loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann C. is 32 years old, separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Sampagar within the municipality of Damulog, a part of Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Mary Ann runs a specialized retail store from which she sells lotions and perfumes from a supplier in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Digna Vicenta

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Digna,  en la actualidad está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos viven con ella, nos cuenta que su vida es muy dura ya que la menor de sus hijos es una niña especial la cual estudia en una escuela para discapacitados, dice que es muy duro pero que Dios sabe por qué le puso esta prueba.

Tiene un puesto de comida en la calle Julio Jaramillo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja de lunes a viernes   desde las 16h00 hasta las 23h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 13h00 hasta las 24h00, en su trabajo le ayuda una de sus hijas. En las mañanas también compra pescado para vender por libras por su sector dice que tiene que ayudarse con lo que sea ya que tiene muchos gastos mas que todo por los estudios de sus hijos ya que los tres que están con ella estudian.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar la mitad en productos para preparar la comida que vende y para comprar pescado ya que esto le deja buenas ganancias. Es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
The partners of the Virgen de Guadalupe community bank meet every two weeks in the Andres De Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, which is known as the city of the true tamarind. This is where we meet Digna who is currently separated but who has 5 children from that relationship, 3 of whom live with her. She tells us that her life is very difficult since her youngest is a special needs child and studies in a school for the disabled. She says that it is very difficult but God knows why He tested her this way. 

She has a food stand on Julio Jaramillo street in Portoviejo. She works Monday through Friday from 4:00pm to Midnight and weekends from 3:00pm to Midnight. Her daughters help her at work. In the mornings she buys fish to sell by the pound in her neighborhood. She says she has to do whatever she can since she has lots of expenses especially related to her children's studies since all three are in school. 

She will use half the loan to buy food for her stand and the other half to buy fish since this is profitable. This is her second loan with the community bank and she likes it because of the favorable repayment terms. She dreams of her children being professionals and of having a good restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and fish

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is 39 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Manuyog, a part of the municipality of Sagay, Camiguin Province on the Mindanao islands. Linda runs a specialized retail store from which she buys and sells dried squid to the local community. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling biscuits, snacks and ice candy. Linda has been engaged in her businesses for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Linda is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her businesses.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda T. is a married woman who lives in Purok 8, Brgy. San Jose, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a piggery. Her husband, Rolly, who is 37 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are aged between 6 and 13 years old.

Criselda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Criselda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000 thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and feed for the piggery, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her piggery. Criselda T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference to the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva Lending Team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Ernesto Eliuth

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 21 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli.
Recibe ayuda economica de un hermano que vive en los Estados Unidos, le gusta mucho la carrera y cree poder tener oportunidades.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 21, is a fourth year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Esteli.

His brother, who lives in the United States, sends him economic help.  He likes his career very much and believes it can offer him opportunities.

He negotiated this loan to invest in supplies for a university project: dairy products production.

He wants to finish his studies, work for a firm for a time and then become independent in his own business.

loans.use: AgroBusiness Student Project: Elaboration of Dairy Products.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 56-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil. He is the father of three children and works in transportation to provide a good living for his family. Abdallah is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, for an urgent situation. He wants to buy an engine for his van, which is his only source of livelihood. Abdallah is honest and loved by his neighbors, friends and relatives. Abdallah hopes to provide the best for his family and seeks expansion in his work.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his van

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida B. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 43 years old. Aida is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Aida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Regina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Regina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui sont originaires de quartiers différents mais qui chaque mois se réunissent au tour des activités du Banc Villageois. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HLM NDIAMBOUR. 

Fatou N. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants et de 02 filles (une de sa sœur et une de sa parente) 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, de parfums, de l'encens, de pâte alimentaire etc. Elle a une bonne expérience pour avoir pratiquer cette activité depuis 2001

Son prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de réaliser plus de revenus financiers

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: The solidarity group SOP MAME DIARRA was founded on December 15, 2008 during the inauguration of its village bank (Banc Villageois).  It counts 17 women who come from different districts, but get together every month to take care Banc Villageois business.  The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of HLM NDIAMBOUR.  Fatou N., first on the right of the photograph, is in charge of the group.  She is 43 years old, married and is the mother of nine of her own children and two other girls (one from her sister and one from another relative).  She has a small business selling fabric, perfumes, incense and pasta, etc.  She has a lot of experience as she has been in business since 2001.  This loan will allow her to further grow her business and increase revenues.  Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family and most certainly to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fabric, perfumes, incense and pastas.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios. Eliana se dedica a la venta ceviche, ella nos cuenta que tiene un puesto de venta de forma ambulatoria al frente del mercado de “Tica Tica” y la pueden encontrar todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 1 de tarde o hasta que se acabe el ceviche. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, pescado, limón y muchas cosas más. Su sueño de la socia es abrir una cevichería.  
 
Eliana pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Eliana lives in the historic city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco, Peru. The people in the city of Cusco work in different types of businesses and in providing services. Eliana works selling ceviche and she tells us that she has a cart in front of the Tica Tica market where she can be found every day from 8am to 1pm, or until there is no more ceviche left. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients like rice, fish, lemon, and many other items. Her dream is to open a ceviche restaurant.

Eliana belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s Hijas de María Communal Bank in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is in its third year of operation and all of the group members are doing well.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like rice, fish, lemon, and many other items

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 45-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  used clothing, Avon & Natasha dealer and a manicure/pedicure/weaving business.  She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. Lilian joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilian has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy items for her used clothing business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and to have her own business area. Lilian is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her business

loans.name: Yendy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Yendy. La socia tiene 22 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de (6 y 6 meses), la socia tiene el apoyo de sus padres y de su conyugue, ella trabaja comprando al por mayor verduras del mercado de Huancaro en la ciudad del Cusco y lo lleva a Puerto Maldonado, ella vende en este departamento y cuando esta no se encuentra en Cusco sus padres le hacen el envió para ella recoger la mercadería y venderlo en Puerto Maldonado. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería (verduras), para enviarlo a Puerto Maldonado.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Yendy is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (a six year old and a six month old). Yendy has the support of her parents and her husband. She buys vegetables in bulk at the Huancaro Market in Cusco and then brings them to Puerto Maldonado to sell. When she is not able to get to Cusco, her parents ship the vegetables so that she can pick them up to sell in Puerto Maldonado. Yendy is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables that she can bring to Puerto Maldonado.

She is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Melita Gonzaga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Melita G. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Melita is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Melita G.’s Group". 

Melita is 47 years old, married and blessed with seven children of whom three are now adults and the other four are school-aged. To make a living, she is presently engaged in “kangkong” (a vegetable like spinach) vending and laundry activity. Her husband is a farmer. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years already. She’s earning an average amount of not less than Php 2,000 a month from these activities. 

In September 2007, Melita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a micro-finance program that reaches out to rural communities, Melita has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php3,000. She is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000 as her 6th loan which will be used for  house repairs and renovation. She joined Paglaum MPC because she is very much interested in the programs and services offered, especially savings and insurance.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to do house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica works hard to support her family. Angelica has a common-law husband and a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Angelica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her sari-sari store.

Angelica has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Angelica would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El señor Oscar esta solicitando nuestra cooperación en el financiamiento de la construcción de un cuarto, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esta mejora, el esta solicitando esta ayuda ya que desea brindarle a su familia comodidad y lo principal privacidad, en la foto que se le tomo para ver donde se realizara dicha mejora aparece su esposa. El Sr. pagara este crédito con una parte de los ingresos que gana como ayudante de ventas, debido a que es el jefe de familia.
texts.en: Oscar is requesting our cooperation with the financing of a room addition for his house, since he does not have the money he needs to complete this project.  He is requesting this help because he wants to provide his family with greater privacy and comfort.  In the photo that was taken he appears with his wife in the place where they will make this improvement.  Oscar will pay back this loan with a part of the income that he earns as a sales assistant, since he is the head of the household.

loans.use: to add a room to their house

loans.name: Leon De Judas Group

texts.es:
El grupo León de Judas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Cristhian María R., Mariana Poso y Rosa T.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora R. de 26 años quien desde hace más de un año vende ropa de paca. 
Ella tiene  dos hijos pequeños por los cuales trabaja arduamente con el propósito de salir adelante. El crédito lo ocupará para comprar pacas de ropa.
Las otras dos integrantes son la señora P. de 47 años comerciante de productos Avon, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo  y la señora Toruño de 28 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group "León de Judas" is made up of three hard working, toiling and enterprising women.  These women are Cristhian María R., Mariana P. and Rosa T..

The group's coordinator is R., 26, who has sold packaged clothing for more than one year.  She has two young children for which she works hard, with the goal of coming out ahead.  She will use the loan to buy packages of clothing.  

P., 47, sells Avon products, a brand that is well known through her catalog sales.

T., 28, sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: buy packages of clothing.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is married with two children. Both of them are very young, not of school-going age yet. 

Asia is a housewife. She stays at home and takes care of the children. She is a very good wife and a very caring mother. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells a variety of seasonal fresh fruits to his customers cheaply. Because his fruits are fresh and good quality, he makes good profits every month. 

Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling to his customers and he will earn a good profit. Her husband has been operating this business for the past eight years and Asia is very confident that an investment will bring more profits to him and expand his business. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first application to Asasah. She is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for her family.

In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Asia.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru: Сайдали проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает необходимые вещи для дома, заколки и бижутерию. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки бижутерий, парфюмерии и новых видов заколок.
texts.en: Saydali lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. He trades in the central market of the city. He rents a shop where he sells household supplies, barrettes, and costume jewelry. He has been doing this work for eight years. He is taking out a loan to buy costume jewelry, perfume, and new kinds of hair accessories.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, perfume, and new kinds of hair accessories

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Girasol está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Emelia de 36 años quien desde hace 17 años tiene una refresquería en mercado de San Judas la cual poco a poco por su ardua labor y los prestamos ha ido creciendo.

Rosa invertirá el crédito en la compra de materia prima para su negocio como son las frutas, el azúcar, los baldes, las bolsas, vasos… etc.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sugey de 29 años y Eva Esther de 50 años quienes se dedican a la venta de cosméticos y con el crédito compraran productos de encargo.
texts.en:
The 'Girasol' (Sunflower) group has three hard-working, determined and entrepreneurial members.  One of them is 36 year-old Rosa Emelia who has owned a soft drinks business in San Judas market for 17 years.  Gradually, through her hard work and loans, she has managed to grow her business.

Rosa will invest her loan in buying supplies for her business such as fruit, sugar, buckets, bags, cups, etc.

The other members of this group are 29 year-old Sugey and 50 year-old Eva Esther who both sell cosmetics and will use their loans to buy products that their customers have ordered.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, buckets, bags, cups, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated his tailor shop in Njabini town for the last two years.  He is 35 years old, married to Hellen, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new sewing machine and more cloth to use for making new clothes.

In future, James hopes to grow his business and open up a bigger clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
A villager who resides in Kompong Speu Province, Mrs. Pok is 57 and the mother of five children; four are single and one is already married. She has two children who can generate some of their income by working in a garment factory as domestic garment workers. 

Mrs. Pok is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for a long time. Her husband also works in the same business. Recently, she has needed more money to repair her broken house, so Mrs. Pok has requested a loan of $600. She will use the rest of loan funds to support her crop-planting business. Mrs. Pok was pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En Ciudad del Este se reúnen 19 mujeres para la formación del comité denominado Mujeres Unidas. Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que luchan por el sustento diario. Se unieron con un fin en común que es la lucha en conjunto por la obtención de mayores beneficios de todas las miembros. Todas son conocidas en el barrio por la excelente labor que realizan.
La Sra. Amalia es manicurista, por medio de su profesión ella ha podido salir adelante, generando mayores ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Ella comenta que tienen ya un grupo de clientas bien definido que siempre la llaman para hacerles algún trabajo. Dice que los fines de semana es cuando tiene mayor trabajo, debido a que en esos días donde la gente va a fiestas y eventos. Sueña con algún día poder tener su propia peluquería.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de esmaltes, corta cutículas u otros insumos que necesite para realizar su trabajo. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le está dando.
texts.en:
In Ciudad del Este, 19 women meet to form the group Mujeres Unidas.  All are heads of their families that fight for daily sustenance.   They come together to fight for a common goal, to obtain greater profits for all the members.  They are all known in their neighborhood for their excellent work.  

Señora Amalia is a manicurist and through this profession she has been able get ahead, generating a higher income to support her household.  She says that she has a group of established customers that always call her to do work for them.  She also says that the weekends are when she has the most work because those are the days when people go to parties and events.  She dreams that some day she will have her own shop.  

She is requesting a loan to buy polish, cuticle scissors and other supplies that she needs to do her job.  She is grateful to Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: purchase polish, cuticle scissors, and other supplies that she needs for her job as a manicurist.

loans.name: Otgonchuluun

texts.en:
Otgonchuluun is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four of his children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His older two sons, age 21 and 23, attend college while the younger four go to a secondary school. 

He manages a leather clothing making business with the help of his wife. With 15 years of business operation he gained much experience. He is a hardworking and delightful man who says, "I have many children. Therefore I need to work hard to better my living condition." He is requesting a 2,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase leather for his business.

loans.use: To purchase leather

loans.name: Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Caacupé se unieron con el propósito D. luchar por un mejor estilo D. vida. D. allí surge el comité denominado Las lomas, todas ellas trabajan D. forma conjunta y solidaria, se encuentran muy felices dentro del programa D. la Fundación. Se definen como mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, con mucha creatividad e ingenio.
La presidenta del comité, la señora Leonarda, vive con su marido e hijos. Manifiesta que ellos siempre la ayudan en su trabajo, que es la venta D. comestibles. Ella comenta que hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esto, por lo cual ya tiene una clientela bien formada, tiene mucha demanda, ya que a los clientes les gusta mucho las comidas que ella prepara.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los ingredientes para los alimentos que ella prepara, como ser carne, hortalizas, condimentos, panes y demás. Está con muchas esperanzas en el crédito, pues le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
19 women in the city of Caacupe decided to join forces to fight for a better standard of living. This has developed into the communal bank called Las Lomas. The women work as a supportive and collaborative team and are very happy to be a part of the Fundación. They see themselves as enterprising and hardworking women with plenty of creativity and ingenuity. 

The president of the communal bank, Leonarda, lives with her husband and children. She says that they help her enormously selling her meals. She says that she has been in this business a long time and so has a loyal client base and is in great demand, as the customers really like the food she prepares. She is asking for a loan in order to buy the ingredients for the meals she prepares, such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, bread and the like. She really hopes to obtain the loan as it will help her substantially

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, bread and the like in order to make meals

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es: Waldo  es un hombre de 42 años casado y padre de un niño de 7 años, con quienes vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia muy cerca al mar. Allí tiene en su propia casa  un estadero en el cual vende cervezas, jugos y refrescos en general. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, que se acercan a la terraza de Waldo para conversar, jugar dominó mientras degustan las frías cervezas o refrescos en un clima cálido que así lo amerita. Como su clientela ha aumentado tiene un gran desafío,  que es el de tener suficientemente surtido su enfriador para complacerlos y su creciente clientela hace que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente para lograrlo; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor, e irse convirtiendo poco a poco en un distribuidor de negocios a su alrededor de la playa, para que cuando estos se queden sin refrescos por efectos del consumo masivo que hay en este puerto los fines de semana, él pueda ayudarle a superar sus necesidades. Su meta más adelante es remodelar la terraza de su casa, para hacer más agradable su negocio y seguir disfrutando de la buena conversación con sus clientes mientras genera los ingresos suficientes para su hogar. Mientras esto ocurre se esfuerza en su negocio, manejando un margen de utilidad no inferior del 40% y una rotación de inventario de 6 días, desde la cual partimos para augurarle un potencial crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Waldo is a 42-year-old married man and the father of a 7-year-old son living together in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean.  He has a snack bar at his house where he sells beer, juice and beverages in general.  His main customers are his neighbors, relatives and friends who come by Waldo’s terrace to chat and play dominoes while they enjoy cold beers or beverages in the hot climate that encourages this.  

Since his clientele has increased, Waldo has quite a challenge which is to have enough cold merchandise available to please them and his growing clientele leads to his working capital being insufficient to do so.  This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy beer and soft-drinks at wholesale so that he can gradually become a distributor to businesses at the beach near him so that when they run out of beverages due to the heavy consumption that takes place in this port on weekends, he will be able to help them meet their needs.

His goal for later on is to remodel the terrace to make his business more pleasant and continue to enjoy pleasant conversations with his customers while generating enough income for his home.  While this occurs he works hard at his business maintaining a profit margin of no less than 40% and an inventory turnover rate of six days which we use as the basis to predict potential business growth for him.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: El señor Celso, es rentista jubilado de una institución pública. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillo) ya que realizara la refacción de su vivienda. Vive en casa de propia, ubicada en la zona de Los Andes en la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene 1 hijo . Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito y desea que se canalize a través de los financiadotes de Kiva.
texts.en:
Celso is a retired pensioner from a public institution.  He needs the loan to buy construction material (cement, sand, bricks) to fix up his house.

He lives in his own house in the Los Andes zone in the city of El Alto.  He is married and has one child.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan, and he wishes for his loan to be channeled through Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction material in order to fix up his house.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
This is Cesar, 52, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Fe, a church worker and the mother of their only child, who is now studying in high school. Cesar, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cesar manages a drafting services business. He offers drafting and other school art project services to students and other customers who need his service. He earns by charging the students a fee for every project that he is doing. He earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the services he provides every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy drafting materials and other school supply items that he uses in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Cesar hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a permanent place for his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. Here he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional drafting and school supply items he needs in his business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 36 años, es soltero, pero tiene una hija. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Él se dedica a la extracción de madera desde hace ya seis años, y aún continua trabajando con mucho esmero, pues su único fin es obtener un ingreso económico para darle una mejor alimentación, educación a su querida hija. Es así que su faena laboral empieza desde muy temprano en la madrugada, para enrumbarse selva adentro caminando tres a cuatro días para encontrar los arboles que le proporcionen buena madera. Convirtiémdose en proveedores los mismo carpinteros que necesitan de ésta materia prima. Entre las pricipales maderas que extrae es la caoba, tornillo, cedro, quinchao, diablo fuerte, aceite de maría, moina, entre otros. Él se siente satisfecho con éste trabajo, pues le genera las ganancias que necesita, sin embargo sabe que es pesado transportarlo durante varios días, y eso lo agota mucho. Por tanto espera ahorrar un montar un nuevo negocio que no implique desgaste físico. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con  los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará una nueva motosierra.
texts.en: Francisco is 36 years old, single but with a daughter. They live together in their own house located in the district of Pichari. He has been a logger for the last 6 years and still continues to work in this field with a lot of care as his sole purpose is to obtain an income to provide his beloved daughter with better nutrition and education. Thus his working day begins very early in the morning, walking into the jungle for 3 or 4 days to find trees that provide good wood. Thus the very carpenters who need this raw material become the suppliers. The main types of wood that he extracts are mahogany, tornillo (screw), cedar, quinchao, diablo fuerte (strong devil), aceite de maria (oil boiler), moina and others. He feels  satisfied with this work as it generates the money he needs, however, he knows that it is heavy work transporting the wood for several days and it takes it out of him. Therefore he hopes to save enough to set up a new business that doesn't exhaust him physically. This will be his first loan with MFP and he agrees to make the repayments punctually. With the 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) he is going to buy a chainsaw.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es:
Hipólita es socia del Banco Comunal Suni, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, es separada, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 10 años. 
Hipólita es feriante, vende golosinas, queso y carne en las ferias, y antes solo vendía golosina, no tiene mucho capital porque su mayor prioridad es la educación de sus hijos. A Hipólita le encantan las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a poder ser mejor madre y tener mas ganas de trabajar, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ganados y queso.
texts.en: Hipólita is a member of the “Suni” communal bank.  She’s 39 years old, separated and has been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years.  Hipólita is a vendor in the market.  He sells snacks, cheese and meat in the markets.  She used to only sell snacks.  She does not have much capital because her main priority is her children’s education.  Hipólita loves the training because they help her be a better mother and to want to work more.  She will use this loan to buy cattle and cheese.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cheese.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  50  años de edad, es conviviente y tiene diez hijos, 4 de ellos independientes.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de once años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales, venta de combustible y venta de abarrotes.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará un cilindro de combustible (petróleo y gasolina).  Su esposo trabaja en el sector de educación.

La señora desea tener un carro cisterna para traer combustible, lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la orientación respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Eva, 50, is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank in Juli, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is partnered and has ten children, 4 of whom are grown.

Eva has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than eleven years.  She used her first loan, for S/.300.00 new soles, to support her retail business.  She sells all kinds of merchandise: traditional crafts, cylinders of oil and gas for cooking and heating, and groceries.  

Eva is applying for a S/.1500 new soles loan that she will use to buy cylinders of oil and gas for cooking and heating.  Her husband works in education.

Eva would like to buy a vehicle for transporting oil and gas cylinders.  What she most likes about the community bank is its focus on helping businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her retail business.

loans.name: Maboe Nande Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Maboe Nande” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu. Kadiata was born in Northern Sierra Leone 35 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a salaried worker and her children are attending primary and secondary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for ten years, she sells dishes, plastic bowls, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 39, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Cornelio, a tailor, and she is a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Imelda operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home furnishings. Seasonal clothing, like uniforms, is available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, Imelda operates a small variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Imelda hopes her business grows, and she dreams that she will be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members. With her fellowship group she can share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido nació en la ciudad de Maras y vive en la comunidad  de Paucarbamba, él tiene 38 años de edad y no tiene hijos por el momento.

Guido desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, él se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Guido requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales como toros y vacas. 

Guido se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Guido pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Guido was born in city of Maras and lives in the Paucarbamba community.  He’s 38 years old and doesn’t have any children yet.

He works in Paucarbamba, where he raises livestock and farms.  He’s been doing this for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Guido needs this loan to buy more animals such as bulls and cows.
 
He is grateful for the opportunity given him through this medium and is committed to making his payments on time.  Guido is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 25-year-old married woman with no child. She's had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Ruth es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas algunas y modernas construcciones otras que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional, no desentonan del todo y más bien le dan variedad al paisaje, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
Doña Ruth tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora conduciendo maquinaria pesada, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Ruth se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para vehículos y filtros, negocio en el que se encuentra hace un año y medio y trabaja de lunes a sábados todo el día. También cría cerdos y cuyes. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de lubricantes para vehículos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es  agrandar su local y vender repuestos para vehículos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Amistad". She lives in the Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place known for its large cattle ranches, romantic old haciendas and other modern buildings that, while not keeping with traditional architecture, are not out of place and even add variety to the landscape. The people here are kind, polite and traditional and maintain their parents' culture.

Doña Ruth is 29, married and has a common-law husband and two children, ages 9 and 2.  Her eldest is in school in the city.  Her husband works as a heavy machinery driver.  They live in their own home.

Mrs. Ruth sells vehicle lubricants and filters and has been in business for a year and a half.  She works Monday through Saturday all day.  She also raises pigs and guinea pigs.

Through the communal bank she is requesting her second loan which she plans to use to buy vehicle lubricants so she can continue business.

Her goal is to expand her location and sell vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy vehicle lubricants.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa familiar, el se dedica hace tres años a la venta de mariscos como: pescado, camarones, punches, curiles, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres no tiene un horario establecido traslada su mercadería en una bicicleta para sus clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería como: pescado y camarones, que es lo que más se vende y de esa forma podrá aumentar las ganancias y serán mejores para el beneficio de su familia.
El sueño de Carlos es fortalecer su negocio seguir trabajando con nuestra institución y de esa forma lograra mejores ingresos y ayudara mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and children in the family home. For three years he has sold seafood such as: fish, shrimp, punch fish and curil. He learned the trade from his parents. He has no set schedule and transports his merchandise to his customers by bicycle.

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as: fish and shrimp, which is what sells the most. In this way, he can increase his earnings and they will improve for his family's benefits.

Carlos' dream is to fortify his business and continue working with our institution, thus earning more income and better helping his family.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: La Trinité Group

texts.fr: LA TRINITÉ est un groupe composé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bertina Aurelia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bertina Aurelia est âgée de 44 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Bertina Aurelia est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Jules. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Bertina Aurelia et son mari. Pour cette raison, Bertina Aurelia vend des sachets et des boîtes de conserves par la méthode de distribution depuis une vingtaine d'année ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Bertina Aurelia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bertina Aurelia sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe LA TRINITÉ, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sachets et des boîtes de conserves.

loans.name: Njuru

texts.en:
Simon is a sixty six years old man, married and a father of six children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
He does dairy farming to earn a living. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to reconstruct his cow shed and buy dairy feeds. He hopes this will increase his milk production thus increasing his income. He will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To reconstruct his cow shed and buy dairy feeds hence increased income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy 3 extra steer

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès L. is married and the mother of three children. She sells beauty products in her own store, and has been involved with her business for the past 12 years. Mrs. L. believes that by increasing her working capital, she will be able to make more profit and provide for the needs of her children. With a loan of $200, she can add more beauty products such as hair-cream (pomade), hair clips, soap and perfume to her product line. With increased profits, Mrs. L. will be able to buy the products she will need if one of her children falls ill, in the tough conditions her family has seen. Her family has endured hard socio-economic conditions.

Mrs. L. represents a HELP Africa solidarity group called "Hope", which has collectively applied for a loan of $600. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

loans.use: Increase business activities

loans.name: Adedara

texts.en: Mrs. Adedara V. is a cook. She is happily married with five (5) children; she is from the semi-urban area of Jattu, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes to get the above amount to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Pasesa

texts.es:
Pasesa is married with three children. She produces cheeses, an art she learned from her mother who owns and raises 6 cattle. The cattle produce an average of 6 cheeses per day, four days a week. In charge of her own products, Pasesa goes door-to-door to her nieghbors of Ciudadela Ferroviaria, Chijini, and some zones of the city of El Alto. She asks for a loan to be able to install a stand dedicated to the sale of milk and its by-products in the city of El Alto. This would allow her to help her husband in providing for the household and the education of their children, as well as giving her own mother the life she deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada con un ayudante de albañil y madre de tres hijos, la señora Pasesa Gutiérrez Calle, se dedica a la elaboración de quesos; arte que aprendió de su madre, la que es propietaria de 6 crías de ganado vacuno, con los que producen un promedio de 6 quesos diarios, cuatro días a la semana. Cargada de sus productos, Pasesa, recorre a pie y puerta a puerta las casas de los vecinos de la Ciudadela Ferroviaria, Chijini, y algunas zonas de la ciudad de El Alto. A la fecha ella necesita de dinero para poder instalar una tienda dedicada a la venta de lácteos y sus derivados en la ciudad de El Alto, de esta forma colaborar a su marido para el sustento de su casa y la educación de sus niños y darle a su madre la vejez que ella merece.

loans.use: To invest in the installment of a stand dedicated to the sale of milk and its by-products

loans.name: Khiem

texts.en:
Khiem and his family live in Lập Phuớc hamlet, in the Tân Lập commune of Hàm Thuận Nam district.

Khiem works as a motorbike driver and his wife purchases wasted materials to sell. They plant some vegetables and raise several chickens to eat. Their daughter is in the 7th grade class.

Their average income is $12.50 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow so that they can save funds for their children’s schooling. They plan to pay back the loan during the course of seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Nga was married in 1986 and has 3 children, two sons and one daughter. She is in the business of planting and selling tomatoes and cucumbers since 1994. She continues the farming business of her parents. Her husband is also in business with her. Their three children are living under their custody. However, only their oldest son continues his study in the faculty in Phnom Penh. Their other two sons are assisting the family to plant tomatoes and cucumbers.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times before. Now she is asking a loan of $200. She will use this loan to expand her farming business in planting and selling tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: Expanding in planting and selling tomatoes and cucumbers

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en: Sikola is one of the oldest members of South Pacific Business Development and this is her first loan. Her two sons and husband are helping her operate her fishing business. She goes to the market three days a week and manages to bring around $400 WST ($160 USD) home during that time. The fishing is done six days a week, depending on the weather, and they prefer fishing at night because they catch more than in the daytime. She is very happy about running and sustaining her fishing business and she is always looking for more opportunities and markets for her products.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets, hooks, and a new fishing boat

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa's husband is a plumber, a trade with inconsistent demand. Consequently he has been out of money during long periods of time on various occasions. It is for this reason that Felipa decided t start her own business to help her husband with household expenses. In 2004, a friend of hers invited her to sell cosmetics by catalogue and at this point started her business. Thanks to all her acquaintances and family members, she sold all her initial products. Her clients were so pleased, they started to recommend her among their respective friends. Today, Felipa has a much larger clientele.

Nonetheless, Felipa wishes to expand and strengthen her business. For this reason, Felipa is requesting a loan of $475 which she is willing to pay back over the course of 5 months. With this money, she will buy products to be able to offer something new to her clients. With your help, she will be able to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Felipa es plomero y este oficio no es muy constante, es por eso que en varias ocasiones se queda una larga temporada sin dinero. Es por eso que Felipa decidió comenzar su propio negocio para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del Hogar. En el 2004 una amiga de ella la invitó a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Fue ahí donde comenzó en este negocio. Gracias a los conocidos que tiene y sus familiares vendió sus primeros productos. Y tal fue el agrado de estos clientes, que comenzaron a recomendarla entre sus demás amistades. Actualmente Felipa ya cuenta con un mayor grupo de clientela.

Sin embargo Felipa desea crecer y que su negocio se consolide. Es por eso que Felipa está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Felipa podrá comprar sus productos para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. There, he has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Kayidish village. This village was built for IDPs.

Etibar has run this business for five years now. This man is married and also has two children. Now, he needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Gloria and Norma have been members of the Obreras Communal Bank for 10 years. From their membership with the bank, they learned to support their fellow man, to be disciplined and to save.

Gloria is 45 years of age, divorced and has one daughter. She sells Unión products like baked goods and desserts, products she sells through credit to workers from different institutions. Gloria also sells cosmetics through catalog.

Norma on the other hand is 45 years of age, married and has 5 children. She sells candies as a peddler in one of the central streets of the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, Norma works at an institution doing general cleaning.

Gloria and Norma need loans of 1200 and 600 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of baked goods, plantain snacks, loaves of bread, perfumes, jewelry, cookies, sodas and chewing gum.

Gloria’s and Norma’s dream is that their children become professionals, their businesses prosper, their financial situation is stabilized and that they are able to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria y Norma son socias del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 10 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a apoyar al prójimo, ser disciplinadas y a ahorrar.

Gloria es divorciada, tiene 45 años y 1 hija, Gloria vende productos Unión, como panes, postres, productos que vende al crédito a los trabajadores de distintas instituciones. Además Gloria vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Norma es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Norma vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Norma trabaja en una institución haciendo limpieza.

Gloria y Norma necesitan préstamos de 1200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes, piononos, pan molde, perfumes, joyas, galletas, gaseosas y chicles.

Los sueños de Gloria y Norma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea prospero, tener estabilidad económica y mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Gloria and Norma will purchase baked goods, plantain snacks, loaves of bread, perfumes, jewelry, cookies, sodas and chewing gum.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum S. is widow with four children; one son and three daughters. Two of her children married and live in the family house while the other two children are in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sum has been a silk weaver since she was young. She picked up this skill from her parents. She sells her finished product to the middle man in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel started his business due to a lack of education, since he studied only up to middle school and only found contract work with very low pay. He started 5 years ago, when his closest relatives (since he is an orphan) suggested that he sell cheeses, and little by little he built his customer base. He started with neighbors and relatives, selling door to door. Currently, he has an established customer base and has been doing very well.

He is requesting a loan for US $675, which he will repay in 6 months, to expand his business and stock with more cheese to increase his income and extend his sales territory toward other parts of the city. With your support, José will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

José Ángel inició el negocio por la falta de estudios, ya que solo estudio hasta la secundaria y solo conseguía trabajos eventuales poco remunerados. Comenzó hace 5 años, sus familiares cercanos, ya que es huerfano de padre y madre, le recomendaron que vendiera quesos y poco a poco fue haciendo clientela, empezó con los vecinos y familiares, ya que las ventas las efectúa casa por casa, cambaceo. Actualmente ha hecho una buena cartera de clientes y le va muy bien.

Solicita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio y surtir más quesos e incrementar sus ingresos, ampliando las rutas de venta hacia otros sectores de la ciudad. Con tu apoyo José podrá seguir progresando.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to stock his cheese business.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Kodjo A. A. was born on December 31, 1981 in Lomé. He is a married father with two children. He has been selling timber since 2004. In fact his business entails buying timber from the interior of the country and delivering it to sawmills in Lomé. According to Monsieur A. A. it’s a fairly lucrative business providing one has potential customers.

This is Monsieur A. A.’s first loan and he is asking for 300,000 FCFA ($725) to purchase 12 teak planks and 11 white wood planks to better serve his customers and make a profit in return.

Translated from French by Alisn Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. A. Kodjo est né le 31 décembre 1981 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Depuis 2004, il exerce le commerce de planches. En fait son activité consiste à acheter des planches de l’intérieur du pays et de faire leur livraison dans les usines de scierie de Lomé. Selon Monsieur A. A. Kodjo c’est une activité qui rapporte assez de revenu pourvu qu’on dispose des clients potentiels.

Monsieur A. A. Kodjo est à son premier cycle de crédit et sollicite 300000 FCFA pour acheter 12 planches de tecks et 11 planches de bois blancs pour pouvoir bien servir ses clients et tirer en retour un bénéfice.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Cúc is 47 years old. She joined the Fund in 2003, asking for a loan to invest into her fruit shop at the market. Every day, she buys fruit from large retailers and resells them to the locals. Over 5 years, the funds for her fruit shop allowed her to expand the business. As of today, her family’s income from the fruit business amount to around 2.500.000đ per month. In order to improve further the family’s income, her husband regularly works as a general labourer for a regular income of 1.500.000đ per month. Thus her family’s conditions are very stable and they were able to raise 2 kids. She also managed to build a spacious storey house and buy a set of valuable appliances. For the next loan, she would like to borrow 9.000.000 đ in order to invest further in the fruit business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Cúc năm nay 47 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị xin vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng hoa quả ở chợ. Hàng ngày chị đi mua hoa quả từ các đại lý về bán cho bà con địa phương. Qua 5 năm sử dụng vốn cửa hàng hoa quả của chị đã ngày càng được đầu tư, mở rộng. Đến nay thu nhập của gia đình từ công việc kinh doanh hoa quả đạt khoảng 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chồng chị thường đi làm thuê cho thu nhập ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng, do vậy kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại rất ổn định, anh chị đã nuôi được 2 con khôn lớn. Ngoài ra gia đình chị đã xây được căn nhà khang trang và mua sắm thêm một số đồ dùng có giá trị.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư thêm vốn kinh doanh hoa quả.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a married woman from the town of Tesanj. Her husband is currently employed, while she works as a cashier for a betting house--a place where people can put bets on sports, races, and other competitions.

To supplement her income, Melisa has been working a side job selling cosmetics. She is able to order a large batch from a wholesale retailer and resell to people in her town, and can earn an extra 300 KM a month through this job.

Melisa is taking this, her second loan out in the amount of 1000 KM, which she will use to buy more cosmetics. It is Melisa's wish to earn enough to meet their household expenses, and also start to save some money. It is her dream to next year take some time off and have a vacation, something she has not been able to do for a long time.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mr Phum L. was born in 1959 and he now lives in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. In plantation, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the rice field. In addition, he would like to purchase more rice seeds and fertilizers for cultivating. His wife, Mrs Dong Vy, owns a small grocery store in the local village.

Mr Phum L. has seven children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The others are attending school. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow the rice field and to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es:
La  Señora  Coralia Sunjù  empezó su negocio de la tienda hace 18 años,  que poco a poco ha ido agrandando, ella desea obtener el crédito ya que quiere aprovechar que viene una buena temporada, quiere surtir con mas productos su tienda, como azúcar,  arroz, fideos, etc. y también comprar regalos para diferente ocasiones que los mismos clientes le piden, ella quiere tener disponible mercadería y esto le ayudará en gran manera a incrementar su negocio y que la gente la busque porque tiene lo que ellos necesitan.   Ella tiene 3 hijos dos de ellas trabajan y le ayudan,
Siempre ha trabajado duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos tiene un pequeño negocio vendiendo chuchitos y café en el parque local de San Raymundo, donde ella vive.
texts.en:
Ms. Coralia S. started her store business 18 years ago and, little by little, has expanded it. She would like to obtain a loan, since she wants to take advantage of the good season ahead. She wants to stock her store with more products, such as sugar, rice, noodles, etc. and also to buy gifts for different occasions, which her clients ask for. She wants to have the products available and this will help her in a big way to grow her business and people will seek her out because she has what they need. She has three children, two of which work and help her. She has always worked hard to get her children ahead. She has a small business selling chuchitos (a local tamale-like snack) and coffee in the local park in San Raymundo where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her store

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Señor Martin S. de 37 años de edad esta felizmente casado hace 10 años con la señora Cristina Benítez de 28 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, el primero está en el segundo grado y el otro en el primer grado.nEl señor Martin se dedica a está actividad desde que tenía 20 años , siendo soltero, luego se casó formando su propio hogar y continuo en el mismo ramo, ademas incursiono tambien a la venta de pescado. Cabe mencionar que el señor dispone de una moto en la cual diariamente sale para ofrecer sus mercaderias cubriendo la zona aledañas a la ciudad.nEl cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, pantalones, ropa interior, sulfa carbón, 25 tetra , apirón, lascamicetina, dolanet, todos medicamentos de venta libre. De esta forma aumentar su stock de mercaderias y asi ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad  de productos a  sus clientes.nnnnnnnnnn
texts.en:
Martin S. is 37 years old and has been happily married for 10 years to Cristina Benítez, 28. The couple have two children, ages 8 and 6. The eldest is in second grade and the youngest in first. Martin has made a living in commerce since he was 20 years old and single, and continued after he got married and started his own household. He has also added fish to his business. It's worth mentioning that Martin has a motorcycle, which he uses daily to offer his merchandise to the surrounding areas of his city. He is requesting the loan to purchase T-shirts, pants, underwear, and various over-the-counter medicines to increase his inventory and offer a wider selection and high-quality products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase T-shirts, jeans, underwear and various over-the-counter medicines.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. L.  lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province She is 50 years old and has 4 children and 2 of them are grown - up. Her husband is a  security guard and her sons are workers. She is a member of TYM since 1999. .Now, her main income are raising cows, growing of rice and husband's salary. For the next L. cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million to buy cows for raising
texts.en:
Mrs. L. lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province. She is 50 years old and has 4 children and 2 of them are grown-up. Her husband is a security guard and her sons are workers. She has been a member of TYM since 1999. Now, her main income is from raising cows, growing rice and her husband's salary. For the next L. cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million VND to buy cows for raising. (original text was in English; minor corrections made to grammar)

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows for raising.

loans.name: Shamshad Akhtar Saleem Safdar Group

texts.en:
Shamshad akhtar baji is 43 years old, and she resides in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has lived for the past 6 years. She completed her education through the 6th standard, and she was married when she was just 17 years old. Moreover, she is the mother of four children (two sons and two daughters), all of whom are currently enrolled in a local school. Shamshad baji’s husband, S. S., is a painter by profession; specifically, he takes orders from his clients, and he then paints their houses.

Meanwhile, Shamshad baji has a clothing sales business. In particular, she buys clothes from the famous city of Multan, and she later sells such clothes in her own city for a profit. She notes that she has 6 years of experience in this business, and that she does this work to pay for her children’s education (i.e., she saves her income in order to cover her children's school fees). Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is the group leader of three other members of her community: (1) Azhar batool baji wants a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads and sketches) for her carpet-making business; (2) G. khatoon baji seeks a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business; and (3) Fatima bilal baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Importantly, this is a group loan: as such, the loan proceeds are distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business; at the same time, the members mutually guarantee one another's loans (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears).

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothes for resale purposes

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila M. lives with her husband and two sons in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Her older son is studying in grade 4 and younger son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Saroj M., make different types of traditional brass religious figures, as per the demands of their customers. With her first loan from Kiva, she bought wax, metal, and other materials needed to mold and finish her idols. Now she is requesting a second loan from Kiva of Rs 15000.00 to buy necessary raw material for her statues. She plans to continue making the statues and improving her efficiency over the time.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 37 años de edad, y una hija la cual es su razón de vivir, vive hace 17 años con su pareja y actualmente está viviendo en una casa alquilada. Tras la desgracia del huayco (salida del río, causando derrumbe de cerros) que sufrió en el año 2007, Vilma interrumpió su trabajo, ya que sus prendas y demás mercadería fueron afectadas, arruinando sus ventas, hace dos años comenzó de cero su negocio y fue sobreponiéndose poco a poco, alquilando un local, desde entonces viaja a Lima a traer mercadería cada 15 días. Además, también es instructora de aeróbicos, cobrando por semana 40 soles; su esposo también  trabaja en la venta de ropa, pero él lleva la mercadería a otros lugares fuera de la ciudad. Cuando necesitan hacer una inversión juntan sus ganancias por semana que son de 500 a 800 soles, para poder afrontar el alquiler del local y los gastos de educación para su hija que quiere estudiar diseño de modas. Vilma esta muy contenta con sus dos actividades, las cuales la llenan de esperanzas en el futuro, y está pensando construir su casa. Vilma es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, es la tesorera, cargo que cumple con mucha responsabilidad, brindándole su apoyo a la asesora de crédito. Ella está muy contenta de pertenecer a este banco comunal, siendo este su 5to préstamo con MFP y pagando puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su capital, con la adquisición de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and has one daughter, who is her reason for living. She has lived with her husband for the past 17 years, and they currently live in a rented house. The flashflood of 2007, during which the river overflowed, causing a landslide, suspended Vilma's work, as her clothing and other merchandise were affected, ruining her sales. She started her business from scratch two years ago, and has been building it up little by little, renting a storefront and travelling to Lima every 15 days to buy merchandise. In addition she works as an aerobics instructor, earning 40 soles per week. Her husband also works selling clothes, but he takes his merchandise to other places outside of the city.
