When they need to make an investment they combine their weekly earnings of between 500 and 800 soles. This allows them to pay the rent on the storefront and the education expenses for their daughter, who wants to study fashion design. Vilma is very happy with her two jobs, which fill her with hope for the future, and she is thinking of building her own home. Vilma is a very active member of her community bank. She is the treasurer, a position which comes with a lot of responsibility. She is very happy belonging to this community bank, with this being her fifth loan with MFP, and having made all of her repayments on time. The loan will be used to build up her capital, through purchasing clothing merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is a 32 year old mother of four children. She is raising the children with her husband who works for an NGO. She runs a fish stall and her customers typically purchase meals during lunch or after work. She wants to purchase some utensils she can use for cooking. With her profit, she will buy clothing for her children. She wants Kiva lenders to know that she loves her children.

loans.use: To purchase utensils for cooking

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unite) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi de l’association Kotognontala est un regroupement de sept femmes du  deuxième quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6  enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités,  vente en gros de condiments, pâtes alimentaires, chaussures, céréales et habillements..
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125 000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt du groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz, de l’ail, des gros oignons de Niono, des cartons de macaroni provenant du Ghana, de Dakar et  divers autres produits  venant d’Abidjan (la capitale ivoirienne) et de Bamako ( la capitale du Mali). Ces  femmes vendent leurs produits exclusivement au grand marché de koutiala.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 130 000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours de ce cycle.. En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles comptent utiliser une partie de leurs revenus  pour payer la scolarité des enfants et faire face aux maladies. Dans les jours à venir elles comptent  diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités telle l’ouverture d’un magasin de vente des produits divers.
texts.en:
Benkadi of the association Kotognontala is a group of seven women of the 2nd district of the city of Koutiala who know one another well. They are married mothers who average 38 years of age and have at least 6 children each. They do different work, selling condiments, pasta, shoes, grains, and clothing at the wholesale level.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. The loan amount has gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 125,000 francs for the fourth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice, some garlic, big onions from Niono, boxes of macaroni from Ghana and Dakar, and various other goods from Abidjan (capital of Cote d'Ivoire) and from Bamako (capital of Mali). These women sell their goods exclusively at the grand marketplace of Koutiala.

With this new loan, the women intend to realize an average of 130,00 francs of profit in the course of this cycle. Besides repaying loans, they intend to use part of their revenues for covering the children's school costs and for coping with illnesses. In the years to come, they plan to diversify their commerce by embracing other businesses, such as opening a store for selling various good.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29 year old Veronika K. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 5 and 9 years old. Veronika has been running a grains business since 2004. Veronika sells rice, maize and wheat flour. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Veronika currently earns about 220USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she plans to open another business. Veronika thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 57 años y está casado con Prisciliana que tiene 54 años de edad. De la unión de ambos han nacido 5 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, solamente 2 siguen viviendo con el matrimonio mientras que los demás ya han formado su propio hogar.

Ricardo es un sacrificado hombre que se dedica a la venta de carbón desde hace 10 años atrás. Su esposa le ayuda aportando dinero para los gastos del hogar con lo que recauda de sus ventas en un puesto que tiene en el mercado municipal de la ciudad.

Ricardo comenta que compra el carbón en bolsas y luego él mismo se ocupa de empaquetarlos en pequeñas bolsitas para su posterior venta. Cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada a quien sale a vender todos los días en un camión de su propiedad.  También vende leñas que son utilizadas frecuentemente por las amas de casa para abaratar costos a la hora de cocinar los alimentos y también a pequeños panaderos de la zona.

Todos los días sale a vender, no importa que haga frío, calor o sea un día de mucha lluvia, lo importante para él es cumplir con su clientela.  En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de más carbón debido a que tiene una oferta que quiere aprovechar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 57 years old and is married to Prisciliana who is 54 years old. From their marriage they have five children, all adults now, with just two still living with the couple while the others have formed their own homes. Ricardo is an industrious man who has worked selling charcoal for the last ten years. His wife helps him with the household expenses by contributing money which she earns from her sales in a stall she has in the city market. Ricardo says that he sells the charcoal in bags and that he himself is in charge of packing the charcoal in small bags for later sale. He has well established clients who he visits every day to sell, in his own truck. He also sells firewood that is frequently used by home makers to reduce costs when it comes to cooking meals, and also by small bakeries in the area. Every day he goes out to sell. It does not matter if the weather is cold, hot, or if it is a very rainy day. The important thing for him is to serve his clients. At this time he is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal since he has an offer he would like to take advantage of.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Melba Mercedes

texts.es: Melba Mercedes R. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Melba tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Melba es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Melba inicio este negocio por su Mama, y con el tiempo fue que el negocio le gusto este tipo de negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Melba son de mejorar cada día la calidad de sus comidas para obtener una variedad de clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo y cuajada todo esto es para materia prima por lo que tiene que elaborar la comida. El deseo de Doña Melba es tener su negocio de una manera mas estable y la mismo tiempo ayudar a generar fuentes de trabajo ya que necesitaría de un personal que le ayude a elaborar  la  comida.
texts.en:
Melba Mercedes R. is 45 years old and she is married. Melba has two children and they are both studying. Melba's economic activity is the making and selling of food. For more than 14 years, she has been involved in this business: she started this business for her Mother, as it was the type of business that she liked. The aims of Melba are to improve the quality of her meals every day in order to attract a variety of customers. The financing is to add to her work capital for buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, egg and curd as raw ingredients from which she makes her dishes. Melba's wish is to make sure her business is more stable and at the same time to help generate a source of employment as she needs an assistant to help with making the food.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Aslam Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji's husband, M. A., is a delivery man by profession and delivers different items, like fruits and vegetables, from one place to another. He delivers the items on his donkey cart. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because her husband’s old cart is rough and rotted in different areas. Shamim baji also runs an embroidery business. She takes orders from her neighbors and charges them $3 per dress. She uses her income as needed. She has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy items like chairs, mirrors and scissors for her barber shop. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa S. sells meat. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies other retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Adwoa has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk.

Adwoa is 56 years old, married and has five children: two sons and three daughters who are currently out of school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Наим Сангинов по профессии плотник. Этому мастерству он научился  у своего отца, еще в свои школьные годы. Сейчас он передает этот опыт своему сыну Чамшеду. Они вместе работают в мастерской, которая находится  рядом с домом.
Но основной источник дохода их семьи, это животноводство. Наим имеет 15 летний стаж в сфере животноводства. Наим покупает коров и овец, откармливает их и осенью продает, получая от этого хороший доход. Его жена Гавхар, вместе с дочерями Шоирой и Шоистой помогают Наиму в откорме скота.
Получив кредит в первый раз, он увеличил свой скот и поднялся на ступень высше. Теперь он планирует еще раз получить кредит и использовать его для откорма скота. Ведь в конце сентября предстоит празднование священного праздника Рамазан. Многие семья приносят в жертву овец и коров и раздают мясо малоимущим семьям и сиротам. Поэтому Наим хочет откормить свой скот до осени.
texts.en:
Naim S. is a carpenter by profession. He learned his trade from his father during his school years. Now he is passing on his experience to his own son, Jamshed. Together, they work in his studio, which is next to their house. However, the main income source for their household is from animal husbandry. Naim has 15 years of experience buying cows and sheep, fattening them up and selling them in the autumn, from which he makes a good income. His wife, Gavhar, together with their daughters Shoira and Shoista help Naim with feeding the cattle. The first time he took out a loan, he bought more cattle and operated on a much larger scale. Now he plans to take out another loan and to use it to feed the cattle. As in late September, he wishes to prepare for the celebration of the holy festival of Ramadan in which many families sacrifice cattle and give the meat to poor families and orphans. For this reason, Naim wishes to feed his cattle before the autumn.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for cattle feed

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie hails from the busy town of Cardona in the Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 29 years old and married to a construction worker. She has three children to take good care of. She is young and full of the energy needed to run a business.

With her desire to start a business, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. With her first loan, she started a business making doormats. The business is going well.

Now she is about to receive her second loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will buy 20 kilos of assorted cloth, scissors and cover transportation expenses for doormat making.

Margie hopes to make her business grow. She also dreams of sending her children to college and wants to buy a house and lot of her own.

loans.use: Buy cloth, scissors to weave doormats.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-year-old married man with 3 children. He has been working in the tile sector since 1990. Today, Ali is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new specific machine for his work so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy a new specific machine

loans.name: Marjorem

texts.en:
Marjorem B.'s main source of income comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. Marjorem has been in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marjorem joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marjorem has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Marjorem is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 49 year married with five children aged between 13 and 25 years.Three of her children go to school.  Sarah resides and owns a five roomed house where she staying with eight people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Sarah takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 15 customers a day.  Sarah sells charcoal in Katanga and besides the charcoal stall she also practices outside catering.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and rising food prices.  Sarah has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and stock enough food stuffs which are not perishable..  Sarah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owing a permanent business structure as of now works from an open place.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and other food stuffs

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal wholesale at her store and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Roda is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building another store for selling charcoal. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Los Gutiérrez Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo los G. son del valle de la laguna que se encuentra localizado  a las orillas de la laguna de Apoyo. La principal actividad de la zona es la pesca.

José Antonio L. L. de 31 años tiene un taxi desde hace cuatro años en el cual invertirá el préstamo y su meta es lograr comprar otro taxi. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana Maritza G. R. quien vende frutas, pan y pinolillo en Granada y Elsa del Carmen G. R., ella vende frutas en Granada.
texts.en:
The Los G. group members are all from Valle de la Laguna which is located on the shores of Lake Apoyo. The main activity in the area is fishing. José Antonio, 31, has had a taxi for the past 4 years in which he will invest the loan. He hopes someday to be able to buy another taxi. The other members of the group are Juana Maritza, who sells fruits, bread and pinolillo (a drink made from toasted corn and a little cocoa) in Granada and Elsa is a fruit vendor in Granada.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gasoline and replacement parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 47-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Yasser has owned a beauty salon for almost two years now. He also does makeup, tattoos and hair removal. Yasser is good at his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His clients feel comfortable going to his salon because he offers a lot of services. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva field partner, in order to purchase more beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Yasser has requested a loan.

When Yasser first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he already had faithful customers from his previous job. He decided to open his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat C. (pictured with his mother) is 20 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and brothers and sisters along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Socheat has been growing lotus for 6 years. He wants to supplement his income by starting a duck-raising business. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to buy ducks to raise. He will also use part of the loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing lotus.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for growing lotus.

loans.name: Jorge Oreste

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Oreste M., tiene a su cargo dos  hijos, uno de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que le debe de brindar las condicinoes necesarias para su desarrollo. Es importante destacar que ha trabajado con créditos de CEPRODEL durante 12 meses, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones pero ahora ha iniciado a reconstruirla para brindarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio de piso de la vivienda en que habita, para así beneficiar a sus hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Oreste M. is married and has two children, one of which is in primary school, so it is necessary he provides the necessary conditions for their development. He has worked with loans from CEPRODEL (Center for the Promotion of Local Development and Poverty Eradication) over the course of one year, during which time he has invested two loans into the improvement of his home, since it has been in bad condition. With these loans he has been able to rebuild his home to give a better living condition for his children. The loan he is requesting would be invested in the purchase of construction materials to replace the floor of the house he lives in, so it can benefit his children he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gbadessi

texts.fr: A. Gbadessi est née en 1959 au Bénin. Gbadessi vit depuis près de 10 ans à Cococodji, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi au Bénin. Mariée à KPONOU Noel, un revendeur, Gbadessi est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gbadessi vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs charges. Gbadessi n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Gbadessi vend des tissus, de l’huile d’arachide et des savons, par le système de distribution. C’est depuis 20 ans que Gbadessi exerce cette activité. Gbadessi s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Gbadessi a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, et l’a bien remboursé. En vue d’élever le niveau de son activité, pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle, Gbadessi sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Gbadessi is born in 1959 in Benin. Gbadessi lives close to 10 years in Cococodji in the district of Abomey Calavi in Benin. Married to KPONOU Noel, a retailer, Gbadessi is the mother of two children, all in school. Gbadessi lives alone with her children and bears solely their expenses. Gbadessi has not been to school. In order to provide for her needs, she sells fabrics, peanut oil and soap through the distribution system. Gbadessi has been in this business for 20 years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Gbadessi obtained a loan once from ALIDe and repaid it correctly. In view of raising the level of her business, in order to meet the resquests of her clientele, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 5 gallons of peanut oil and 5 pieces of fabric

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Haydee se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 20 años logrando llevar el sustento a su familia.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de los productos de la pulpería entre ellos comestibles lácteos como queso, cuajada, crema y otros productos como detergentes, jabones, entre otros. La señora S. espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará las condiciones de vida propia y las de su familia.
texts.en:
For the last 20 years, María Haydee has dedicated herself to her business in Managua's Mayoreo Market, in order to support her family. The funds will be used to buy items for her grocery store among them: dairy products, like cheese, cuajada (milk curd), cream and other products like detergent and soap, among others. Mrs. S. hopes that her loan will be granted satisfactorily so that she can improve her own and her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eusebia Estela

texts.es: Doña Eusebia Estela Z. Chaclán cuenta con 25  años de edad  casada vive con sus  hijo y esposo  reside en el lugar conocido como Paraje Chuatzam del cantón Juchanep, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala actualmente ella se dedica al comercio en venta de productos básicos en su comunidad queriendo mejorar su negocio se acercó  a las oficinas de la Asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo para mejorar su pequeño negocio incrementando y mejorando las variedades como también la demanda de su clientela y mejoramiento de sus ingresos mensuales como también la de su familia con sus ingresos mensuales para poder sufragar sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Doña Eusebia Estela Z. Chaclán is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She and her family live in a place in the Juchanep region known as Paraje Chuatzam, which is in the City and Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Estela currently sells basic necessities in her community and wants to improve her business. For this reason, she came to the offices of Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She plans to increase and improve the variety of products that she offers in order to keep up with customer demand and improve her monthly income to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Walter,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 30 años de edad, él socio es soltero, Nuestro socio  es un joven emprendedor y trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba desde el año 2007, el socio quiere implementar un proyecto en el área agropecuario, en realidad es un proyecto que abarcará el campo agrícola, el medio ambiente y ganadería; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para cubrir su proyecto. 

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Los Solidarios Community Bank. He lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, about one hour from the city of Cusco. He is 30 years old, single, and an enterprising young man who has worked in the municipality of Urubamba since 2007. Walter wishes to develop an agricultural project that involves farming, the environment, and cattle raising. He is asking for a loan to cover the costs of the project. He is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the costs of his agricultural project

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells groceries, drinks and sachet water at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business since 2000. Mercy is single without children and she is 31 years old. She is a bini by tribe. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 30 years old and married with three children who go to school. He has been rearing chickens for sale for two years. He raises broilers and sells them to hotels when they are mature. He is married to a business lady and together they are able to pay their expenses and educate their children. David does not only raise livestock but is also a church pastor. He hopes to increase the number of his livestock and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria Jadan es socia del banco Pauteñitas, ella vive en la comunidad de Jadan en el  cantón Paute ubicado al noreste de la provincia del Azuay en la ruta de unión natural entre la sierra y el oriente Ecuatoriano incrementando el acceso  al Amazonas por los Ríos del Perú, lo que convierte al turismo en un gran potencial para el desarrollo local, además de su clima templado y su gente siempre amable atractivos para el turista nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres esfuerzo de mucho trabajo a quienes ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Gloria se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos en su propia comunidad actividad que realiza hace un buen tiempo, cuenta con un puesto propio y trabaja de domingo a domingo de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., para abastecer su negocio compra el pollo ya que su criadero es aún pequeño y no le abastece para su negocio.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo  trabajando con la fundación permitiéndole incrementar poco a poco su negocio, con el nuevo crédito va a comprar  pollos pelados y tambien unas crías y alimento para abastecer su negocio y su criadero.

Su sueño es poder ingresar a la universidad para seguir la carrera de Ingeniería de Alimentos.
texts.en:
Gloria Jadan is a member of the Pauteñitas Communal Bank. She lives in the Jadan community of Paute county, located northeast of the Azuay province. It is on the Union Natural route between the mountains and the Ecuadorian east, facilitating access to the Amazon by the rivers of Peru, which makes tourism a big potential for the local development. Furthermore, it has a mild climate, and its kind people are perfect for both national and international tourists.

Our client is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who have worked hard to obtain their house. She helps them out with the household expenses. Gloria raises and sells chickens in her community, and she has been doing so for quite some time. She has her own stand and works 7 days a week from 8 am to 5pm. In order to stock up her business, she buys chickens because her poultry farm is still very small, and she does not have enough to satisfy demand.

She is now in her third loan cycle with this institute, which has allowed her to expand her business little by little. With this new loan, she will purchase some chicks, plucked chickens, and feed to restock her farm.

Her dream is to be able to enroll in university so that she can pursue a degree in Food Engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks, plucked chickens, and feed

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en: Sarvan A. is a 30-year-old internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar settlement in 1992. He started his business in 2004 by buying one cow and now he has gained enough experience to breed more cattle. Sarvan is married and has four children. He has applied for 1200 AZN to purchase more cattle and increase his income by fattening and selling calves to the local butchers.

loans.use: To purchase five baby calves

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma B. is from the village of Butuay. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Wilma owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio C., 62 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has 2 children aged 18 and 22. To make a living, Aurelio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been involved in farming for more than a few years.

Aurelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Aurelio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Aurelio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, junto con su esposo, siembra cereales y granos como trigo, cebada, maíz, habas, quinua y arveja, puesto que la venta de estos productos son los más rentables. Es así que durante la temporada de cosecha, lo vende al por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados y trata de venderlo de manera directa sin intermediarios dependiendo de la ocasión y del precio a la que se oferta en el mercado.  Por tal razón cuida mucho de sus plantaciones, de esa manera logrará prevenir cualquier ataque de plagas. Desde entonces desea intensificar más el trabajo tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, y por tanto desea adquirir más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y espera serlo esta vez. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para preparar sus terrenos de cultivo en la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She has been working in agriculture since childhood and with her husband she grows cereals and grains such as wheat, barley, corn, beans, quinoa and peas. These are the most profitable products to sell. During the harvest season, she sells them wholesale to market traders and tries to sell them directly with no intermediaries, depending on the occasion and the market price. For this reason, she takes great care of her plantations in order to prevent pest attacks. From now onwards, she wishes to intensify both the sowing and harvesting work, and therefore wants to acquire more land in order to increase production. This is her fourth loan with MFP; she is very responsible with her payments and expects to be this time too. With the loan requested, she will buy sacks of fertiliser with which to prepare her cultivating plots during the next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
BB.CC. Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui.
Elisabeth, tiene 33 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijos. 

Yo nací en la provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco y actualmente vivo en la comunidad de Yungaqui. Mi actividad económica es la ganadería la cual consiste en comprar ganados críos en la ferias de Inquilpata y Tablada de la provincia de Anta y después de hacerlos engordar los vendo en las mismas ferias. Ya son varios años que me dedico a este negocio y me va muy bien gracias al empeño que  pongo en mi trabajo. Yo necesitaba dinero para aumentar mi capital y fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa el cual me brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar y así mejorar mi negocio. En esta oportunidad necesito el préstamo para comprar más ganado críos como ovejas, chanchos, etc. La comunidad de Yungaqui se encuentra ubicado no menos de 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Izcuchaca.
texts.en:
BB.CC. Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui. Elisabeth is 33 years old. She is a widow with three children. I was born in the Anta province in the department of Cusco. I currently live in the Yungaqui community. I buy baby animals at the markets in Inquilpata and Tablada in the Anta province and I raise them. After I fatten them up, I sell them at the same markets. I have been doing this for several years now and I am doing well because I have been persistent. I needed money to increase my capital and it was then that I was given the opportunity to join the communal bank Asociación Arariwa. They offered me financial support to start and improve my business. Now I need a loan to buy more baby animals like sheep, pigs, etc. The Yungaqui community is located 45 minutes or more from the city of Cusco and 10 minutes from the city of Izcuchaca.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more baby animals like sheep, pigs, etc..

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro A. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 48 years old. Isidro is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Isidro owns and operates a business growing crops, specifically, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Isidro has been in ,business for over 26 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Isidro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. Isidro is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Isidro from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Matham Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Matham” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 3,100,000 to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Ramatu S., age fifty, who was born in Matham village. Her husband is a businessman and, currently, Ramatu, her husband and five children reside in Magburaka town. One of her children is attending secondary school and the rest are now grown-ups.

Ramatu has been selling cigarettes, pepper, Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), firewood, etc., for many years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business by buying more firewood, pepper, Margi, cigarettes, etc., in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy firewood, pepper, Margi, cigarettes, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is a 36-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   Videoke (Karaoke with video) , a General store and a rice retailer businesses. She lives in Brgy Poblacion, Roxas, Palawan. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Videoke, General store and rice retailer businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3200. 

Elena is now borrowing PHP 15000 so that she  could  fund and sustain the operations of her Videoke business . This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Business funds operation

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania, D. 53 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor D. 51 años y su hijo menor Bryan D. 16 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Melania ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas, zanahorias y habas, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Melanie, age 53, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 51 year old husband, Héctor, and her 16 year old son, Bryan. She wants to give them a better future. With a great deal of effort Melania has managed to work her fields and have them be productive again. She grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans. These products are taken to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her crops have given her the necessary income to support her family. Therefore, she wants to put all of her efforts into getting this business ahead. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She has been doing this for 30 years. The most difficult part is transporting her products to Tarma. The sacks that she takes there are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she wishes to buy new fields to increase her production. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous loans, and she plans being punctual with this loan as well. She is a very active participant in her communal bank, and she is up on all of the agreements the group has come to. She will use the requested 1,300 soles to buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: God Time Is The Best Group

texts.en:
Sekou D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Time Is The Best. He is 23 years old, single and has one child who is one year old. He was only able to attend school through twelve grade due to financial constraints. He cares for one sibling.

For four years he has been operating a foreign exchange bureau in waterside downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 16,250 Liberian Dollars portion of this 81,250 Liberian Dollars group loan to add more money to his business. He describes himself as a devoted man whose goals are to improve his business and continue his education further.

loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Las Nazarenas Group

texts.es: La señora yeng tiene 42 años y vive en Huaycan, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ademas es la presidenta del grupo "Las Nazarenas" que se conforma por 8 amigas las cuales se conocieron el el colegio "El Nazareno", pues sus hijos estudian ahi. Este es un nuevo grupo y esperan el apoyo de Edaprospo para mejorar su calidad de vida y desarrollar sus negocios, por su parte la señora Yeng vende comida entre las calles Misti y Huascaran, lleva 10 años en este rubro y vende aproximadamente 30 platos por dia el cual le ayuda para mantener su hogar, arreglar su casa e implementar su bodega con muchos mas productos hasta convertirla en un Minimarket, pero para eso necesita trabajar duro y tambien de las habilitaciones por parte de Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Ms. Yeng is 42-years-old and lives in Huaycan. She's single and has 2 children. She's the president of the group "Las Nazarenas," which consists of 8 friends who met each other in the "El Nazareno" school, where their children now study. This is a new group and they're counting on the support of EDAPROSPO to improve their quality of life and develop their businesses. 

Ms. Yeng sells food between the streets Misti and Huascaran. She's worked this area for 10 years and she sells approximately 30 plates per day, which helps her maintain her home, fix her house and stock her store with many more products until it becomes a Minimarket. But for this she needs to work hard with the help of EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: Purchase of products and consumables

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores C. is 42 years old, married and has four children. She is from the town of Surallah in South Cotabato province on the islands of Mindanao. Dolores farms and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She also has a piggery and grows pigs for breeding. Dolores aims to increase her rice yield and grow healthy pigs.

Dolores joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Dolores successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizer and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está formado por 14 mujeres y un hombre quienes son personas muy amables y alegres, trabajadoras quienes con el esfuerzo del día a día buscan mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en la parroquia del Valle, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos  han  migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de mejores trabajos, también en la ciudad encuentran las oportunidades de un buen trabajo.

La Señora. Margarita T. vive en la comunidad de Poloma que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Este es  su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, se dedica a la cría de animales como cerdos y ganado, la leche que obtiene de ellos los vende a los carros lecheros, sus animales los vende en su comunidad. 
Doña Margarita tiene 45 años, es viuda hace 14 años y tiene un hijo de 25 años de edad que es casado y vive independiente.  Vive en acompañada de una sobrina que tiene 10 años de edad que estudia en la escuela, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca. Su sueño es tener un vehículo para poder trasladarse con más facilidad.

La Señora. Ana L. vive en el centro de la parroquia del Valle, es muy joven con apenas 23 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad quienes pasan a su cuidado. Su esposo labora en una fábrica en la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Ana pasa en casa debido a que sus hijos son pequeños pero aprovecha el tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de animales como: cuyes, pollos, conejos y patos a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
Es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y ha sido invitada por su mamá a formar parte de la banca en donde ha formado una bonita amistad con todas las socias.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento, también en hierba para sus cuyes y conejos. Su meta es  comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Corazón de Jesús, is comprised of 14 women and 1 man who are pleasant, happy and hard-working people wishing to improve their home finances by their daily efforts. They live in the parish of Valle and they work in animal husbandry and agriculture. Many people have emigrated to different places in the world in search of better work, or to the city to find opportunities for a better job.  

Sra Margarita T. lives in the Poloma community which is part of the Valle parish. This is her second loan through the communal bank; she works in animal husbandry with pigs and livestock. She sells the milk obtained from these animals to the milk trucks, and sells the animals within her community.  Doña Margarita is 45 years old, she has been a widow for 14 years and has a 25-year-old son who is married and lives independently.  She lives with her 10-year-old niece who is studying at school. Owing to her work, she has managed to build her own house. She plans to invest the loan in purchasing a cow. Her dream is to have a vehicle in order to be able to move around with greater ease.

Sra Ana L. lives in the centre of the parish of Valle. She is very young, having just turned 23 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 4 and 2 years, who she looks after.  Her husband works in a factory in the city. They do not have a house of their own but rather they are renting. Doña Ana stays at home as her children are so young, but she makes good use of this time to work in animal husbandry, caring for animals such as: guinea pigs, chickens, rabbits and ducks, which she sells within her community whenever she has financial need to do so.  This is the second loan that she has applied for from the community bank; she was invited by her mother to join and she has established good friendships with each of the members. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens and feed, and also in buying grass for her guinea pigs and rabbits. Her aim is to be able to buy her own land.

loans.use: To buy a cow, chickens and feed, and grass for guinea pigs and rabbits.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon S., 31, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker, typically making $3 per day, while her husband sells salt and earns about $4 a day. This couple has no children yet and would like to take out a loan of $400 to purchase more salt for resale.

loans.use: Buy salt to resell

loans.name: Nelsis Esther

texts.es: Nelsis R. V., es una mujer que vive en el municipio de Soledad donde vive con su esposos y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 16 años, Ella tiene un negocio que diez años atrás comenzara su madre: alquiler de sillas playeras en el Rodadero, hermoso balneario en la ciudad de Santa Marta, a dos horas de Barranquilla.  Con el paso del tiempo su madre decidió   buscar el apoyo de sus hijos y asociarlos a él,  porque se amplió mucho. Ellos tienen 320 sillas y viajan a Santa Marta desde el viernes hasta el domingo y lunes si es festivo, de igual manera lo hacen todo el tiempo en temporada de mucho turismo como a finales y a mediados de año. Aprovechando la gran cantidad de turistas,  de toda Colombia y extranjeros, que disfrutan de sus descanso; ella también ofrece productos como refrescos pasteles, hayacas dulces y agua y con ello logra un ingreso adicional, especialmente  en la alta temporada  que se avecina en este sitio turístico.  Nelsis quiere comprar 40 sillas playeras y este es justamente el motivo por el cual está aplicando a su credikiva, su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  porque quiere aumentar sus ganancias con una oferta mayor de sillas de descanso en  playa y en buena época.  Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para su uso en el negocio pues le ayudaría  en su traslado y él mismo se pagaría, por eso trabaja persistentemente con mucha disciplina para a mediano plazo responder a este gran desafío.
texts.en:
Nelsis R. V. is a woman living in Soledad with her husband and two children who are 11 and 16 years of age.  She has a business that her mother started ten years ago:  she rents beach chairs at El Rodadero Beach, a beautiful sea resort in the city of Santa Marta, two hours from Barranquilla.

In time her mother sought help from her children to associate them with the business it because it grew much.  They have 320 chairs and they travel to Santa Marta every Friday through Sunday or Monday if it’s a holiday.  During high tourist seasons they go all the time as well as at the end of the year and at the middle of the year.

Taking advantage of the large number of tourists, both from all of Colombia and foreigners alike, that enjoy their rest, she also offers other products like delicious cakes, sweet hayacas (a type of tamale) and water thereby earning additional income, especially during the  high season that’s about to start in this tourist destination.

Nelsis wants to buy 40 beach chairs and this is precisely why she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she wants to increase profits with a larger number of beach chairs to relax in during this good season.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to use in the business because that would help transport and would pay for itself.  This is why she works so hard so that in the not too distant future she will meet this great challenge.

loans.use: To buy 40 beach chairs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine L. is from the barangay of Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married to Jerito L., and blessed with 5 children, all of whom are now in college, high school, or elementary school. To make a living, she is presently employed as an insurance underwriter together with her husband as the area manager. They’re also engaged in the direct and network sales of fitness and wellness food supplements products. She has been employed for 3 years and has been in the direct and network selling business for 10 years. She earns an amount of not less than Php 10,000.00 per month from insurance sales and not less than Php 5,000.00 from their direct and network selling business. 

In December 15, 2005, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, and has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 50,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php 50,000.00 as her 3rd loan, which will be used as additional working capital for the insurance premium quota and for the food supplement direct and network selling business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, their children’s education, and possible future land acquisitions.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital for insurance premiums quota and direct selling business

loans.name: Girlisa's Group

texts.en:
Girlisa J. is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Girlisa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marigold 3.

Girlisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Girlisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Girlisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Girlisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jecil's Group

texts.en:
Jecil S. is from the village of Bongbong, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old, married and has one infant. Jecil is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Jecil owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jecil joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Silvia trabaja en la institución privada ABC de PRODEIN como personal de limpieza y lavandera. Silvia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y ofrece sus productos en la feria sabatina y dominical de la plaza Túpac Amaru del distrito de Wanchaq, Cusco. Ya son 2 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Silvia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, napa, cintas, globos, pintura, lana y mantas.  

Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Silvia is 51 years old and lives in the city of Cusco in the department of Cusco in Peru. She works in the private institution, ABC, which is operated by PRODEIN (the human rights branch of the Catholic Order, Lumen Dei), where she is a member of the cleaning and laundry staff. Silvia is a determined and enterprising woman, who spends her spare time making handicrafts, which she sells at the weekend fair in the Túpac Amaru square in the Wanchaq district of Cusco. Silvia has dedicated the last two years to this business and it is going well. She needs a loan to buy materials such as fabrics, imitation leather, ribbons, balloons, paint, wool and blankets. 

Silvia belongs to the Asociación Arariwa's "Hijas de María" Banco Comunal in Cusco, Peru. This Banco Comunal is in its third year of operation and all the members are very happy with it.

loans.use: To buy materials such as fabrics, imitation leather, ribbons, balloons, paint, wool and blankets

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 3 Group

texts.es:
Ysabel es la coordinadora del grupo Mujeres poderosas 3, cada uno de ellos días a días realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya actividades principales es el turismo y una fabrica de ron, tambien esta ciudad es fuerte en el sector inmobiliario, son las principales fuentes de trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Joyas, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Ysabel posee una familia conformada por su esposo y un hijo. Como madre nos dice que su mayor dificultad es salir a trabajar y tener que dejar a su hijo, solo sin su atencion, por eso es que esta dedicada a un negocio propio que le permita estas mas horas disponibles en su casa, atendiendo a su niño. Su actividad favorita es asistir a la iglesia y compartir con los miembros.

Ysabel opera la venta de Calzados y Joyerias, vio la necesidad de alguien que vendiera prendas de plata en su comunidad y otras cercanas, y comenzo a venderlas poco a poco, en la actualidad despues de cinco prestamo con Esperanza, ha podido dedicarse tambien a la venta de calzados. Este prestamo sera invertido en ambos productos dedicando el 50% de su prestamo a cada uno. Desea tener un negocio estable, con local y que pueda ser sostenible, y esta dentro de sus planes futuro poder construir este local al igual que su vivienda. Gracias por todo.
texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of the 'Mujeres Poderosas 3' (Powerful Women 3) group.  Each of the group's members carries out her own business activity every day in the city of Puerto Plata.  This is a city whose main businesses are tourism and a rum factory.  The property sector is also strong in this city.  These are the main sources of work.  The ladies in this group mainly sell jewelry, clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products.

Ysabel's family is made up of herself, her husband and her son.  As a mother, she tells us that her greatest difficulty is going out to work and having to leave her son at home alone without her attention.  For this reason, she works in her own business which allows her to spend more time at home looking after her son.  Ysabel's favorite activity is going to church and sharing with her fellow group members.

Ysabel runs a business selling shoes and jewelry.  She saw the need for someone to sell gold jewelry in her community and other nearby communities and she started selling these products gradually.  After having received five loans from Esperanza she is now able to sell shoes as well.  Ysabel will invest this loan in both lines of products, devoting 50% of her loan to each.  She would like to have a stable business, with her own premises, and for it to be sustainable.  One of her future plans is to build these premises as well as her own home.  Thank you for everything.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and shoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita R. O. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa “MINED” desempeñándose como Docente tiene veinte   años  de trabajar  como docente de Educacion Primaria es Casada  actualmente, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Margarita R. O. currently works for "MINED" (the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education) as a teacher.  She has been working as an elementary school teacher for twenty years.  Margarita is married and has three school-age children.  She has had two loans from CEPRODEL and used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. in order to extend and improve her home.  CEPRODEL's loans have benefited her greatly since she has been able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies: sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a very supportive woman. She has been operating a milk sales business for the past 20 years to financially assist her family. She keeps a buffalo at her home, milks it and sells its milk to her community clients at reasonable rates. Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to further improve her business. She plans to use the loan to buy another buffalo which will help her produce more milk and serve more clients. Sughran is hopeful that this loan will enable her business to grow and to produce more profit. Sughran's husband, A. G., is a daily wage laborer. Sughran has a son and a daughter. Her daughter is illiterate and her son is in 8th class. For the past 20 years, Sughran and her family have been living in a 2-room brick house in Jaranwala, a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Sughran is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is a responsible client with a good credit record.

Note: In the photo, Sughran is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en:
Kombo S. is a 65-year-old married man who has four children. He operates a retail shop in the Marereni area in Malindi town. The business has been in existence for the past six years now and it usually gives Kombo a monthly income of about Kshs. 5000/=. He uses this income to support his small family since all his children are grown up. 

Kombo has been loaned Kshs 12,000/= by KADET LIMITED and this serves as his second loan from the company. He intends to use this loan to buy foodstuffs such as cooking flour, soft drinks such as sodas as well as other items like cooking oil, toothpaste, sweets for children so as to add to the stock that he already has. 

He wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue looking after his family as well as continue restocking and gradually expanding his business so that in future, his family may come to own a well-established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for her food business

loans.name: 041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
"Tâm Lê Thị (60) is a 58 year-old female living in the town of Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  Tâm is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường (041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).


Tâm is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, Tâm operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Tâm has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tâm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be the 8th loan taken out by Tâm from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị Hợp (113) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  P. Thị Thơm (64) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  Lê Thị Huệ (42) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  N. Thị Đương (30) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tâm Lê Thị (60) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  Tâm là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường (041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tâm thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tâm kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Tâm đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tâm đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Hợp (113) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  P. Thị Thơm (64) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Lê Thị Huệ (42) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  N. Thị Đương (30) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business	.

loans.name: Veenus' Group

texts.en:
Veenus runs a beauty salon. She is a professional beautician and offers bridal makeup, facials and beauty services to her clients. She is very much an expert in her work and has a good number of clients who get her services regularly. She is also a very good housewife and manages her household responsibilities very well.  
She is 47 years old married with five children. Her eldest daughter is also a beautician. She got her training from Veenus and now helps her handle her clients. The other four are studying in a local school. Her husband is a factory worker.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her beauty salon business. With the loan, she will purchase beauty products & cosmetics such as face creams, masks, hair creams, lipsticks, nail polishes, eye shadows, mascara, etc to offer better quality services to her clients.   
She is hopeful that after the loan, her business will grow further and she will be able to earn a better income.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Veenus.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 56 years old with seven children who are ages 14-30 years old. She is a widow. She sells charcoal in the market and she has sold charcoal for three years. This business has improved the standard of living for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and make more profits. With the profits, she plans to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
Rolando, vive con su esposa y una hija de 5 años, él es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, lo realiza desde hace 10 años, aprendió de su padre y trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Este trabajo es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta, para sostener a su familia, actualmente solicita un préstamo para adquirir los insumos agrícolas e iniciar nuevamente la siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, con estos materiales puede tener una mayor seguridad del cultivo.
Su propósito es mantenerse en el trabajo, ya que de ahí depende su familia y sobre todo su hija, por quien espera tener una fuente permanente se ingreso, para ayudarle a superarse.
texts.en:
