Rolando lives with his wife and 5 year-old daughter.  He is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He has been in this business for 10 years and learned from his father.  He works every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

This work is Rolando's source of income with which he supports his family.  He is currently requesting a loan to buy farming supplies so that he can start sowing his crops.  He will buy manure and fertilizers.  With these materials, his crops will be safer.

Rolando's goal is to keep working as his family depends on his work, especially his daughter.  He hopes to have a permanent source of income so that he can help his daughter to do well.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for growing corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 34-year-old married father of three children aged between five years and two months old.  He runs a poultry business in Mariakani, a business that has been in operation for the last two years and has been a success.
 
Hamisi has been a KADET client and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more chicks for sale in his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.  His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: purchase more chicks

loans.name: Rosa Petith

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es separada, tiene 54 años y solo vive con su hija, todos los demás son independientes y ya han conformado sus hogares.

Decidió dedicarse a un negocio pues por aquel tiempo su pareja no la apoyaba económicamente y tenía la necesidad de mantener a la última de sus hijas y a su mamá que estaba a su cargo.
Empezó con un pequeño capital de S/. 100.00, vendiendo jugos de frutas por las mañanas y posteriormente implementó un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Actualmente continúa desarrollando ambas actividades, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hija y a su mamá. También cuenta con una buena clientela pues les brinda un trato amable.

Con este préstamo de S/.3000.00,  piensa comprar productos que tienen más salida para implementar su negocio como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite por cajas, de esa manera mejorará sus ventas y ganancias.
Rosa es una mujer trabajadora,  su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Brigada Ramírez” communal bank in the district and province of Lamas, within the San Martín department.  She is 54 years old, separated, and lives only with her daughter.  The rest of her children are on their own.

She decided to start this business because at that time her husband was not supporting her financially and she needed to support her youngest daughter.  She started with a small amount of capital, 100 PEN, and began selling fruit juices in the morning and later she started a grocery business.  Currently she is working both businesses and it allowed her to get ahead with her daughter and her mother.  She also has steady customers because she treats them well.

She will use the money from this loan of 3,000 PEN to buy some of the better selling products such as snacks, carbonated drinks, sacks of flower, sugar, milk, and boxes of cooking oil.  In this way she can increase her sales and profits.

Rosa is a hard working woman with a dream of continuing to grow her business.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving women like her the opportunity to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 34 years old and was born in Yerevan. He graduated from the State Engineering University of Armenia, Machine Building Economy Department. After graduation he worked in a hothouse as an economist. Vahe is married and has a little daughter. Vahe’s wife is a manager in a travel agency. 

Eight years ago Vahe began his own business, which consists of producing adornment with precious metals. He rents a place in a jewelry trade market and works very hard to support his young family. 

Thanks to his first Kiva loan, Vahe was able to buy ring and earring templates, which have been helping him until now in his business. Now Vahe has many orders, and to fulfill those orders he needs a loan of $3,000 to buy gold and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy gold and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.name: Flor De Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario FLOR DE MARIA esta conformado por cuatro personas 3 mujeres y 1 hombre. 
todos trabajadores y luchadores y que se conocen muy bien.
el grupo esta ubicado en la Aldea El Jobo de la jurisdicción de Nacaome, departamento de Valle.

El señor Javier se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular en su pulpería que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, Javier es una persona muy simpática, amable, responsable y sobre todo muy respetuosa, sus clientes dan muy buenas referencias de el como persona , como amigo y como comerciante.

El señor Javier en su pulpería vende todos los productos de la canasta Básica Familiar, como ser abarrotaría en general, granos básicos, productos derivados de la leche, embutidos , refrescos, todo tipo de carnes , pollo, agua, cosméticos y productos de aseo personal.

los demas integrantes del grupo son: Ana Mirian se dedica  a la venta de golosinas en la escuela Agrícola, La señora Gloria Araceli se dedica a la venta de tortillas y La señora Ramona se dedica a la extracción y venta de materiales de construcción.

Uno de sus anhelos es ver crecer sus negocios y dejar un mejor sustento a sus hijos y familiares.
texts.en:
The “Flor de María” solidarity group is composed of four people: three women and one man.  All are hardworking and tenacious and know each other very well.  The group is located in the village of El Jobo, Nacaome jurisdiction, Valle Department.

Javier sells items of popular consumption in his home-based grocery store.  He’s been in this occupation for several years.  Javier is a likeable, kind, responsible and, above all, respectful person.  His customers give him very good references as a person, as a friend and as a merchant.

Javier stocks all the basic items a family needs in his store like: groceries in general, basic grains, products derived from milk, cured meats, soft-drinks, all types of meat, chicken, water, cosmetics and personal hygiene items.

The other group members are: Ana Mirian who sells snacks at the Agricultural School, Gloria Araceli who sells tortillas and Ramona who extracts and sells building materials.  One of their wishes is to see their businesses grow and to provide better support for their children and families.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 61 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 30 a 33 años y  vive al sur de la ciudad,  donde se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir y también tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la confección de conjuntos infantiles  y multiusos que fabrica con telas, hilos, en dos máquinas sencillas y con herramientas manuales. El arte de la costura lo aprendió por sí sola, pero logró perfeccionarlo con capacitaciones que le posibilitaron el montaje de su negocio, actividad de la cual sus hijos, personas trabajadoras y de bien, se sienten muy orgullosos de ella. Blanca también desarrolla otra actividad complementaria y es la venta de comidas rápidas, negocio que funciona en las horas de la mañana  y en el que emplea solo dos horas diarias. Sus negocios la ayudaron a elaborar su duelo una vez falleció su esposo, situación que ha sido el desafío más grande en su vida.  Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materiales para la confección de ropa encargada y harina, queso, embutidos para la preparación de picadas que también vende a crédito y de contado. Con sus créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar su infraestructura y tener un capital de trabajo disponible para realizar sus compras de contado, con las cuales ha obtenido descuentos e incrementado sus utilidades. Su meta es terminar de arreglar su casa y continuar apoyando siempre a sus hijos y nietos que son su mayor felicidad. El negocio de Blanca maneja un margen de contribución del 35%, una liquidez de 3 a 1, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 18 días y una capacidad de pago del 100%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales auguramos un mayor crecimiento.
texts.en:
Blanca, 61, is a widow and has three children whose ages range from 30 to 33 years.  She lives in the south part of the city where she makes clothes and also has a fast food business.  She’s been making children’s outfits and multiple-use garments for the last 10 years with fabric and thread on two simple machines and with hand tools.  She learned the art of sewing on her own but managed to perfect it through courses that allowed her to set up her own business, work that her children who are upstanding, working people, feel very proud of her for.  Blanca also carries out another activity which is the sale of fast food, a business that operates in the morning and that only takes up two hours a day.  Her businesses helped her get through the mourning period when her husband died which was the greatest challenge she’s had to face in life.

Her Kiva loan is the third loan she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy materials to make the clothing she has on order and to buy flour, cheese and cured meats to prepare the snacks which she sells both for cash and on credit.

Previous loans have made it possible for her to improve her infrastructure and to have working capital available to pay cash for her purchases which led to discounts that increased her profits.  Her goal is to finish fixing up her house and to continue to support her children and grandchildren who are her greatest source of happiness.  

Blanca’s business operates with a gross income of 35%, a 3 to 1 liquidity ratio; an 18 day accounts receivable rotation and a 100% capacity to pay – all financial indicators that we can use to predict greater growth.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes and flour, cheese and cured meats to make snacks.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: El señor Benjamín, es pintor y restaura cuadros dañados. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar materiales como ser: pinturas, lienzos, pinceles y otros insumos requeridos en su profesión. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona  Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado  y  tiene  2  hijos.  Benjamín ha acudido a IMPRO cuatro veces para solicitar crédito y esta es la tercera vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Benjamín is a painter and restores damaged paintings.  He needs the loan to buy materials like: paint, canvas, brushes and other supplies needed in his profession.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  He’s married and has two children.  Benjamín has called on IMPRO four times to request a loan and this is the third time we’ve channeled his loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy paint, canvas and brushes to continue restoring paintings.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past year, Kevin has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells cooking goods. 

To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and cooking oil, and will help Kevin to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Kevin hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Kevin is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Kevin's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Zebastiana Enilda

texts.es:
Zebastiana tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Casa GranD., una zona D. actividad agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra ubicada en el departamento D. La Libertad.

Ella  cuenta con una bodega instalada en un puesto en el mercado. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes.  Asimismo  su negocio cuenta con una antigüedad D. 10 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. 

Zebastiana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería y realizar algunos arreglos en su puesto donD. venD. D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes y brindar cada vez un mejor servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Zebastiana, 57, is married living with her family in Casa GranD. District, a farming and livestock raising zone located in La Libertad Department.

She has a store located in a market stall.  She offers her customers various daily consumption items and groceries.  The business has been in operation for 10 years and currently has a steady, regular clientele.

Zebastiana wants to expand her business buying more merchandise and to make some repairs to the stand where she sells so that she can meet customer demand and proviD. better service each time.  She, therefore, has felt it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and to do some repairs to her food store.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 40 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 12 años.
Clementina tiene una panadería, recuerda que antes vendía golosinas en una carretilla, después se compró un triciclo, a medida que fue creciendo su negocio llegó a vender sus golosinas al por mayor gracias a ello construyó su casa, ahora ella tiene una panadería en el cual le va bien gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal, Clementina ha podido educar a sus hijos. El préstamo que esta solicitnado lo invertirá en la compra de harina y azúcar. Su meta es poder sembrar cacao.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vida” (New Life). She is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Clementina has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years.

She manages a bakery. Clementina recalls previously selling candy from a cart. Afterwards, she bought a tricycle so that she could grow her business and sell candy in bulk. Thanks to this business, she was able to build her house. Now she has a bakery that is doing well thanks to the training she received from her Communal Bank. Clementina has been able to provide for her children’s education.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Her goal is to grow cacao.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 26-year-old single man. He is the second child in his family. He has four siblings. They are living with their parents except the first child who is living on another island.
 
Winfred has been working as a fishmonger for 7 years. He commenced the business using his own small capital. He usually gets up at 3 am to buy fish and then walks from one house to another to sell the fish. From the business income, Winfred has been able to buy a used motorbike that helps him in running the business.

After running the business for seven years, one day Winfred was thinking to be a fisherman but he needs a small boat (a kind of canoe) to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He would like to purchase a small boat, trawl, tarpaulin and a lamp as well. He is hoping TLM will approve the loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase a small boat, trawl, tarpaulin and a lamp as well.

loans.name: Zacheaus

texts.en:
Zacheaus is a resident of Nkubu and has been in farming for 10 years.  He sells his produce -- milk, cabbage, carrots and potatoes --  to middlemen in the local market. He is married with four adult children and one minor who is still in school.  Zacheaus operates a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Zacheaus has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank for his farming business. He says the tank will ensure good storage for use by his dairy cows during dry seasons and will help maintain his milk production as well as other farming outputs. He adds that he plans to construct a greenhouse and that the tank will also ensure its water supply.  He hopes his family living standards will be improved.

Zacheaus laments of pests and other crop and animal diseases that limit a farmer's output.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Basilia Yamilet

texts.es: Basilia trabajadora, emprendedora con su negocio de costura y venta de productos variados de uso personal ha logrado establecerse en el ámbito del comercio con trayectoria de excelente atención y productos de calidad. Con el préstamo anterior  aumento su inventario y logro cumplir con sus pedidos. Proyecto realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Con este nuevo ciclo de crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como: telas, hilos, botones, zíperes, elásticos, cosméticos (base, sombra, lápiz de cejas, pinturas de labios), perfumes entre otro productos que son buscados por sus clientes en estos tiempos de festividades. Agradece por el apoyo constante brindado por la financiera para el desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Basilia is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman.  Through her sewing business and her business selling a variety of personal products, she has managed to establish herself in the field of commerce, providing excellent customer service and good-quality products.  With her previous loan, Basilia increased her inventory and managed to fill her orders.  She also plans to make some improvements to the infrastructure of her home.

With this new loan, Basilia will invest in buying raw materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, elastic, cosmetics (face powder, eye shadow, eyebrow pencils and lipsticks), perfumes and other products that her customers are looking for during this holiday season.  She is grateful for the constant support that she receives from the financial institution which allows her to develop her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making clothes

loans.name: Myriam Astrid

texts.es: A sus 42 años de edad y después de separarse de su esposo, Myriam empezó a trabajar con su madre para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y ofrecerle a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Esta emprendedora oriunda de Sonsón al oriente de Antioquia, Colombia desea iniciar con su propio negocio y para ello desea aprovechar la temporada navideña para venderle mercancía a sus conocidos en el municipio. Para ello necesita de un préstamo para comprar ropa interior, medias y cosméticos y así iniciar con este negocio que espera se convierta en un gran almacén con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en: At age 42, and after separating from her husband, Myriam began working with her mother in order to generate more income for her household and provide a better quality of life for her two children.  This enterprising woman is a native of Sonsón, west of Antioquia, Colombia, and wants to start her own business to take advantage of the Christmas season by selling merchandise to her acquaintances in town.  She needs this loan to buy undergarments, socks, and cosmetics.  She hopes that this business will grow into a large store over time.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with 3 children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Esther operates a service-based business to earn a living, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns 7,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Esther has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Esther hopes to finish the study of her children and to gain double the income from her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 33 years old and has been married to Tito for almost 11 years. The couple has one child who is in college. To meet the family's daily needs, Myrna has established a small store in which she sells grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. According to her, minimal profits earned were just enough to buy food for daily meals and to provide allowances for her child. She is thankful that, despite many competitors in the retail business, she can still acquire sales and earn good profits.

With her current situation in the business, she aspires to make improvements and to provide for all of the needs of her customers. She is asking for additional capital, because she had insufficient funds to buy canned goods, soft drinks, detergents, and eggs to sell. She is now asking for 25,000 PHP.

Through the help of this loan and her patience and determination to succeed, Myrna will alleviate her family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, detergents, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Rubia Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rubia es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno,  su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres. 

La Señora. Rubia tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos  de 24, 20, 15, 7 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y la ayudan  económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rubia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y también vende todo tipo de ropa, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 5 años, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Rubia is a member of the Renacer Uncovia communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  It is a mixture of the colonial and the modern.  Its people maintain the traditions and culture of their parents.

Rubia, age 45, is married and has five children; ages 24, 20, 15, 7, and 5.  Her first two children work and help her financially.  Her third child goes to high school, and the last two children go to a city school.  She does not have her own house; she rents where she lives.

Rubia sells Yanbal brand cosmetics.  She also sells all types of clothes.  She has been doing this for five years.  She sells her products by traveling through the city.  She works every day without a fixed schedule.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy clothes and cosmetics in order to increase her merchandise.

Her goal is to have her own place to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Delia has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecues. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients used in making barbecue.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make barbeque

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
In life there is always a reason to smile, but today Martha has a big reason, and it is that she is only one step away from being able to start her own cereal selling business, thanks to Juhudi Kilimo and the wonderful Kiva lenders. 

Martha is an amazing woman who is a smallholder farmer based in Kiminini village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is married to her handsome hubby, with whom she has been together for almost a decade. She has three children who commute to school from home every school-day. Martha has been practicing livestock farming for ten years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise animals on the farm. 

Martha is seeking a loan to stock her cereals business. She plans to use the money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cater for all the expenses incurred plus profit. Martha is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard-working and financially disciplined. 

Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Kikoga Church Of Uganda Group

texts.en: Nicholas is 29 years old, and is married. He does farming as the main source of income.He does this for the well being of his family.He is doing well though faced with a challenge of weather changes especially floods that affects many farmers in his area.His crops are now affected by heavy rains, which has exposed them to pests, and diseases, and weeds as well. He is now requesting for credit to buy pesticides and pay labour for weeding his farm. Nicholas is a committed member of Kikoga church of Uganda where members guarantee one another for a loan as they do not offer security.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay labour for weeding his farm.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with three children.She runs a  hairdressing business in a business center  of Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She has employed two assistants in her business. She usually in short of hairdressing materials and hair drier equipments.She experienced most difficulties relating to  stockouts two days before x-mass.Most of the shops selling hairdressing materials were out of stock during x-mass.She hadn’t enough stock either.This condition made her lose so many customers.She want to improve this condition by adding sufficient amount of hairdressing materials,sitting chairs,a fan and a television set to entertain customers while in a waiting queue.To effectively implement her plan  she need an additional working capital of USD 550.

loans.use: Buying hairdressing materials,driers,towels, a fan

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has 15 years of experience in business. She was encouraged to start by a friend and her mother-in-law. She has participated in many microbusiness courses, which have helped her to always be responsible with the loans she obtains. She works every day of the wek from 7 AM until 9 PM. On the weekends, she travels to the countryside, where she has some customers. Her parents also live there, and they help her out with the business.

Rosa wants this loan in order to be able to include other products in her inventory, especially school supplies. She will buy them wholesale, which will increase her profits. Rosa is a single mother. She has been separated for 6 years. She has 2 children. One no longer lives with her, and the other works and helps her out. Her wish is to be able to complete her house and to remodel part of it to accomodate her business, and in that way to increase her income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To diversify her inventory of school supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
"The security of my family concerns me greatly, since in the neighborhood where we live there also many gang members and many robberies. I would like to put up bars around my house before they can get in or something unfortunate happens." I am requesting $1000 for the installation of bars on my home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

“Me preocupa mucho la seguridad de mi familia ya que en la colonia en donde vivimos habitan también muchos pandilleros y hay muchos robos, me gustaría poner rejas alrededor de mi casa antes de que se puedan meter o suceda algo lamentable”. Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para la instalación de rejas en mi casa.

loans.use: Install bars on my home

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria Lopez D. P. is a mother of 6 children. She is 57 years old, single, and only her youngest child, 18, still lives with her. Her other children are married and working on their own. She has a table set up outsiD. of Mercado Ita, a small outdoor market, where she sells lottery tickets. She works for a private company and receives 20 percent for the tickets she sells. 
Every day she has over 300 customers that pass by and purchase lottery tickets from her. She has been selling lottery tickets for over 11 years now. With the loan, Maria uses it as capital to buy the lottery tickets from a private lottery ticket company. She is thankful for the many opportunities that her previous loans have provided her.

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en: Ismoil A. is 35 years old, with a secondary education. He is married and has 3 children. After graduating school, he worked hard and became a taxi driver. For many years now, he has worked as a driver in many various cars. Currently, he works as a taxi driver and provides his services to local residents. This activity is the main source for his income. With his loan. the client is going to fix gas equipment and other minor repairs.  This loan will give people opportunities to have taxi services available to them. The client will pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: to fix gas equipment,  and  minor repairs

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen I. is 39 years old, married with 4 children. She comes from the Lagos state. She travels from Lagos to Niger State to buy her river fish and sells to the neighbouring market. She has been in this business since the year 2000 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more river fish for sale

loans.name: Usnamah

texts.en: Usnamah is 39-year-old woman who has a small shop which sells snacks, and household items. She usually earns US$5 per day with a small profit. Her husband, I., has no fixed income.  Usnamah needs a loan to buy more goods for her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Ma. Esther

texts.es:
For many years Maria Esther was a teacher; once she retired, however, she was unable to support herself with the money that the government paid her. She must also support one of her three daughters, who is studying. What her husband, who is retired as well, earns does not cover household expenses. In 2005 Maria consequently began selling cookies, but she stopped doing it when she had to frequently visit one of her daughters in the United States, who fell ill. During this time, however, a friend told her that she could take advantage of these trips to bring back used clothes and household items to sell because those items sell very well. This is how Maria began her business. She worked with somebody else so that he could watch the business while she went to the United States and spent time with her daughter.

Nevertheless, Maria doesn't have enough merchandise to offer her customers at present. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of $750, which she is ready to repay over a period of 6 months. With this money, Maria will be able to bring back and sell a greater variety of clothes. With your assistance, Maria will be able to help her daughter succeed.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther durante muchos años fue maestra, y desde que se jubiló no podía mantenerse con el dinero que el gobierno le paga. Puesto que de todas sus 3 hijas todavía tiene una hija que apoyar, ya que está estudiando. Y lo que gana su esposo que también es jubilado no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de su casa. En el 2005 María comenzó vendiendo galletas, pero dejó de hacerlo porque una de sus hijas que radica en los Estados Unidos se enfermó y viajaba mucho a verla, fue cuando una amiga le propuso que aprovechara esos viajes para traer pacas de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar usados para vender, ya que eso se vende muy bien, fue así como comenzó y se asoció con otra persona ya que mientras Esther viajaba por la mercancía y estaba unos días con su hija, él se quedaba vendiendo y no se descuidaba el negocio.

Sin embargo Esther actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Esther podrá traer ropa para poder tener más variedad que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Esther podrá sacar a su hija adelante para que termine su carrera.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing in order to have more variety

loans.name: Nyenga East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Josephine Ssenabulya. She is currently operates a drug store and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale. Josephine is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a pastor. She has 4 children ranging from age 10 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Josephine makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a piggery business. Josephine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy two hair dryers and the loan was paid back on time.

Josephine is joined in her small group by Rose B., Jane B., Ruth N., and Erina N.. Rose B. has a farming business and wants to modernize her farming system. Jane B. is currently selling charcoal and wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Ruth N. operates a business of fish selling and wants to purchase more fish nets. Erina N. is currently operates a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To add capital to a  drug store and improve it.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos is 50 years old and lives with his family in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. His wife is a homemaker and tends to their 2 children. Marcos has been a bricklayer for more than 30 years and therefore, has vast experience in this occupation. He works independently, and that is how he has maintained his family. Thanks to his work, he has been improving the infrastructure of his home. Despite living in humble conditions, they have been making improvements to their home when their finances allow it. Their chief necessity at the moment is to erect the side wall of their home, which is currently deteriorated due to the poor infrastructure it was constructed with. Thus, it needs to be torn down and reconstructed using high-quality, resistant material. Marcos will perform this task himself to offer higher security for his home and his family. He will work on this project during the weekends and during his free time being that he currently has work orders from his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marcos tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su familia en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar de los 2 hijos que ambos procrearon. El señor tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a la labor de albañil, cuenta con una vasta experiencia en ese oficio, trabaja por cuenta propia y es de esa forma como ha sacado adelante a su familia. Con su trabajo es que ha ido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda, a pesar que viven en condiciones humildes han ido acondicionando su vivienda de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas. La necesidad del señor en estos momentos es la de levantar la pared lateral de su vivienda, la cual se encuentra deteriorada debido a la mala infraestructura con la que fue construida, por lo tanto requiere de botarla y volverla a levantar con material de buena calidad que resista, trabajo que realizara por su cuenta para brindar mejor seguridad a su vivienda y familia, este trabajo lo realizara los fines de semana y días libres ya que cuenta con trabajo actualmente.

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, sand and iron to reconstruct the side wall of his home.

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
Sri Widiyati lives in Jl.Palapa XI No 5 Denpasar together with her husband and their 3 children. They rented the land for Rp.1.000.000.- a year and build their own building on it. Their home is a simple and clean one.

Sri Widiyati and her husband run a laundry business since 2003. Their customers are those who live around Jl.Palapa. They only do laundry business activities on the afternoon, because they should run their other business: selling underwear in Batam Market, Kendal Suwung, in the morning until 12.00 a.m. Sri uses a motorcycle as her daily vehicle.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Sri Widiyati tinggal di Jl.Palapa XI No 5 denpasar dengan mengontrak tanah senilai Rp.1.000.000.- pertahun dan membuat bangunan sendiri diatasnya sebagai tempat tinggal bersama suami dan ketiga anaknya. Rumahnya cukup sederhana dan bersih. Usaha laundrynya sendiri sudah dimulai sekitar tahun 2003 dan pelanggannya kebanyakan adalah penduduk sekitar Jl.Palapa. Usaha laundry biasanya ditekuni pada siang hari sebab pada pagi harinya Ibu Sri W. mempunyai usaha menjual pakaian dalam di Pasar Batam Kendal Suwung. Usaha jual pakaiannya biasanya dari pagi sampai jam 12.00. Sebagai alat transportasi sehari-hari Ibu Sri menggunakan sepeda motor.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is divorced and has one son who is 28 years old. She began her business selling clothing in 2005. She went to Aguascalientes to purchase merchandise since it is cheaper there. She needed to generate some income since, when she separated from her husband, she lost the economic support that he provided.

Catalina needs a loan of US $350, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and fulfill the orders that she has. With your support, she will be able to continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Catalina es divorciada y tiene un hijo de 28 años. Comenzó el negocio de venta de ropa y blancos en el 2005, fue a Aguascalientes a comprar la mercancía ya que haya es mas barata. Ella tenia la necesidad de generar algún ingreso, ya que cuando se separo de su marido perdió el apoyo económico que el le brindaba.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir los pedidos que tiene. Con tu apoyo ella podrá seguir progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn K. is a vegetable seller in Rotaing Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Von Lon, is a vegetable farmer who cultivates for his wife to sell. Unfortunately, the vegetable revenue is not on time for Mrs. Khoeurn K. to sell; thus, Mrs. Khoeurn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell. Mrs. Khoeurn K. is 36 and the mother of five children, two of whom assist their father in the field while the three others are attending school. Presently, Mrs. Khoeurn K.’s youngest child got a lung disease and Mrs. Khoeurn K. spends an unforeseen expense on this. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Minh, 55 years old, has 3 children, 2 are grown up while 1 is still schooling. Before joining the Fund, her family faced many obstacle due to the lack of capital. In 1998, Mrs. Minh joined the Fund to borrow money and invest in breeding pigs. After 10 years, now her family's income has been more stable and her 2 grown up children have already had stable jobs. This time round, she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD) to purchase buffalos, assisting farming. Her family's average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (129USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh năm nay 55 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành 1 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi thma gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Năm 1998 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định. Hai con lớn của gia đình đã trưởng thành và đã có việc làm. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để mua trâu phục vụ cho sản xuất nông nghiệp. Thu nhập bình quân: 2.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising buffalo

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth S., 20, is employed by a garment factory and can make about $1.60 each day. Her husband, 22, is a motor-taxi driver transporting passengers to different locations, earning around $2.50 each day. There are five members in her family. Her oldest sister works as a farmer and her parent is too old to work. Mrs. Ruth S. and her husband have humbly requested for a loan to purchase a motor-bike to replace their old one. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Ruth S. is not available).

loans.use: Ruth would like to purchase another motor-bike to replace her old one.

loans.name: Preab

texts.en:
Preab R., 44, lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Tuy Soin, and their five children. The children range in age from 8-22 and the older two work in construction. Preab R. grows lettuce and various other vegetables to sell in the local food market. She typically makes US$2 per day from her business and her husband is a farmer who makes US$2.50 per day out in the fields. Their monthly expenses are around US$70 for food and US$25 for utilities, so the family is seeking ways to increase their income.

Preab R. has requested a loan of US$350 from CREDIT to purchase more fertilizer for her crops. She took over her vegetable business from her parents and would like to continue expanding in the future.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nubia Mayra

texts.es: La Sra. Nubia está solicitando  su financiamiento  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en el Nerpe el Triunfo desde hace 10 años, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de  15 años de edad estudia su tercer año de Educación secundaria la otra  hija  de 11 años estudia su quinto grado de Educación primaria y un niño menor de 8 años;  Nubia se ha destacado por ser responsable, trabajadora  y muy participativa en las actividades de su comunidad, su compañero de vida es comerciante este viaja a las colonias del Municipio de Nueva Guinea a vender y a comprar productos perecederos,  ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia pobre, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 12 meses y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, viven en un barrio de comarca el Triunfo donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que esta va adquiriendo con AFODENIC y se siente feliz de seguir trabajando con la institución,   sueña tener estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Nubia Lopez is seeking funding to invest in the improvement of her house (building a room). For the last 10-years, she has been working as a teacher in the Nerpe el Triunfo. She has 3 children: the oldest is 15-years old and is in the 3rd year of secondary school, the other daughter is 11-years old and is in the 5th grade and the youngest is 8-years old. Ms. Nubia is known for being responsible, hardworking and very active in the community. Her companion’s trade is to travel to the colonies of Municipal Nueva Guinea to sell and purchase perishable products. Both Nubia and her companion share in the expenses of their home as they are a poor family. This loan, which they believe will be repaid in 12-months, will gradually help them make improvements to their home. They live in the borough of Comarca el Triunfo, which each day seems to be increasing in population. Her dream is to have a better home with this loan from AFODENIC and she feels happy to continue working with the institution. She dreams of having a stable job, good health and that her children continue to study to be successful in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new room

loans.name: Senderos De Luz Group

texts.es: Hola nosotras somos el grupo Senderos de Luz, estamos ubicadas en el municipio de Las Trojes, nosotras siempre hemos trabajado juntas ya que somos vecinas de nuestra comunidad, nuestro grupo se integra asi:nSandra Suyapa V.: soy coordinadora del grupo, me dedico a la venta de verduras y golosinas, actividad que tengo de realizar hace 3 años, este negocio me permite tener ganancias para contribuir con los gastos de mi hogar.nMaria B.: ella y su esposo cuentan con un foto estudio, tienen varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos y necesitan varios materiales para poder sacar adelante a su negocio.nJuana R.: la actividad principal de ella es el comercio, ella vende ropa americana, tambien vende rosquillas y pan, ella tiene 2 años de estar haciendo esta actividad, este negocio le brinda los recursos economicospara contribuir con los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros adquiridos, ella no cuenta con capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de ropa.ntodas necesitamos un credito para poder capitalizarnos y asi invertir en nuestros negocios, tambien queremos implementar nuevos servicios que nos generen muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Senderos de Luz (Paths of Light) group, we are located in the municipality of Las Trojes. We have always worked together as we are neighbours in our community. That is how our group formed. Sandra Suyapa V.: I am the group coordinator. I sell vegetables and sweets and have been doing so for three years. The business' profits allow me to help with the household expenses. Maria B.: She and her husband have a photo studio. They have had it for several years. This is their only source of income and they need some materials in order to improve their business. Juana R.: She is in sales. She sells American clothing. She also sells donuts and bread. She has been doing this for two years. The business gives her the economic means to contribute to family expenses and other financial commitments. She does not have the money to invest in buying clothes. We need the loan to be able to invest in ourselves and in our businesses. Also, we want to offer new services that would generate good income.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food, clothing and materials

loans.name: Jonscorner C Group

texts.en:
Greatery M., age 34, is widowed with 3 children (ages 18, 14, and 8). She has a café, which she began 9 years ago. She works from 6:00 AM until 2:00 AM and says she could definitely use a break! She is able to make a monthly profit of about $160.

Greatery has taken 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital, and she has paid it back successfully. Now, she is hoping for a new loan to increase her stock of beer and soda and make her café nicer and more comfortable.

Greatery will share this loan with subgroup C of the Jonscorner loan group. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Greatery is standing in the center in a yellow kitenge.

loans.use: To make her cafe nicer and increase her stock of drinks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice T. is 51 years old, married, with three children. Alice lives with her family in the suburb of Teshi located in the capital city of Accra. Her first born completed high school, while two children remain in junior high school. For 10 years, she has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, egg plant and onions; spices; and fish. Alice gets her vegetables and other goods from the major markets in Accra and then sells them to her customers. She says that food vendors come to buy in large quantities. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy goods in bulk and meet the demand of her customers. 

Alice is in the Awake Trust Bank group. The group members provide guarantees for one another as collateral. This allows them to access loans and provide support and assistance to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, spices and fish

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. The majority of people living in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Ram Maiya M. has five members including herself in her family. She has two sons and one daughter. Both her sons are studying in secondary level and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Her husband's name is Dharma Lal M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop 3 years ago. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled out of the shop's income. Therefore Mrs. M. is seeking a loan in the amount of Rs10,000 to buy timber to use to build furniture. Her husband makes different varieties of furniture: beds, tables, chairs, wardrobes, and so on.

loans.use: To buy lumber for furniture-making

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira Bucad is a mother to six children: Elvie – 16 years old, senior high school student; Clarissa – 15 years old, sophomore high school; Mary Jane – 13 years old, a graduating elementary student; Gilvies – 11 years old, grade five; Rosemarie – 9 years old, grade three and the youngest is two years old.  Her husband is a farmer and they are living in the the rural village of Pilitan Tumauini, Isabela. 

Elvira is engaged in the sari-sari store business (a community based store).  Aside from her store, she would also like to expand her hog raising business.  With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP4,000.00 that she can use to purchase two piglets and maybe 30 kilos of feed supply.  She will also use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store.  

She is hoping to uplift their living status through her patience and hard works in the business. Elvira also prays that all her children will someday finish their college education and hopefully have a better job in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and feed supply and commodities for her store

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is thirty-six years old. He is married with two kids, both of whom are in the basic school. He is a taxi driver and has been driving for the past six years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks passengers up from the local lorry station and takes them to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 50 pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head.

However, his business is in crisis of late because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs. He therefore requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi cab. This will allow him to resume business and earn income to support his family and get his kids back to school.

Collins belongs to the community group called Fervent Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To repair his taxi cab.

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor José H. se dedica a su negocio de venta de variedad de productos los cuales son comercializados por él mismo y es visitado a diario por su clientela.

Ha logrado sacar adelante el negocio por medio de los créditos que ha solicitado en Ceprodel y es por este motivo que hoy en día busca la forma de cómo salir adelante mejorando su situación económica y para ello ha acudido una vez mas a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito y así comprar sus productos para ofertarlos.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Mayoreo market of the city of Managua, José H. sells a variety of goods which he markets himself to customers who come to him daily. He has managed to build his business thanks to the loans he has received from Ceprodel and because of this he is looking once again to continue to improve his financial situation and so has once again approached Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy more goods to retail.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24 years old Rosemary M. from Mwanza. She is married. Rosemary has been running a African clothing business since 2008. She has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Rosemary works at the business for 12 hours per day, 5 days per week. Rosemary currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase shirts, trousers and vitenge (African cloths). In the future, she plans to open another business. Rosemary thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers and vitenge (African cloths)

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya  de l’association Sabali est constitué  de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  31ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour leur deuxième fois. Le  premier  prêt fut remboursé correctement. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la restauration, la vente de  savons traditionnels,  de médicaments et d’atiéké.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 sacs d’atiéké, de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et autres (pour la cuisine), 300 morceaux de savons traditionnels (farakourouni), et 10 emballages de médicaments. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant, en détail et quelques fois à crédit. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent avoir des montants conséquents pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle .
texts.en:
The Danaya group of the Sabali association is made up of married women with an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children. They live in monogamous families in Mancourani II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They are working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the second time. Their first loan was correctly reimbursed. They have various businesses, among others selling cooked food, traditional soap, medicines and atiéké (a semoulina flour).

With this new loan, they expect to buy 3 sacks of atiéké, 20 liters of cooking oil, and other things (for the kitchen); 300 pieces of traditional soap, and 10 packages of medicines. They buy their goods at the market of Médine in downtown Sikasso and in surrounding areas.

The merchandise is sold in various markets around Sikasso and in the residential neighborhoods to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash, retail, and sometimes on credit. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest invested back into their businesses.

The women of the Danaya group hope to be able to keep up a consistent stock of their goods so as to better satisfy their clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vanesa García tiene 32 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposo ayuda al negocio, es la venta de hierro de segunda, desde hace dieciséis años, comenzó reciclando hierro en la calle en  una jabalina, ahora vende hierro y estribos, y tiene dos trabajadores a su cargo, el cual ha podido ir mejorando y incrementado su negocio con los prestamos de Afodenic este es su onceavo crédito el cual va invertir en la compra de sesenta quintales de hierro para cubrir la demanda. Sus planes es poder tener una ferretería en donde pueda ofertar todos los productos.
texts.en:
Señora Karla Vanesa García is 32 years of age and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband helps with the business which is selling scrap iron. It's been 16 years since he started recycling iron in the streets in a "jabalina". Now he sells iron and shapes and has two employees working for him. He has been able to improve and expand his business with the loans fro AFODENIC. This is his eleventh loan which will be used to buy 60 quintals (six tons) of iron in order to keep up with demand. His plans are to be able to have a hardware store where he would be able to offer lots of products.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 tons of iron.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam D. is a widow with two children. They live in the Bayanzurh province of Ulaanbaatar. Her 21 year-old son is a local police officer and her 18 year-old daughter is a senior in high school.

Davaanyam has a small retail business in second-hand clothing. She started her business in 2008 by renting a small stall in "Hasu," a local shopping mall. She usually travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase imported second-hand clothes from the wholesale markets. Since the start in 2008, her business has been doing well and her business capital has increased from 350,000 to 800,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

In the near future, Davaanyam would like to expand her business because the demand for her clothes remains high in the local market. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes as she often runs out of inventory.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: She lives with a child who is currently in school at the community of Sefwi Dwenase in the western region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells “waakye”. Waakye is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetables, oil, beans, macaroni, meat, etc. to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the village bank ‘Nkunimdie’, which literally means Victory.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working in the agriculture sector for the past 8 years and in 2007, he decided to open his own business as a vegetable trade to start a new and more solid career. Today, Elie is requesting to borrow $700 to purchase merchandise in order to develop his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her poultry-raising and pig business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 49 years old. Annabelle is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Annabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Annabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mrs. Pho Y., 52, is a widow with two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. One son is employed full-time, and one daughter operates a grocery store out of the family’s home. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pho has been producing baysey for twenty years. Baysey is a kind of Khmer sacrificial item made of a section of banana tree trunk set on legs. Three, five, seven or nine layers of banana leaves rolled up into finger shapes are attached.

Pho is asking for $300 (her first loan) to help purchase more stock for her daughter’s grocery for Pchum Ben, an upcoming Khmer festival during which food is offered to Buddhist monks in the hope that such a deed will benefit the spirits of dead relatives.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her daughter's grocery store

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar Antonio L. García, tiene  50 años de edad, es casado y  junto a su compañera tiene un hijo todavía menor de edad. El señor Oscar tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Don Oscar dio inicio a su negocio hace 10 años, además en ese tiempo era dueño de un taxi que fue de donde se ayudo a proporcionarle capital al negocio, tiempo después vendió el taxi ya que le era más rentable para ingresar más dinero a la pulpería. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos variados para la pulpería, principalmente en la compra de granos básicos que es lo que las personas están priorizando en la actualidad en sus compras. Su sueño es llegar a establecer un negocio con suficiente capacidad económica para establecer una distribuidora que brinde productos a los precios más bajos y que incrementen sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar Antonio L. García is 50 years old, married, and has one dependent child. He operates a grocery store out of his home. At the time he opened his grocery store 10 years ago, Don Oscar also owned a taxi which he drove in order to provide the capital to establish his current business. He later sold the taxi because the grocery store proved to be more profitable.

His loan will be used to buy various products for the grocery store, with basic grains being at the top of his priority list. He hopes that his business will earn sufficient financial capital so that he can convert it into a distribution company that provides goods at lower prices and generates more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more goods

loans.name: Mr. Em Huy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Em H. is a villager I. Niel village I. TaK. province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Now he is applying a loan to buy a pump machine, construction supplies, and he would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Nut Saraem, is employed I. a garment factory. This couple has two children who are just four and two years old. 
Eight I. this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan Francisco R. esta separado de su pareja, el tiene su negocio establecido desde hace 2 años de abarrotes; inicio su otro negocio ubicado en un ejido cercano a nuestra ciudad; es por tal motivo que el esta tramitando este crédito para la inversión de mercancía en ambos negocios para que sigan dando fruto.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Francisco R. is separated from his partner, he has had an established grocery business for two years, he started another business located in a piece of land close to the city; he is requesting this loan to invest it in merchandise for both businesses to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Saied

texts.en:
Saied is a 52-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital city of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Saied has owned an accessory shop where he sells toys, home products (like dishes, home accessories etc…) and faux bijoux. Saied is special in his work because he offers a wide range of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Saied has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 

When Saied first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia owns a general store in their village. She has been managing it for years already and she hopes that it will further grow with the help of KIVA lenders. She hopes for a loan of PHP 5,000 to have additional capital to purchase more grocery items for her store. She plans to increase the number of items that she sells to attract more customers. In this way, her general store could become more profitable. 

Anatalia is a 48-year-old businesswoman. She has been married for 23 years to Mario who is a farmer. The couple is not yet blessed with kids and they don’t have anyone to support now except their selves. Their income from the business is being used for their daily expenses and some is saved for their future needs. The couple hopes to maintain their retail business in order to have a source of income to support their needs until they grow older.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her genreral store

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk B. is an older woman and the mother of two daughters, who are single ladies. Both of her daughters are employed: one is a garment worker and one works cooking meals for a restaurant. Ouk B. was married, but her husband died of senility. She currently walks to sell a few cakes that she produces from her home. Ouk B. is taking out her loan to repair her old house and to buy essential ingredients to make cakes for sale.

loans.use: To repair her old house and to buy essential ingredients to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Javier Álvarez vive en el Centro Poblado Juan Velazco Alvarado perteneciente al distrito de Santiago en casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus menores hijos. Actualmente labora como obrero de campo en parcelas de la zona alternando labores en la empresa North Bay del Perú SA. Su esposa también realiza labores de campo en la empresa Gourmet Farms Perú SRL. No posee endeudamiento en ninguna entidad financiera. Solicita crédito para continuar con mejoras progresivas de su vivienda ya que ésta es de caña y adobe. Son personas muy trabajadoras que con sus ahorros producto de su trabajo han comprado su terreno y acondicionado su vivienda para sus hijos. Su sueño es logar construir su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Álvarez agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar para alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Javier Álvarez lives in the central town of Juan Velazco Alvarado, part of the district of Santiago, in his own house with his wife and his small children. He currently works as a field labourer in smallholdings in the area, alternating with work for the company North Bay del Perú SA. His wife also does field labour for the company Gourmet Farms Perú SRL. He does not have any debts with any financial institution. He is requesting a loan in order to continue work with better progress on their house, which is made of straw and sun-dried brick. They are very hardworking people who, with their savings from their work, have bought their land and made a suitable home for their children. Their dream is to succeed in building their house and to be able to offer a better quality of life to their children. Mr. Álvarez is grateful for the support that we can offer him to attain his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of housing

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Marisol es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, de profesión Enfermera, Marisol tiene un molino en su casa en donde procesa cereales variados, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados y tiendas.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quinua y haba.
Los sueños de Marisol son tener una empresa grande y vender al mercado local y regional.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Tulipanes ("Tulips") communal bank. Marisol is 35 years old and has a common-law husband and 2 children. She is a nurse by profession. Marisol has a mill in her home, where she processes a variety of foods. Her products are sold in markets and stores. Marisol needs a loan of 750 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing quinoa and dry beans. Marisol's dream is to have a large business and sell her products on the local and regional market.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing quinoa and dry beans

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is thirty-one years old. Mercy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling eggs in the local community. Mercy is just starting this business. She was able to engage in the food-vending business with a previous loan.

In 2009, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand the number of products she could offer. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Mercy's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benigno Octavio

texts.es:
El señor Benigno P. labora arduament como agente de seguridad en un centro de labores en el municipio de Somotillo. Es un caballero muy trabajador y que preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y por el mejoramiento de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones.

La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloque,  zinc, arena, perlin y otros para mejorar la vivienda y así tener mejor condición de vida él y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Benigno Octavio P. works as a security guard at a labor center in the municipality of Somotillo. He is a very hardworking man that is very concerned about the well being of his family and improving his home which is currently in bad conditions. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy construction materials like concrete blocks, zinc, sand, timber and other items to improve his home and living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and enlarge his home

loans.name: Laura Marcela

texts.es:
Laura Marcela F. y su esposo están preocupados por el bienestar de su familia, en este momento están pasando por un momento tan difícil. La mama del señor se encuentra enferma y los medicamentos que le están pidiendo están muy caros. 
Laura esta preocupada por la salud de su suegra y la estabilidad de su esposo es por ello que quiere un préstamo para poder comprar las medicinas para que la salud de su suegra mejore.
texts.en:
Laura Marcela F. and her husband are worried for the well-being of their family, and at this point they are going through a difficult time. Her husband's mother is sick and the medication that she needs are very expensive. Laura is worried about her mother-in-law's health and her husband's stability, and it is for these reasons that she requests a loan to be able to buy the medication to improve her mother-in-law's health.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medication

loans.name: Carmen Esther

texts.es:
Carmen Esther es una mujer proactiva, a sus 37 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 5 y uno que recién acaba de nacer, trabaja con EDAPROSPO prosperidad desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de CD, MP3, VCD, desde hace 10 años,  además vende flores artificiales, desde hace 4 meses, el cual lleva por nombre “ROSAS”, y recientemente acaba de inaugurar una cabina de internet el cual lo puso con el desembolso de diciembre del 2009, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado dar una mejor educación a sus hijos, ha comprado un repostero, una computadora, ha hecho el piso de su vivienda, y ha mejorado su calidad de vida. 
El gran sueño de Carmen, es mejorar el acabado de su vivienda y comprarse un carro para movilizar su mercadería. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra cuadros locerías y habilitar mas cabinas de internet. Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a salir adelante y a prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Esther is a proactive woman. She is 37 years old and married, with four children ages 18, 16, and 5, and a newborn. She has worked with EDAPROSPO Prosperity for 5 years. She has sold CDs, MP3s, and DVDs for 10 years. In addition, four months ago she began selling artificial flowers, which go by the name "rosas." She just recently opened an internet kiosk, which she set up with the December 2009 disbursement. With the force of her daily labor, she has succeeded in giving her children a better education, she has bought a pastry shop and a computer, she has put a floor in her home, and she has improved her quality of life. Carmen's great dream is to improve the finishing of her home and buy a car to carry her merchandise. The recently granted loan will be invested in the purchase of dishes and pictures and in setting up more internet kiosks. Carmen is very appreciative of all the support offered, because it has helped her and her family advance and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: by pictures, dishes, and set up more internet kiosks

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sérieux est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles  traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux, dans le village de Sido, préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce.
Afin de satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe, après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent acheter, 35 boites de 2kg de concentrée de tomate, 25 sacs de 25kg de sel de cuisine, 60 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses autres qualités de condiments.
