Les produits sont achetés auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les être revendus ensuite dans le marché Sido à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les frais d’habillements et santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The group Sérieux (« serious ») is composed of married women with an average age of 28 and five children. They live in traditional families made larger by their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children, and husbands, in the village of Sido, Bougouni prefecture, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women met through business relationships. In order to satisfy their growing number of clients, they decided to join the microfinace institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to sell condiments. They are on their sixth group loan, after having fully reimbursed the five previous loans. With this loan the women plan to buy 35 2-kilo cans of tomato paste, 25 25-kilo bags of culinary salt, 60 100-cube packages of “Maggi” boullion, and various other condiments. They get supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, then resell at the Sido market to a clientele composed essentially of woman, retail for cash and credit. With this loan the women hope to make a monthly profit of 35,000CFA which will be used for their children's clothing and health expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of culinary condiments

loans.name: Jose Abdon

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 31506 	No. de Foto: 213

Josè Abdón G. S. tiene 42 años, es viudo, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 
Josè trabaja en la agricultura,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz  ademas se dedica a la cría de animales como: vacuno, porcino y ovino.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

La familia tiene la costumbre de compartir con los vecinos de la comunidad los días festivos, además le gusta los juegos deportivos como es  dolí y fútbol.

 El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos y la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Josè Abdón G. S. is 42 years old, is widowed and has 3 children. He lives near San Miguel in the Bolívar province.

The member is a part of La Palmera communal bank it is in a rural area, and it is an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel. There are 16 members in total, it is an agricultural community and a few are cattle-dealers.

Josè works in agriculture to increase his families’ finances. The crop that stands out in production is corn; he also raises animals like cattle, pigs and sheep.

The family has the habit of sharing the holidays with their neighbors and he enjoys sports like dolí and football (soccer).

Josè needs the loan to buy goods for field work and above all for fertilizers and manure. His goal is to have a good economic activity for the family and to buy a car for work. The challenges that he faces are due to climate, the diseases that hurt his crops and the lack of money to buy goods for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds for production.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Daniel K. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “In God We Trust”. He is 31 years old, is married, and has a 5-month-old child. He also cares for his parents.

For nine years Daniel has been selling medicines at the S. D. Cooper Road Market in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells at an ideal location and gives his business center good maintenance in order to keep customers returning.

Daniel's goal and dream is to expand his business to other locations outside of Montserrado County. He will use his 16,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 83,500 Liberian dollar loan to purchase more medicines to sell. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Daniel is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling hair extensions, hairpieces, etc.

loans.name: Jerrylin

texts.en:
Jerrylin S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jerrylin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes to be successful in all her ventures.
Jerrylin joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jerrylin is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and feed for the pigs. This loan will be her fifth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and pig feed

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Luisa es madre de tres hijos, de edad de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de poder ayudar siempre  a sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta de fritanga que día  a día hace por las tardes para vender, en frente de su casa, bajo un bajarete pone una mesa y sus comida de pollo frito, asado, carne, enchiladas, tajada verde y madura. 

Este negocio lo inicio hace varios años con el objetivo de poder ayudar a su familia a cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz y alimentación ya que la canasta Básica esta muy cara, y solo con el salario de su esposo no da. 
Con este préstamo invertirá en mas cantidad de carne, pollo, verduras, para hacer mas fritanga ya que por las ventas bajas a veces no vende toda la comida y es una perdida, es por eso necesita trabajar con mas capital para cubrir la demanda en su pequeño comedor.
Contenta por que a través de estos prestamos ha logrado la inversión.
texts.en:
Luisa, a mother of three, is 44 years old. She is a hard working woman and wants to be able to help her children. She sells the fried food she makes every afternoon just outside her home, where she displays fried chicken, roast, meat, enchiladas and vegetable slices on a table beneath a pergola. She started the business a few years ago to help her family meet water, power and food expenses as everything is very dear and her husband's salary wasn't enough. She will use the loan to buy more meat, chicken and vegetables to make more fried food, because sometimes due to low sales she doesn't sell all the food and it goes to waste so she needs more capital to meet the demand in her small food stand. She is happy because in the past she has managed to use the loans to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, chicken, bananas and coal to increase the range of food she sells

loans.name: Cleide

texts.es:
Cleide es casada y tiene 2 hijas que estudian, Cleide junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería llamada Carlitos, fabrican los muebles según pedido de sus clientes, tienen 2 ayudantes y Cleide ayuda en el lijado y laqueado de los productos. Cleide tiene proyectado comprar un carro para facilitar el traslado de los muebles. Además Cleide trabaja en una empresa privada.
Cleide es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita y solicita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
texts.en:
Cleide is married and has two children who are both in school. Cleide, along with her husband, have a carpentry shop named "Carlitos". They make furniture according to the requests of their clients. They have two assistance and Cleide helps in the sanding and laquering of the products. Cleide plans to buy a car to faciliate the transportation of the furniture. Cliede also works in a private business. Cleide is a partner in the communal bank Santa Rita and is seeking a loan of 1800 Soles that she will invest in the purchase of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea  N., age 36,  and is a villager who lives in Trapeang Krasang village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Lanh, are farmers who own a plot of land cultivate rice. With the farm, they still earn less income to support the family. Thus, in order to increase income to improve the family, Mrs. Thea  N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle to support her husband motorcycle taxi driver. This couple has four children, two are attend in the local school and two are too young and are not to study yet. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to support her husband motorcycle taxi driver.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. is currently in the business of selling local brew at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials such as yeasts, etc.

Margret is 47 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a small bar.

loans.use: To stock more brewing materials such as yeasts, etc.

loans.name: Katente Unity, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Joseph B., the group leader is in the small photo at the top left corner.

Fror 3 years Joseph has overseen his bar business in Musomba, Mubende. He started the bar with his savings after getting advice from friends. In here, he sells soft drinks like sodas, beer, wines and local gins which he does alongside farming. Once his business got on a firm footing, he was  able to make the best out of it. 

In a month, this focused married father of 8 children, gets 400,000 Ugandan shillings as his monthly profit. With this money he has managed to cater to all his children’s education needs and general family welfare. He has come to grips with some inevitable business challenges and has never lost heart. The determination he carries around  means he is full of optimism that the future of his business will be bright. He is requesting a loan to be able to revamp his business with more stock purchases.

loans.use: To restock his business with sodas, beers, wines and local gins

loans.name: Ynocente

texts.es: Ynocente, de 47 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mila de 45 años y su único hijo Renzo de 16 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La siembra de papa, espinaca y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica Ynocente, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, ya que saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educación de su hijo les demanda muchos gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días, espera cosechar sus productos y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja, espinacas y papa, también comprará abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ynocente is 47 years old and is a simple hard working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 45 year old Mila, and his only son, 16 year old Renzo. He wants to give them a better quality of life. He raises potatoes, spinach, and peas. Every morning, Ynocente works his land to make it more fertile and productive and he and his wife work together very hard. They know that they must work all they can because their son’s education is expensive. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and preventing them from getting disease. He’s been doing this for 32 years and he considers the most difficult part to be transporting his goods to the market in Tarma, where he sells his harvest. Within a few days he expects to harvest his current crops and sell them for a good price in the market. This will be his fifth loan through MFP and he knows that he must make all of his payments on time, so as not to cause problems for his communal bank. There his is a very responsible member. He will use the 2,000 PEN ($725) from this loan to buy new seed for peas, spinach, and potatoes. He will also buy fertilizer to care for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Progress Family Group

texts.en:
Thomas T., holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Progress Family. He is 42 years old, married, and has seven children between the ages of 8 and 25. He was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For seven years, he has sold door locks, toothbrushes, shoes polish, soap etc. in Via Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to increase his inventory. He describes himself as a friendly man whose goals are to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is married to Ceasar B., who is 41 years old and a farmer. They have six children ranging in age from 2 months to 7 years old. The family lives in Sitio-Lawis within the barangay of Mainggit, a part of Toledo City on Cebu island. Evangeline earns her living by selling vegetables.

Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her fifth loan cycle, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Evangeline B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is a resident of Khanewal, which is an agricultural city in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house there and lives in it with her family. She is 28 years old and a very hard-working lady. She does labor work to financially support her family. Her husband, K. M., is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at his home from which he gets milk and generates income for the family. 

Farhat is the mother of two daughters and two sons. The first three children are studying in a local school. It is Farhat’s greatest desire to provide her children a quality education so they become successful in life and make their parents proud. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo and increase the milk production. She is hopeful that her husband’s income will increase by selling more milk.  

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Farhat”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 30-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married with two children and lives in a rented house. Julius’ dream is to see his family living in his own house and says he is working so hard to achieve it, educating his children and boosting the wife’s business. He has been into the poultry business for three years and hasn’t had any hardships, which makes him feel that his business is bound to grow even more. Julius needs this loan to buy more chicks for his poultry farm so that when they mature he can sell eggs and even broilers for meat.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis J. M. is 63 years old. He lives in the village of Luchadores Sociales in the district of Tambogrande. It is a tropical area that has many small fruit plantations. Luis owns his home and shares it with his wife and their two children.

Luis has a medium-sized fruit plantation on which he grows mangoes and limes. He tends to his trees on a regular basis and harvests his fruit weekly. He also has a herd of cattle, which he maintains on property near his home.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other supplies to support the growth of his fruit. He hopes to be able to increase production slightly in the near term in order to increase his income and be able to make additional investments.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other supplies to support the growth of his fruit

loans.name: Las Abejitas - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Rosario Estela S. N., integrante del grupo: " Las Abejitas - Chupaca".
Rosario es conviviente, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 09 y 03 años de edad, ella quedó huerfana de padres a los 15 años, teniendo a cargo sus dos hermanos menores de 10 y 08 que actualmente ya son mayores de edad, para poder mantener a sus hermanos empezó a trabajar como cobradora de transporte pùblico; asì empezó a ahorrar y conoció a su esposo quièn también la apoyó ya que èl trabajaba como chofer de combi, los dos trabajaron hasta lograr comprar su propio carro, el cual ahora es su fuente principal de ingresos. 
Pero el apoyo que ella brindò a sus hermanos nunca quedó olvidado por ello también adicionalmente ayuda a sus hermanos en sus trabajos, y ahora sus dos hermanos menores tambièn cuentan con sus propios autos que los han puesto ha trabajar como taxis.
El sueño de Rosario es poder lograr comprarse una combi para obtener mayores ingresos y con ello poder seguir construyendo su casa.
El uso del crédito serà para el mantenimiento de su automovil, y la compra de llantas.
(en la foto Rosario es la primera de la derecha, viste jeans azul y chompa color beige)
texts.en:
Rosario Estela S. N., member of the “Las Abejitas-Chupaca” (The Little Bees-Chupaca) group.

Rosario lives with her husband (unmarried) and their two children who are 9 and 3 years of age.  She was orphaned at the age of 15 and had two younger brothers, 10 and 8, in her care.  They are now adults.  To support them she started working as a fare taker on public transportation.  She started to save up and also met her husband who also helped her since he worked as a minivan driver.  Both of them worked until they were able to buy their own car which is now their main source of income.

The help she gave her brothers was never forgotten, however, and she still helps them with their work.  Her two younger brothers also have their own cars that they have put into taxi service.

Rosario’s dream is to be able to buy herself a minivan to have more income and continue building her house.

She will use the loan to service her car and buy tires.

(In the photo Rosario is the first one on the right, wearing blue jeans and a beige sweater)

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Rodelyn is married and has 2 children aged 18 and 10. To make a living, Rodelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodelyn works hard to sustain her family and have savings in case of emergencies. 

Rodelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rodelyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer

loans.name: James Mugenda

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 28 years old, married to Teresiah Wambui and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilzer and pesticides for his farm.

In future, James hopes to start a auto spares shop in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilzer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is from the village of Madalag. She is 42 years old and is a group member of PMPC. She is married and has eight children. To make a living,  Violeta operates a business which is a plantation of seaweed (also known in the community as "agar-agar"). The harvest is carried out after the plantation has been in the sea for three months: it is then dried in the drier after which it is ready to be sold. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Violeta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 2,500 PHP which will be used to provide additional capital for buying materials for her business. This will be the fifth loan that Violeta has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for buying materials for her business

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita C. is a married woman who lives in Aguinaldo, Calubang, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband, Hernany, who is 57 years old, works as a Barangay Tanod (village policeman) to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 19 and 31 years old. 

Florita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $233, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children’s education and house expansion. Florita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 32 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NOB SA JËKËR.

Madame NDEYE MADY FANTA D. debout à tout à fait à droite de la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de son neveux 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques, des vêtements, de l'huile d epalme etc. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son bas âge.

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d'escompter des bénéfices plus importants. 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille tout renforçant son niveau d'épargne au niveau du Banc villageois
texts.en:
The DEGGO solidarity group was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of 32 women from the same neighborhood. They came together as neighbors and by affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois NOB SA JËKËR.

Mrs. NDEYE MADY FANTA D., standing at the far right of the photo and shown inset, is the head of the group. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of four dependent children. She also has a nephew in her care.

She has a small business selling cosmetic products, clothes, palm oil, etc. She started practicing this activity at an early age. Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business and bolster her profits.

Her goal is to help support the family financially while increasing her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Rosa Lila

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Lila C., es profesora de primaria tiene  quince años de ser maestra, se le han financiado diez crédito los ha utilizado para compra de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra, cemento, piedrín y otros. Para mejorar su vivienda. Todos sus créditos le han beneficiado en gran parte a toda su familia ya que ahora tienen una casita bonita. Que le agradece a ceprodel por todas las oportunidades que se le han brindado y espera que se le siga apoyando.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosa Lila C. is a primary school teacher and she has 15 years as a teacher. She has had ten past loans and she has used them to purchase construction materials such as sand, rocks, cement, gravel and other materials in order to improve her house. All of her loans have helped her family a great deal because she now has a beautiful little home. She is thankful to Ceprodel for all of the opportunities that they have given and she hopes that she will continue to have their support.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, rocks, and gravel

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is an ambitious married man with three children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the butcher business for four years. His business is now in its boom stage despite the challenge of the high costs of cows. Joseph's dream is to set up three shops in town. He needs this loan to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy more cows to butcher.

loans.name: Kahati

texts.en:
Kahati M. is a widow with one married child. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food. For over 30 years, she has operated a makuti (palm leaves used in roofing houses) business, selling as retail to house contractors and those with business premises. 

The business has helped and improved her mode of living. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation in the business. Kahati dreams of expanding the business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase more palm leaves for sale. She joined Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves to sell for roofing houses

loans.name: Celia Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Celia Aydee tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada a fuera de su casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que desea vender ropa nueva y de mejor calidad y moderna, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del las ventas del negocio, ya que su esposo  Antonio se encargara de los gastos de la familia. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más mercancía y así en un futuro poder poner un local y así poder darle trabajo y ayudar a otra persona.
texts.en:
Celia Aydee has been selling used clothing in front of her house for more than four years.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the business. She would like to sell new, higher-quality, modern clothing, but she doesn’t have the money necessary for the investment.

She will pay the loan with the earnings she will have from her sales; her husband, Antonio, takes care of the family’s expenses.

She wants for her business to have more merchandise so that in the future she can open a store. That way she could provide a job to someone else, and help out that person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: En

texts.en:
Mrs. En H. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Bunthin Roeung, live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have four daughters. Two are in school and the other two are still young. 

Mrs. En H. stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary. He is a driver, he drives for a brick kiln.

En wants to launch a food vending  business by selling boiled duck eggs, roasted beef, and roasted chicken wings, so she is asking for a loan of $100.

loans.use: to launch a food vending business

loans.name: Dominic Kariithi

texts.en: Dominic has been a farmer in Naivasha town for the past 16 years.  He is 51 years old, married, and has three children.  He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, 36 years old, lives in the community of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He is a rice farmer and a piggery owner. He has been into this business for eight years. His monthly income from his business is 20,000 Philippines pesos (Php).

Through a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., he can buy farm and agricultural supplies like fertilizers. He could also buy pig feeds and pay the school fees of his children.

Edwin has two sons. His dream is to become a successful rice-farm owner and to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig feeds.

loans.name: Las Animas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Animas". Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Victoria es una integrante del grupo. Tiene 25 años estudio la secundaria, esta casada y tiene una niña de tres años. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces negocio que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar dulces de diferentes marcas y sabores para tener mayor variedad en los gustos de sus clientes que la mayoria son niños quienes comentan que la señora es muy linda con ellos porque los trata bien y siempre tiene lo que ellos le piden. Con las ganancias quiere ahorrar para más adelante poder invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es comprar un horno de microondas para poder vender palomitas, café, y otros productos. También desea mejorar su negocio para brindarle esducación a su hija ya que le gustaria verla algun día con una carrera profesional y así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida logrando sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Animas" and is located in Mexico. It is made up of nine members. Señora Victoria is one of the members of this group. She is 25 years old, has a high school education, is married and has a three year old daughter. Two years ago she started a business selling candy. 

She is requesting a loan to buy candies of different brands and flavors to have more variety for the tastes of her customers, who are mostly children who say that she treats them very kindly and always has what they ask for. 

She wants to save the profits so that she can later invest them in her business, as it is her dream to buy a microwave so that she can sell popcorn, coffee and other products. She also wants to improve her business in order to provide for her daughter's education. One day she would like to see her daughter with a professional career so that she can have a better quality of life and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy candies of different brands and flavors.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is aged 35 and married with 3 children, two of whom are currently attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last fifteen years in his hometown in western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables and eggs which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his business of making and selling bricks locally. His primary challenges have been insufficient animal feed and diseases which affect his production.

Eliud has made a loan request of 62,400 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that with the dairy cow, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from this project will help him support his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arzar's Group

texts.en:
Arzar is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a taxi driver.  With her husband, she is raising two daughters and two sons. The youngest daughter studies at university and the other children are employed. Arzar works as a teacher at school.  In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, she breeds livestock and then sells it at a higher price. In this way she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. 

With money received from the loan, Arzar wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to purchase a piece of land for building a house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ena del Rosario, mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos y gaseosas. Este negocio lo inicio con su tía cuando enfrento una crisis económica ya que pudo seguir desempeñándose como orfebre. 
Con la ayuda de su suegra quien le regalo el carretón, el termo, los baldes, la refrigeradora y materia prima para poner su propio negocio. Es así que desde hace nueve años inicio su negocio el cual ha ido creciendo actualmente ella invertirá en azúcar, frutas, baldes y azúcar.
texts.en:
Ena del Rosario is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who sells soft drinks and carbonated beverages.  She started this business with her aunt when she faced an economic crisis, although she could continue to work as a goldsmith.

Her mother-in-law helped her by giving her a cart, a cooler, pails, refrigerator, and supplies to set up her own business.  She started this business nine years ago and it has been growing since.  She will invest the money into sugar, fruit, pails, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pails, and fruit.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a single lady who is 47 years old. She runs a cereals business and is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by a friend. She intends to use the money to buy maize, beans, and rice for resale.

Emily hopes to see her business expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Osman Antonio

texts.es: Osman trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace mas de 20 años, desempeñandose como operador de maquinaria. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorando las condiciones de su casa, esta vez construyendo un muro que le ayudara a dar salida al agua en este tiempo de invierno. Sueña con poder darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida para vivir con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Osman has been working as a machinery operator for Juigalpa council for more than 20 years.  He is requesting his second loan so that he can continue improving his housing conditions, this time building a wall that will help provide an outlet for water during the winter season.  He dreams of being able to provide his family with better living conditions so that they can live peacefully.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en: Mrs.Tsetsegee is a 62-year-old transport driver. She lives with her husband, daughter and her niece in Ulaanbaatar – the capital city of Mongolia. This year, her niece is going to enter college. Tsetsegee’s profession is an auto mechanic and she has worked in her profession for 20 years in a transportation bureau. Currently she runs a transportation business with a minivan in a transportation company named Shine Uul LLC. She started in 2001. Her minivan is becoming very old and is running badly. It is in a dangerous condition to transport passengers. Therefore, she needs to repair her minivan immediately. She is requesting a loan to purchase some spare parts to renovate her transportation minivan.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts to renovate her transportation minivan.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena has been selling plantain in Jukwa for over 20 years. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more plantain from Techiman. Abena is divorced and has seven children and so she is entirely responsible for providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy more plantain

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 34 years old, married and has three children. He runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Previously, he used to farm. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and access loans easily.
Moses hopes to buy a lorry for his transport business within five years. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike

loans.name: Erika Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Erika tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija y vive con su tía.

Ella se dedicaba a cursar sus estudios de bachillerato y desde hace un año aprendió de su tía el oficio de panificación y desde entonces esa es su fuente de ingresos.

La señora Erika, compra los insumos para  elaborar el pan en tiendas y supermercados en una ciudad de la zona oriental, ella sale muy de mañana a comprar los insumos y luego regresa a la casa a preparar el pan, luego otras personas se lo compran para salirlo a revender.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de las diferentes variedades de pan que produce. Por que necesita ampliar el negocio ya que la demanda de los clientes es mucha debido a que su pan es de buena calidad.

Con los ingresos generados por su negocio ella pretende mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y de su tía. El sueño de Erika es poder comprar un terreno donde construir su vivienda y darle a su hija la educación que necesita para que pueda desarrollarse en su vida.
texts.en:
Erika, 20, is a single mother of a daughter and lives with her aunt.  She used to go to high school but a year ago learned how to bake bread from her aunt and since then that’s been her source of income.

Erika buys the ingredients for the bread in stores and supermarkets in a city in the east zone.  She goes out very early to buy the ingredients and then returns home to make the bread which others buy from her to resell.

She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy raw materials for the various types of bread she makes because she needs to expand the business because customer demand is high due to the good quality of her bread.

With income generated by her business she intends to improve her daughter’s and her aunt’s quality of life.  Erika’s dream is to buy a piece of land to build her house and provide an education for her daughter so that she can develop in life.

loans.use: to buy bread baking raw materials.

loans.name: Seluia

texts.en:
Seluia is 28 years of age and married with one child. She has owned and operated a business selling baked goods in the local community for 1 year. Seluia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase baking powder, sacks of flour and sugar and an oven.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2011, Seluia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Seluia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking powder, flour, sugar and an oven

loans.name: Ryan Jay

texts.en:
Ryan Jay is married with 2 kids. He is 28 years old and he is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is a fisherman. His picture is taken when he was in the office applying for a financial assistance. He comes from the market to sell his fish with his contract buyer.He owns and operates a business in the food sector, selling his own caught fish to earn a living.  He has had this business for more than 8 years and earns 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this type of work.

Ryan Jay has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a new engine for his pump-boat and to purchase fish for resale. He has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, he will use his returns to provide for the needs of his family and to educate his two kids.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his pump-boat and to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Sabina, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee with two children who are still going to school. She has been running two businesses as a food vendor and clothes seller for two years now.  She works from 6:30 a.m to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and started selling clothes.

loans.use: to increase her food stock.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulpería en su casa de habitación lleva 10 años con este negocio, es casada, madre de 2 hijos de 24 y 19 años de edad. Ella inicio con su negocio vendiendo golosinas y galletas, 2 bolsas de pan dulce, fue poco a poco comprando y vendiendo , puso este negocio con el objetivo de tener una actividad que le permitiera estar cerca de sus hijos y que al mismo tiempo generara ingresos para aportar en su hogar y pagar la educación de sus hijos. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, enlatados, sopas. Pues el crédito le permitirá adquirir productos de los cuales carece y sus clientes le solicitan a diario. Una de sus metas es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Granada.  She is a shopkeeper and has a grocery store which is located in her home.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  María is married and has two children who are 24 and 19 years old.  She started out in her business selling candies, cookies and 2 bags of sweet bread.  She gradually bought and sold more.  María set up this business with the aim of having a business that would allow her to be near her children and, at the same time, make income so that she could contribute towards her household and pay for her children's education.

María needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soda, juice, canned food and soups.  Her loan will allow her to acquire products that she lacks and which her customers are requesting every day.  One of her goals is to turn her grocery store into a food wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soda, juice, canned food and soups

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 40años, empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos yambal ya que vive solo y de esta manera sale adelante con sus hijos.

Trabaja sola todos los días sin horarios fijos, recorriendo las casas de los amigos, y familiares.
La delincuencia es el mayor problema que presenta en su trabajo. Es madre soltera quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante con sus 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Quiere seguir con su negocio por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar perfumes, cosmeticos. Su meta es poder seguir adelante con su negocio para de esta manera ascender en su trabajo y tener una oficina de trabajo y su propio carro.
texts.en:
Ana is 40. She started selling Yambal products, as she is on her own, and this is a way for her and her children to get ahead in life. She works on her own every day, without set hours, visiting the homes of friends and family members.  Crime is the greatest problem that arises in her work. 

She is a single mother who works very hard to move forward with her two children, ages eleven and nine, who go to high school. She wants to continue with her business, and that's why she wants the loan to buy perfumes, and cosmetics. 

Her goal is to be able to keep her business going, so that she can move up in her work, have an office, and her own car.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and lipsticks

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, 24, is single and has no children yet. She is an honest, principled, and God-fearing lady. She sells dresses and material to retail customers. She has been in this business for one year. Margaret's business challenge is insufficient funds to expand her business. She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy material for clothes. She looks forward to expanding her business and having four employees within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy material for clothes.

loans.name: Reinario

texts.en:
Reinario is a 44-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has no children yet. 

Reinario has been in the business of raising pigs for three years. Reinario earns 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month raising pigs. Reinario also runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. He works hard to improve his income. He plans to use his loan to purchase piglets and feed. Reinario hopes to save for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Tutulu

texts.en:
Tutulu is eighteen years of age and is married with one child. Tutulu owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Tutulu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase soft drinks, snacks, bag of rice,sugar,salt , cookies , ctn of fish herring.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tutulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tutulu's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, snacks, bag of rice,sugar,salt , cookies and ctn of herring

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Paulita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Paulita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Paulita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kabukye United Group

texts.en:
Susan deals in selling cereals like maize and rice in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of eight children and all are able to acquire an education. Susan does farming to increase her income. She wishes to build a permanent home .However, she is challenged by the weather and poor roads to transport her cereals to the market.
 
She is a member of a Kabukye United Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan. 

Susan is accessing a loan to buy more cereals such as maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cereals such as maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 43 years of age and a go-getter. She hails from Gakui, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has bad terrain and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Aileen has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past three years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Aileen passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows and whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. Aileen is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. The Nkubu area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Aileen is much disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Kavule Devt- Bweyogerere Group

texts.en:
Christine- a member of Kavule development is a new client in Ugafode microfinance who has applied for aloan of 500.000/= She is a married woman with children.
        She is a business woman who trades in groceries. In bid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 500,000/= that she will use to buy more groceries since her challenge has been limited capital, which she feels will soon belong to the past courtsey of  kiva generosity.
Christine is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business as well as eduacte her children.
All the pictured are group members though three of them have a different loan term, they signed the waiver form though.

loans.use: To buy stock of groceries for trade

loans.name: Reshat

texts.en: Reshat M. was born in Varna but lives in Silistra since he was 10 years old because his family moved there. He is 47 years old and has worked as a constructor for over 10 years. In 1996 because of the political and ecomic crisis in Bulgaria he left the country and went to  Germany where he has some relatives. There he worked in a fruit and vegatable grocery and when in 2001 came back to Bulgaria he decided to open such a grocery in Silistra. His grocery is in one of the biggest quarters in the town and is always very good supplied. Now Reshat M. applies for a $ 1200 loan which he will spend on a new electronic balance.

loans.use: For a new electronic balance.

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en:
4 years ago this 55-year-old man decided to open a grocery store.
Having borrowed $400 he bought foodstuffs.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of his store.
Arzuman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village and is married and has 3 children.

loans.use: To expand the area of his store

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en: Iokapeta is a 46-year old mother, married with 7 children. Her 5 older children have successfully finished school and are now working.  Her two youngest children are still in school.  Iokapeta is justifiably very proud of having provided an education for her oldest children, and she is determined to keep the younger two in school as well.  She admits that all this wouldn’t have been possible without the income from her banana plantation.  She has used SPBD loans to build up this plantation to where it is today, providing a steady income, and thus a means to making real improvements in the family’s standard of living.  She has used four previous SPBD loans to achieve this and having repaid these loans in full and on time, she is eligible for a fifth loan that she will use for making some much-needed repairs to her home.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Abulfaz

texts.en: Abulfaz is forty-five years old, married, and lives in Khachmaz town with his wife and two children. Abulfaz has sold shirts for three years now, and would like a loan of $825 to increase and vary the range of his goods.

loans.use: to increase and  vary his goods

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married man with one child. He has the best video library and public address system in Kayunga town. He has been in this business for eight years and has seen it grown over the years. He started with 20 Video tapes and now has over 200 video tapes and 100 DVDs. His daily income is about US$60 and he hopes this number will increase this season. He is planning to buy more DVDs, especially Nigerian films commonly called “Ekinigeria”, because they are watched by a good number of the population.

loans.use: Edward wants to buy a new VCD, DVD writer and a modern music system to attract a good clientele.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda has a small business selling women’s clothing and shoes as well as children’s shoes from her attractively-arranged kiosk at the Albion Rhinok (market) in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Nadezhda’s business, which she has had for about five years, provides most of the income for her and her husband who also works but does not receive a very large salary. In a typical month, she makes about $700 in profit. Nadezhda has two daughters who are married. She tries to help her grandchildren when she can. Not long ago, Nadezhda’s father passed away, which left her with some unanticipated expenses.

Nadezhda has requested a short-term loan of $500 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase new inventory in bulk. We are happy for this opportunity to help Nadezhda continue to operate her business profitably and earn the valuable income she and her family need.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Soliga

texts.en: Soliga M. is one of the new members of the loan programme. This is her first loan and also her first time ever to borrow money from an organization. As a guarantee when she applied for loans, she told the banks that she has being running her plantation for years, but the banks wouldn't accept her guarantee. This time she is so happy to be one of those ladies who borrow money from SPBD and will pay back later. Soliga is selling taro, taamu, bananas, and yams from her plantation, and she sells them at the Fugalei Market. She is honest and a hard-working lady.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, equipment, and a wheelbarrow for her plantation business

loans.name: Leonarda's Group

texts.en:
Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria have been members of the community bank Arco Iris for 6, 3, and 5 years respectively. In their community bank they have learned to be punctual and responsible, to save, to run their business, to avoid getting sick, and to respect other people.

Leonarda is 36 years old. She is married and has three children, who are 13, 10, and 8. She travels to different markets two times per week and buys grains and cheeses, which she sells at the Grau Market in Ayacucho and also door-to-door. She has had this business for six years.

On the other hand, Petronila is 54 years old. She is a widow and has nine children, only one of whom lives with her. She has been selling groceries from her home for the past three years. Furthermore, Petronila, together with her son, makes weavings. They sell beautiful tapestries and rugs at the Santa Clara market in Ayacucho.

Ana Maria is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, who are 17 and 9. She has a small grocery store which she started six years ago with very little capital but which has continued to grow little by little.

Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria need loans of 1600, 600, and 1000 soles, which they will invest in buying wheat, oatmeal, cornmeal, quinoa, and other local types of flour. They will also buy rice, sugar, beans, cookies, milk, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables.

They plan to use their savings to care for and educate their children, as well as in the case of an emergency. Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria dream of owning their homes, continuing to develop their businesses, and that their children will be able to continue moving up and become professionals.

loans.use: Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria need loans of 1600, 600, and 1000 soles, which they will invest in buying wheat, oatmeal, cornmeal, quinoa and other local types of flour.  They will also buy rice, sugar, beans, cookies, milk, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat O., 40-years-old, is married with three children. Her family lives in the Mushin area of Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1992, She has been selling building hardware. Her request for a loan of $450 is to purchase additional building hardware for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional building hardware for resale

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda R. started her business in Mexico City 30 years ago, which she and her sister ran from their home. When she got married she went to Zacatecas and started the same business, also from her house, until she was able to rent out a commercial space and expand her services to include not only cuts and coloring but also makeup, nails, etc. The main reason for having the business is to help her husband with education expenses for their 5 children, because as they began growing up and advancing in school these expenses increased and her husband´s income was insufficient.

She needs a loan of US $325, which she will repay in 6 months. With this money she will buy equipment to speed up the process of applying nails. Hilda and her family thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

María Hilda R. comenzó su negocio en la ciudad de México, DF hace 30 años, en su casa en conjunto con su hermana. Cuando se caso se fue a Zacatecas, y empezó también en la sala de su casa, hasta que pudo rentar un local para ampliar los servicios no nada mas de cortes y tintes, sino maquillajes, uñas, etc. La razón principal de este negocio es apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación de sus 5 hijos ya que cuando empezaron a crecer, y al ir avanzando en la escuela estos se incrementaron por lo cual el ingreso económico de su esposo empezó a ser insuficiente.

Ella necesita un crédito de US $325 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses con este dinero comprara una maquina para acelerar el proceso de aplicación de uñas. Hilda y su familia te agradecerán el apoyo que les brindes!!

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is fifty-five years old and the mother of three children. Two the children are in school. She has been selling onions, dry crabs, shrimp, and herring in her community for the past six years.

She wants to use her new loan to buy more onions and shrimp from Keta, a city in the eastern part of Ghana.

Patience is a member of the group called Destiny. Members of the group guarantee social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more onions and shrimp

loans.name: Sareth Kang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth K. is the group leader of four members in Sna Pich Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a subsistence farmer. In this work activity, she can obtain a small amount of revenue because she has a small plot of cultivatable land. Thus, now she is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land in order to expand her plantation business.

Mrs. Sareth K. has three children, one of whom is a farmer while the other two are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Sarim S., is a soldier. Mrs. Sareth K. previously obtained a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. (Mr. Socheng S. is not available in the picture but his wife is presented).

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a piece of land in order to expand her plantation business.

loans.name: Allakhverdi

texts.en:
Allakhverdi Q. is a 55-year-old married father of five living in Bilasuvar, a region in southern Azerbaijan. He and his family live in the Internally Displaced People Settlement, a makeshift city of sorts. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict.

For the past two decades, Allakhverdi has run a small grocery stand. To expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to purchase a refrigerator. Since the temperatures in this region of the country soar in the summer, Allakhverdi believes a fridge would be an excellent investment for his store.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for a small grocery stand

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem S. is a farmer who lives in Spa Village, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She lives with her husband and has two children. She earns about $1.50 per day. With her growing her farming business, she wants to expand the output of rice crop, so she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer to use on her rice crop. The loan allows her to increase her rice output and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil J. is a 37-year-old man who has been making window frames and doors of wood for more than 20 years. He lives and works in a small village in the Imishli region. He is married and has 3 children. Shamil has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase modern machines and develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase modern machines for his carpentry business

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 38, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been selling fish to earn a living and is able to make US$30 in revenue per day. Her husband, Ou Sara, 42, has a business selling corn and earns approximately US$6 of profit per day. This couple have six children, one of whom is married and no longer lives at home. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to rent a section of the river to fish.

loans.use: To rent a section of the river to fish.

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om S., 28, is married and lives in Phnom Penh with her two young children. She sells construction tools in the market, while her husband runs a small store in the market selling groceries, making about US$5 every day. It seems to be hard for every vendor and farmer because the inflation this year is out of control and the weather is unbelievable. Om S. has approached CREDIT for a loan to add to her construction tool inventory. She believes that this will be a sustainable investment which will raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To add to her construction tool inventory.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Con 33 años de edad, la señora Rosa es promotora en el rubro de artículos de limpieza para el hogar en un trabajo mancomunado con su familia. El trabajo es más que arduo pero es el sustento de su casa, de sus 2 menores hijos, 1 por entrar al colegio y el otro ya estudiando. En casa, convive con su esposo y papá. La señora Rosa es consciente de la gran competencia existente en el rubro y de lo importante que es el invertir en grandes cantidades de mercadería en aras de abaratar los costos e incrementar las ganancias, augurando así una calidad de vida más decente y próspera para su familia y para sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son su más grande preocupación y adoración.nnCon el ánimo de obtener más ganancias, que obtendría de poder invertir una suma importante en la compra de su mercadería, la señora Rosa necesita de un préstamo de 800 soles.n
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa, who is 33 years old, runs a family business selling home cleaning products. The job is highly demanding but provides the family’s means of support, which includes her 2 youngest sons, 1 of whom is about to start school and the other of whom is already studying. She also lives with her husband and father. Mrs Rosa is aware of the highly competitive nature of the field in which she works and of the importance in investing in large amounts of merchandise with the aim of reducing costs and increasing profits. In doing this, she anticipates a more respectable and prosperous quality of life for her family and 2 younger children who are her greatest concern and adoration. If Mrs Rosa is to increase her profits, which she intends to achieve by investing a substantial amount of money into buying merchandise, she will need a loan of 800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise that will later be sold: home cleaning products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. has been selling fish in the market at Elmina since 2006.  She buys the fish from local fishermen and then brings them home for processing and preservation. Elizabeth has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Elizabeth is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to assist in meeting the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Elisa es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Elisa viaja a las ferias de la región los días sábados y dependiendo de la oferta de cereales viaja a mas ferias, en donde compra cereales, animales menores, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 
Elisa necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y quesos.

Los sueños de Elisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, salir adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the Communal Bankl Muchuy Huaraqac, which means abundance in Quechua. Elisa is married, 47 years old and has 5 children. She works at the fairs in the region on Saturdays and depending on the supply of cereals she goes to the fairs where she purchases cereals, small animals and products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Elisa needs a loan of 2100 soles (US $675) that will be invested in the purchase of cereals and cheeses. The dreams of Elisa are that her children become professionals, get ahead and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elisa needs a loan to invest in buying cereals and cheeses

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica O. owns two businesses at Sinaga village, Siaya. She buys jaggery (product used in making local brews)in bulk and then sells it to the local brewers. She purchases her product from the sugar manufacturing companies. Her business has flourished over the last 7 years due to high demand for the product.

She also buys cereals, especially maize, in bulk during harvesting season and sells it to her clients when prices are high, thus ensuring a considerable profit.

Monica has applied for a loan to buy more cereals.

She is married with 8 dependent children. Her husband is a retired local leader and is currently farming.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Soleyvi Vanesa

texts.es: Soleyvi Vanesa E. R. vive en el municipio de ciudad Delgado, San Salvador.  A sus escasos 23 años, Soleyvi tiene ya su propio negocio de belleza, un salón donde ofrece todo tipo de servicios a excelentes precios.  Su gran espíritu de superación han llevado  a Soleyvi a soñar con la apertura de una cadena de salones de belleza en todo el país, sueño que ha iniciado hace ya cuatro años cuando abrió el negocio. Soleyvi solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y abastecer con nuevos productos su negocio para poder servir de mejor manera a sus clientes y dar un paso más en la obtención de su sueño.
texts.en:
Soleyvi Vanesa E. R. lives in the Delgado municipality of San Salvador. At only 23 years old, Soleyvi already had her own business, a beauty salon that offers all kinds of services at excellent prices. With her great strength in prevailing, Soleyvi dreams of opening a chain of beauty salons across the whole country, a dream that began four years ago when she opened her business. Soleyvi is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise and supply new products so her business can better serve its customers and get a step closer to obtaining her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Gutu

texts.en: Gutu N. has 1.5 hectares of grapevines and grows several varieties of grapes for making wine. The vineyard was inherited from his parents, and he has continued their business of selling the grapes to the processing plant in the village for the production of wine. He also has approximately 4 hectares of arable land and this year he grew 2.5 hectares of tobacco, 1.5 hectares of maize and the rest in sunflowers. He can generally expect a large harvest. Gutu also works with animals and has done so for more than 12 years, raising pigs and sheep for his own consumption as well as for selling. He needs a loan from Microinvest in order to purchase chemicals for spraying and to buy other supplies necessary for the maintenance of his vines.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals for spraying and other supplies to maintain grapevines.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has one child. He offers taxi services using his personal car. Alexander used to work at a plant which was later downsized. Then he worked as a guard at a security company. After that he decided to become self-employed and began using his car as a taxi.

Alexander would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to fix the engine of his car. His business goal is to make enough income to be able to help his son get better education. Alexander is a family man and has decided to work only during the day time in order to spend more time with the family.

loans.use: To fix the engine of the taxi

loans.name: Leydi Maria

texts.es: Leydi María Palacios C. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Leydi tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Leydi es una pulpería. Hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, Leydi inicio este negocio con la idea de sustentar a su familia, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Sus propósitos son de contribuir a la mejora de su negocio y además colocar más vitrinas para presentar los productos. Y es así que solicita apoyo por medio de Fundación León 2000 que será utilizado para la compra de cosméticos, granos básicos y golosinas. El sueño de Leydi es mantener su negocio ya que este el único medio de supervivencia que posee.
texts.en:
Leydi Maria Palacios C. is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Her economic activity consists of a small grocery store. She has operated the store from her home for the past 4 years in order to generate funds to help support her family. She wants to improve her business and install more display cabinets to showcase her products. This is why she is asking for funds from the Fundacion Leon 2000 which will be used to buy cosmetics, basic grains and snacks. Leydi's dream is to see her business grow since it is her only means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory and install display cabinets.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian tiene 30 años de edad y esta casada con el sr. Francisco Rojas de profesion fletero.  Ellos tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.

La sra. Lilian es propietaria de una despensa. Inicio esta actividad con un pequeño ahorro y luego con la ayuda de su conyuge aumento su capital y fue surgiendo. Actualmente tiene una clientela formada con una antigüedad de 6 años aproximadamente.

Solicitan el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: vinos, cervazas, cigarrillos y bebidas en general
texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old and is married to Francisco Rojas, who transports goods for a living. They have two children who are both school age. Lilian is the owner of a small store. She started her business with the little savings she had, and with her husband’s help she increased her capital, which has risen. She has been in business for about 6 years now and has an established clientele. Lilian is requesting a loan so she can purchase beer, wine, other beverages, and cigarettes for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise such as beer, wine, other beverages, and cigarettes

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
Teresa C..- es la presidenta del banco comunal es una Sra. Muy activa, tiene 56 años D. edad, vive en la localidad D. la Guardia barrio San Jorge, en anticrético, se dedica a la venta D. ropa para niños, hace mas D. 6 años que viene trabajando con este negocio.
Su esposo el Sr. Ángel Soto se dedica a la albañilería, actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la casa D. una D. sus vecinas.
Miguel I..- es el tesorero  del banco comunal, es viudo tiene 54 años D. edad vive en el Barrio el Carmen, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con sus dos hijos.
Tiene como actividad el Servicio D. transporte D. pasajeros en el centro D. la cuidad, el préstamo que fue solicitado fue para la reparación D. su vehiculo, debido a que estaba empezando a fallar. 
Sandy Ávila.- es la secretaria del banco comunal, es madre soltera D. 32 años D. edad, tiene un pequeño hijo, esta viviendo actualmente en la casa D. sus padres, se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva D. revistas el cual trabajo hace mas D. una año. Se esfuerza en seguir aumentando su capital ya que D. esta manera pueD. mantener a su pequeño hijo, porque el padre D. sus hijo lo abandono cuando estaba embarazada. Pese a contar con este caso no le fue mucho problema para ella, porque es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Teresa C. is the president of the communal bank and is a very active women; she is 56 years old, and lives in La Guardia in the San Jorge neighborhood on anticrético (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). Teresa has dedicated herself to the sale of children’s clothing for over 6 years. Her husband Ángel Soto is a mason, and is currently working at a neighbor’s house. Miguel I. is the treasurer of the communal bank, a widow, 54 years old, and lives in the El Carmen neighborhood; he own his house and lives with his two children. He works in transportation services in the city’s center and is requesting this loan to repair his vehicle, which is beginning to break down. Sandy Ávila is the secretary of the communal bank, a single mother, 32 years old, and has one small child; she is currently living in her parents’ home. For over a year she has dedicated herself to the sale of new clothing from catalogs. She works hard to continue increasing her capital so that she can support her small child because the father abandoned him when she was pregnant. In spite of this she does not see this situation as a problem because she is a hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase work capital.

loans.name: Sarfaroz

texts.en:
A. Sarfaroz is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Sarfaroz has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this experience, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Sarfaroz harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. In this way, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Sarfaroz requests 2500 Somoni to purchase calves. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.
