It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Mena group. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each member so that they can expand their businesses. This is the first loan these women are requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they hope to be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently, improve their current standard of living.
 
Fatmata K. (second from left) is the leader of this group. Fatmata is now 39 years old and married with six children. One is in college, four are in secondary school and the last is not of school going age yet. Fatmata sells market food and has been in this business since 1982.

loans.use: To further invest in her business selling food so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Махфират - женщина средних лет 1959 года рождения. Замужем и мать двоих детей. Занимается продажей женской обуви на рынках Джума и Якшанбе города Худжанда. Она закупает товар частично из города Истаравшан и из города Бишкека. Она привозит обувь средней цены, потому, что большое количество клиентов покупают недорогую и недешевую обувь. Махфират просит займ для закупки очередной партии летней обуви и частично школьной обуви, потому, что школьный сезон начинается.
texts.en:
Mahfirat is a middle-aged woman, born in 1959. She is married and is a mother of two children. She is involved in sales of women’s shoes at the Djuma and Yakshanbe markets in the city of Khujand. She brings her merchandise partially from the city of Istaravshan and from the city of Bishkek. She brings average-priced shoes because the majority of her customers purchase inexpensive but not cheap shoes. Mahfirat is requesting this loan to buy a stock of summer shoes and some school shoes because school season is starting.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer and school shoes

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion B. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 39 years old. Asuncion is separated and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Asuncion owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pork and beef products commonly known as "longganisa" in the local community. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Asuncion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Asuncion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza S. is from the village of Bulaw, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35-years old and married with six school-aged children. Eliza owns and operates a sari-sari (general) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eliza joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her income and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif was born in 1972. He is single. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Kalbadjar, and is now settled in Khirdalan.

Arif has sold bath accessories for 10 years. He is requesting a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manat (or about $2500 US) to buy additional accessories.

loans.use: to buy bath accessories

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas.
Lucinda es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucinda tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además Lucinda venD. leña.
Lucinda necesita un préstamo de1050 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. leña.
Lucinda sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de leña.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
“Team work makes the dream work”, said Estrelita.  She is 43 years old and still very diligent in her general store business and gasoline retailing.  She were blessed with six children and all are studying. It is not easy to send six children to school so she came up with her own business since their income from farming is not enough to provide the educational needs of their children.  

Estrelita needs to add more items in her store in order to gain more income.  She believes that through her business, she can meet the needs of their family. This motivates her tom seek for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.  She hopes to become successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia G., 58, is married to Mr. Mariano G., 60, and they are both residents of Purok-6 Maquilao, Tangub City. They have ten children, some of whom are adult-aged and some of whom are school-aged.

Mrs. G. sells gasoline and operates a vulcanizing shop, which gives them an average net income of 3,500 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this business for ten years, and the income it generates greatly helps the couple in raising their family. Mrs. G.'s husband also earns income from farming, which also contributes to supporting the family's daily needs.

As a good member of Kiva partner PMPC, Mrs. G. has the privilege, under the PDP-LP Program, of borrowing 8,000 PHP for her seventh loan cycle. She is very grateful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She enjoys PMPC's other products and services offered to all members. The proceeds of this loan will be added to her capital for retailing gasoline and vulcanizing kits and materials. The rest of the proceeds of her loan will be used for sustaining her family's daily needs and making her loan repayments.

loans.use: As additional capital for gasoline and vulcanizing business

loans.name: Ana Milagros

texts.es:
La socia ANA MILAGROS, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de diez años que cursa el nivel primario, ella es madre y padre para su menor hija. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de confección de ropa para niños y con la venta de disfraces para niños, la socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción en la adquisición de más material (lana de alpaca) para la confección de chompas, chalinas, guantes, etc.      .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana Milagros belongs to the Amauta Communal Bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is 35 and a single mother. She has a ten year old daughter who goes to primary school. She is both mother and father to her minor daughter. She alternates between her household activities, her business of making children’s clothes, and selling children’s costumes. She needs a loan to increase production by purchasing more material (alpaca wool) to make sweaters, scarves, and gloves, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium, and she promises to make her payments according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for making children's clothes

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en: Palolo S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Sataoa Uta A. She is married and has six infant children. Palolo owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2009, Palolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Miss. Sreysros M., 27, is single and lives with her sister and widowed mother in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Sreysros has been a tailor for two years. Before this she was a garment factory worker. She is asking for her first loan of 1,100USD to purchase a sewing machine for her business and also build a restroom for the family to use.

loans.use: To purchase one more kind of sewing machine for her tailoring business and build a restroom to use in the family.

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
El esposo D. Aidee es albañil D. obras D. construcción y precisamente fue el quien le dio la idea D. preparar alimentos y darle pensión a sus trabajadores, es así como empieza en el negocio D. las comidas, al principio algo temerosa pero con muchas ganas D. trabajar ella empieza a cocinar y los trabajadores D. su esposo quedaron tan  contentos con la comida que les preparaba que se empiezan a recomendar unos a otros. D. esa manera fue aumentando la cantidad D. comensales. Por otro lado también empezó a trabajar en un comedor D. su zona lo cual le genera otro ingreso. Con sus ganancias D. los trabajos que realiza ha podido avanzar la construcción D. su casa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Lo que Aidee quiere es tener un restaurante en su misma casa, ella tiene el local adecuado, pero aun no le alcanza para implementarlo es por eso que lo alquila para juntar algo D. capital.
Con el  reciente préstamo que EDAPROSPO le entregara, avanzara con la construcción D. su local  por ejemplo tarrajear las paredes,D. ese modo muy pronto vera su sueño realizado, lo mas importante es que el lugar donD. vive es para ese tipo D. negocio, por que es una avenida donD. transita mucha gente, ella esta segura que le ira muy bien por que cuenta con el apoyo D. su familia.

* La Sra. Aidee esta vestida con polo morado
*El joven que aparece en la foto esta como invitado antes pertenecia al grupo.
texts.en:
Aidee's husband is a construction worker and it was his idea to proviD. lunch options to his workers. This is how Aidee began her food preparation business. Initially she was timid but enthusiastic to work. She began to cook and her husband's workers were so happy with the food that they began to recommend her to others. In this way, Aidee increased the number of diners she served. She also began to work at a local cafeteria to generate more income. With her earnings she has been able to advance construction on her home and to help her husband with household expenses. Aidee wishes to have a restaurant in her home. She has some space but it's not enough, so she is currently renting out the space to build capital. With the loan EDAPROSPO will proviD. she will be able to continue construction by plastering the walls with cement. Soon she will achieve her dream of having her business in her home, which is important because her house is on an avenue with a lot of foot traffic. She is sure the business will do well because she has help from her family. * Aidee is wearing a purple shirt. * The young man that appears in the photo is a visitor; he was previously a member of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue construction on home.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro C. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Isidro is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Isidro owns & operates a retail store where he sells charcoal to local community members. Isidro has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Isidro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Isidro is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for his business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Isidro from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for his business

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. M. is a 40-year-old farmer with many years of farming experience. She is a married mother of two children who are students in the local public school. She has a partner in her husband who allows her to plant crops. The couple raises morning glory, cucumber, and tomatoes, which they sell to buyers when the plants are mature. 

M. lives in an old house that is frequently broken and her living conditions has been affected. To avoid this obstacle, M. is applying for a loan to repair and decorate her house. 

Mrs. M.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To decorate and repair her house.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene la edad de 44 años, durante su trayecto de vida ha logrado tener su propio negocio venta de cereales, y venta de tortilla, procreo un hijo, y su esposo trabaja en un hospital de la capital, en donde trabaja en bodega y en la cocina es el que prepara la comida nutricionista. Doña Maria desde horas temprano se levantaba para palmear sus tortillas ya que salía ambulante a vender por los andenes de Managua. Entregaba en cargo de cereales y tortillas  en una empresa Telmark Nicaragua. Las ventas se vinieron poniendo bajas lo cual ella decide buscar trabajo en Telmark en donde le dan de conserje ya que la conocían. Lo cual para ella fue de gran oportunidad ya que tiene un salario fijo. Pero sigue haciendo cereal que se lo compran sus compañeros. Con esta solicitud de préstamo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un muro por lo menos en la parte de alado levantarlo para ir poco a poco cerrando todo y poder tener un poco mas de seguridad ya que en el barrio que vive asecha mucho la delincuencia. Lo que es, para ella una necesidad en tener mas seguridad.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old. In her life's journey, she has succeeded in having her own business selling cereals and tortillas. She has one child, and her husband works in a hospital in the capital, where he works in the storeroom, and he prepares nutritious food in the kitchen. Maria used to rise early in the mornings to make her tortillas since she went out walking to sell them on the sidewalks in Managua. She gave up her cereal and tortilla sales to work for a company called Telmark Nicaragua. Her sales were going down, so she decided to look for work at Telmark, where they gave her a job as a janitor since they knew her. This was a great opportunity for her since she now has a fixed salary. But she keeps making cereal, which her coworkers buy. With this loan, she will purchase construction materials to build at least a side wall on her house, so she can close the house up little by little and have a little more security, since there is a lot of delinquency in her neighborhood. So she needs the wall for greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron to build a side wall on her home for security

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn Y. is 36 years old and is a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, located about 90 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She is blessed with six children: one is working and the other three are students and dependent on her.

Sorn Y. currently makes bamboo baskets. She saves up over a hundred sets of bamboo baskets before selling out. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to her customers' houses.

Sorn Y. needs a loan to buy zinc sheet to cover her house where it is cracking.

loans.use: To buy zinc sheet to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beans, rice, sugar and salt in bulk

loans.name: Hector Wilmer

texts.es:
Hector es un padre de familia que tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en una casa brindada por su padre para habitarla, la cual queda ubicada en un  pueblo joven del distrito de Pimentel, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, las condiciones de vida del cliente son precarias, su casa es de quincha con barro dividido por dentro con esteras, el piso es de tierra. 

Se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, compra su mercadería en el  terminal pesquero del vecino distrito de Santa Rosa y la vende de manera ambulatoria en Pimentel y en Chiclayo. Esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos con la que solventa los gastos familiares, por ello siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio. 

Actualmente su negocio esta captando mas numero de clientes lo cual hace que sus ventas sean mayores, por lo que Hector desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Hector es un padre trabajador y que siempre trata de sacar a su familia de la condicion en la que viven, su mayor anhelo es poder construir su vivienda de material noble para ofrecerles un techo seguro. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucion y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Hector is a hard working father. He is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in a home provided by his father. The home is located in the Pimentel district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. His living conditions are precarious. His home is a “quincha” home (a traditional construction system that uses a wood and cane framework, covered in mud and plaster) with a dirt floor. He has been selling fish for the past ten years. He buys his merchandise at the fishing terminal in the neighboring district of Santa Rosa and he sells it on foot in Pimentel and Chiclayo. This is the only source of income that pays for his family’s needs and he gives all he can to keep the business running. Lately his business has been bringing in more customers which has resulted in increased sales. He would like to expand his business by buying more merchandise, so Hector is requesting this loan for 1,000 PEN ($350) through Edpyme Alternativa. Hector is a hard working father who always tries to move his family ahead and tries to bring them up from the condition in which they live. His greatest desire is to build a sturdy house in order to offer them a solid roof over their heads. He has worked with our institution in the past and has demonstrated his responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a minibus to transport produce

loans.name: Villa Obrajes Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO VILL. OBRAJES LLAMADO ASI PORQUE TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES VIVEN EL L. ZONA D. VILL. OBRAJES, TODOS LOS SOCIOS SE CONOCEN Y SE GARANTIZAN ENTRE SI.

L. PRESIDENTA ES L. SRA. ALCIRA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ALQUILER  TIENE UNA TIENDA D. BARRIO EN FINAL CALLE COLOMBIA QUE ATIEND. TODOS LOS DIAS SE LEVANTA DESD. MUY TEMPRANO Y ABRE SU TIENDA HASTA LARGAS HORAS D. L. NOCHE, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL TRANPORTE URBANO TRABAJA TAMBIEN TODO EL DIA, PASA A RECOGER A SU ESPOSA A L. TIENDA Y VAN A SU DOMICILIO PARA QUE AL DIA SIGUIENTE SIGAN L. MISMA RUTINA,  ES UNA PERSONA CON MUCHA INICIATIVA Y BUENA LIDER DEL GRUPO POR SU RESPONSABILIDAD Y SU SOLIDARIDAD FUE ELEGIDA COMO REPRESENTANTE DEL BANCO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA.

L. SECRETARIA ES L. SRTA. VIVIANA  VIVE EN ALQUILER HACE 2 AÑOS, ELL. SE DEDICA AL RECICLADO D. BOTELLAS, ESTA ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE L. REALIZAN MUCHAS PERSONAN RECOGEN BOTELLAS D. LOS BASUREROS D. L. CALLE, D. LAS CASAS BUSCAN POR TODO LADO Y DESPUES LO VENDEN A EMPRESAS QUE SE ENCARGAN D. RECICLARAS, CON EL DINERO DLE CREDITO L. SRTA. VIVIANA DESEA ALQUILAR UNA TIENDITA PARA QUE COMPRE ESTOS PRODUCTOS D. OTRAS PERSONAS Y DESPUES ELL. PODER ENTREGAR A LAS FABRICAS DOND. LAS RECICLAN.

ES UN GRUPO  D. 8 PERSONAS JOVENES INDEPENDIENTES   CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENEN UNA ACTIVIDAD INDEPENDIENTE, SON MUY ORGANIZADOS Y ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR L. CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN L. OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The “VilL. Obrajes” communal bank is so called because all its members live in the VilL. Obrajes area; they all know each other and serve as each other’s guarantor. The group president is Alcira. She’s married and has two small children. She rents her house and has a neighborhood grocery store at the end of Colombia Street that’s open every day from very early in the morning until late at night. Her husband is a public transportation driver and also works all day. He comes by to pick up his wife at the end of the day and takes her home to continue the next day with the same routine. She is a person with a lot of initiative and a good group leader. She was elected group president thanks to her responsibility and solidarity. She will use the funds to buy stock merchandise for her store. Viviana is secretary. She rents her house. For two years she has recycled bottles. This is an activity that many people are engaged in. They gather bottles from trash in the street and from homes; they look for them everywhere and sell them to firms that recycle them. Viviana will use the funds to rent a little store where she can buy these products from others and then she will resell them to the recycling firms. This is a group of 8 independent young people. Each has an independent commercial activity. They are very organized and grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en:
M. Akbarali is an active 38-year-old father. He is a talented farmer and his crops are sought after by many local women who would like to sell them. The income he earns from this business allows him to take care of his large family of four children and his wife. Akbarali would like to increase his harvest in order to maximize his income, and to do so he needs to buy fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. As he lacks the financial means to do so, Akbarali is requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni to help him with this purchase.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for farming

loans.name: Amadou Baïlo

texts.fr: Amadou Baïlo D. est une femme de 25 ans, elle est mariée dans son village d'origine et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et a eu 8 bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour avoir toujours remboursé sans aucune difficulté. C'est un membre très fidèle et régulière aux réunion de Banc Villageois. Madame Amadou Baïlo D. est d'ethnie Peulh réputée être de grands éleveurs et son crédit actuel lui servira à acheter deux bœufs, des produits vétos et de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser les sujets pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de son quartier.
texts.en:
Amadou Baïlo D. is 25 years old, married in her home town and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for four years and had eight successful experiences with credit loans, all reimbursed without any difficulties. She is a very steady member and regularly attends the “Banc Villageois” meetings. Mrs. Amadou Baïlo D. belongs to the Peulh ethnic group, which has a solid reputation as cattle ranchers. Her current loan will be used to buy two oxen, veterinarian products and cattle feed, so that she can fatten them for five months before they are resold at the weekly market fairs in her area.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two oxen for fattening

loans.name: Karina Yuniethz

texts.es: Karina Yuniethz tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 12 años que tiene esta actividad, pues ella vende en el mercado en donde tiene muchos clientes que visitan en su local, por lo que a pesar de sus enfermedades ha sabido muy bien cómo manejar su negocio, pues la buena administración es elemental. Se levanta temprano todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, momento en el que dejan de circular clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de leche, cuajada, queso, crema y leche agria. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina Yuniethz is 35, and she sells dairy products. For over 12 years she has been doing this, and she sells in the market where she has many customers who visit her location. Despite her illnesses she has managed her business very well, as good administration is vital. She gets up early every day and works from 7 am to 5 pm, when customers stop circulating. The loan is for the purchase of milk, curd, cheese, cream and buttermilk. She wants to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah L. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Devorah is single. To make a living, Devorah owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. Devorah has fish pond and has been engaged in her business for over 3 years. She earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Devorah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Devorah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Devorah is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transportation vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Devorah from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan Marivic has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Lydia De Fatima

texts.es: Lydia De Fátima tiene 48años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y calzado, por lo que tiene más de 3 años pues siempre está buscando la amera de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Cuenta con una buena clientela que siempre esta pidiéndole buenos productos ya que los ofrece ambulante y en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como perfumes, cremas, shampoo, tratamientos, polvos y lápiz labial. Sueña con seguir mejorando sus ingresos cada día.
texts.en:
Lydia De Fátima is 48 years old. She has been selling cosmetics and shoes for more than three years. Lydia is always looking for ways to improve her income so that she can support her two dependent children. She has a good customer base that is always requesting the fine products she offers.

Lydia sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor and from her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as perfumes, crèmes, shampoos, treatments, powders, and lip pencils. Her dream is to continue improving her income each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, shampoos, treatments, powders, and lip pencils

loans.name: Candelaria  Norma

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria Norma T. vive en la zona Norte de la Ciudad de Cochabamba en el Barrio conocido como Cala Cala. La señora Candelaria estaba casada pero se divorcio hace más o menos  un año, y solo tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. Candelaria vive con sus 2 hermanas con las cuales también trabaja.

Candelaria es Técnico Veterinario y tiene una pequeña granja  de gallinas ponedoras que está ubicada en la zona del Paso de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Se dedica a la venta de huevo y pollo en la ciudad de Cochabamba por casi 8 años. En este tiempo con la ayuda de sus hermanas pudieron hacer crecer considerablemente el tamaño de su granja.

Candelaria solicita el crédito para poder incrementar sus producción con la compra de más gallinas, y de esta manera seguir incrementando sus ingresos y los de su familia. Su próximo objetivo es poder incrementar de tal manera su producción de huevo que pueda vender también a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Candelaria Norma T. lives in an area north of the city of Cochabamba in the neighborhood known as Cala Cala. Canelaria was married, but she got divorced about a year ago. She only has one child, a minor. Candelaria lives with her two sisters, and they also work. Candelaria is a veterinary technician. She has a small farm of laying hens, which is located in the Paso area of the city of Cochabamba. She has been selling eggs and chicken in the city of Cochabamba for eight years. During this time, with help from her sisters, they were able to make the size of her farm grow considerably. Candelaria is requesting a loan to be able to increase her production by purchasing more hens. That way she will continue increasing her income and that of her family. Her next objective is to be able to increase egg production in such a way that she will be able to sell in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Desididas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Desididas lo conforman Yolanda del Carmen S., Claudia Leticia Gómez M. y Elizabeth del Carmen O. C., tres mujeres con actividades económicas distintas pero con la meta de seguir siempre progresando en sus vidas y en sus negocios.

Yolanda, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica desde su casa de habitación a la venta de carne de res y hueso, ella desea incursionar en la venta de carne porcina y es éste el propósito del préstamo otorgado. Claudia, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de nacatamales los días jueves, viernes y fines de semana; y finalmente Elizabeth, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva de manera ambulante en las cercanías de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda del Carmen S., Claudia Leticia Gómez M. and Elizabeth del Carmen O. C., three women with distinct economic activities but with the common goal to continue progressing both in life and in business, make up the “Desididas” (Decided Ones) communal bank. Yolanda is the group Coordinator and sells beef and soup bones from home. She wants to start selling pork and this is the purpose of the granted loan. Claudia makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) for sale on Thursdays, Fridays and weekends. And finally, Elizabeth sells cosmetic and new clothing around her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Blessing Of God Group

texts.en:
Aletha H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Blessing Of God.  She is 38 years old and married with three children whose ages are between 16 and 21 years. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 16 years, she has been selling palm oil, tomatoes, onions, rice, pepper and seasoning in Freeport Market Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 75,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil and more dozens of tomatoes, onions and seasoning. She describes herself as a kind woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fanta is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, tomatoes, onions and seasonings

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria S. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures, an eatery and an oyster vending business. She lives in Purok Su-ol, Brgy. Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Eatery and oyster vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. Gleceria is borrowing PHP 19000 so that she may fund operations of her eatery and oyster vending businesses. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gleceria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia C., 51, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador C., a contractor, and is a mother to four young hard-working adults and five school-aged children. Two of her children are in college, one is in high school and two are in elementary school. By the grace of God, Olivia has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Olivia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling at the piece rate price.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Olivia dreams of being able to renovate her house soon with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko is a 72-year-old married man with five children. He also looks after other dependants and lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of seeing his children attain higher levels of learning. Doviko is a very enterprising man who started from a meek background selling a few pigs and graduated to weekly trading of at least eight pigs. Doviko intends to use the loan to buy cement for construction of his house for rentals.

loans.use: To buy cement for construction of his house for rentals.

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Keav Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum K., who is 51 years old, was selected by the fourteen members of this village bank loan to be their president. They are located in Kaev Chamraeun village in Takeo province. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Prum K. is a silk weaver who can earn some money to help support her family. During the wedding season her business goes well, so she wants to expand, but she doesn't have enough money to support the improvements. So for this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. 

Her husband, Mr. Hoeun Kam, is a village chief and he is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Through this activity, they support five children, two of whom are weavers while the others are studying in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben R. (right in photo) has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day.  Her husband is a fisherman. 

Ben is the mother of four children, who work at various occupations.  They contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. One of her children sells salt and potatoes in his village.  He wants to sell to other villages to earn more income.  Unfortunately, he has no vehicle.

To solve this problem, Ben is applying for loan for her child to buy a horse and trailer in order to transport his products.

loans.use: To buy horse, and trailer in order to transport his product for selling.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Mr. Darwin M. is from the Barangay (village) of San Antonio, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, married and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school while the other two are still at infant age. To make a living, he is presently engaged in a piggery business. He’s been  in this kind of business for five months, and is earning an average amount of not less than $250 when the pigs are sold.

Just this year, Darwin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darwin, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP as his first loan, which will be used as additional capital for his piggery business, for purchasing feed and vitamins. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.
	

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his piggery business

location.town: Ozamis-San Antonio, Ozamis City, Mis. Occidental

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann K. is a 27-year-old woman with three children. She is a local villager living in a medium-sized home with her family in Kompong Tom Province. Chann K. divorced her husband a few years ago. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops including rice and vegetables to sell. Her crops grow well almost every season. 

Chann K.’s greatest business difficulty is transporting her product to market as she must always spend money to hire a motor taxi. Therefore, to save money and decrease her traveling expenses, Chann K. is requesting a loan to buy a used motorbike to get her products to market.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara K. is the treasurer of this group. She is the resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 30 and married. She has three daughters, the first daughter is at school and the others are not yet, they are of preschool age (under seven).

In order to earn money to cover family expenses Gulnara and her husband breed livestock. By reselling livestock animals after fattening them, they earn 10,000 soms per month. This profit makes it possible for them to improve the family’s living conditions and purchase household appliances. Gulnara hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials in order to repair the pavilion, which she installed near her house. In the future she wants to provide her daughters good education and purchase an apartment in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: El Sr. José Ángel M. L. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “Hotel Barceló Monte limar” desempeñándose como  Jardinero tiene  nueve años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. José Ángel M. L. is employed as a gardener at the "Hotel Barceló Monte Limar", where he has worked for the past nine years. He is married and has two school-age children. He has had six loans with CEPRODEL and he has used each one to buy building materials such as sand, cement, stone, piedrín (a type of building stone), blocks, etc., enabling him to extend and make improvements to his home. These CEPRODEL loans have benefited him a great deal because they have allowed he and his family to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as sand, cement, stone, piedrín (a type of building stone), blocks, etc.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene tiene 35 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Yrene nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía en el centro artesanal “Mariscal Gamarra” en la ciudad de Pisaq. Ella trabaja en el negocio de elaborar artesanía desde el año 1998 y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Yrene requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanía como por ejemplo chompas y muchas cosas más.   

Yrene pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yrene, 35, has three children.  She lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.  

Yrene tells us that she sells crafts at Pisaq’s “Mariscal Gamarra” crafts center.  She’s worked at crafts making since 1998 and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  On this occasion, Yrene needs the loan to buy more crafts like sweaters, for example, and many other things.

Yrene is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means while also committing to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more crafts like sweaters, for example, and many other things.

loans.name: Ruby Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Ruby R. es profesora de secundaria del colegio de villa el Carmen tiene diesinueve años de laborar para esta institución, es casada tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, su esposo tiene un taxi el cual lo trabaja diario en Managua. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ha  mejorado su condición de vida de élla y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Ruby R. is a secondary school teacher at the Villa del Carmen school. She has been working in this institution for nineteen years. She is married and she has two school-aged children. Her husband has a taxi which he drives every day in Managua. She has had three past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has bee used to purchase construction materials in order to expand and improve her house. The loans that Ceprodel has granted have been a great help because she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rocks, sand, cement, and zinc

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin. She is 51 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. 

Veronica owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Veronica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

Veronica is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her retail store

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Helen is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Helen is 49 years old. 

Ma. Helen has a business buying and selling fermented fish (tinabal) in the Philippines. Ma. Helen requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for her fermented fish business.

Ma. Helen has been in this business for 12 years.  In the future, Ma. Helen would like to put up a stall for selling fermented fish in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Su esposo trabaja como maestro D. obra (constructor). María y su familia residen en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteneciente al departamento D. La Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.
María se dedica a la venta D. pan a sus vecinos D. su localidad.  Además brinda servicios D. costura, atendiendo con modelos exclusivos a su clientela, quienes ya conocen las labores que realiza.  Estas actividades las realiza en su propio domicilio y los ingresos que percibe sirven para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
María desea comprar más tela para diseñar más prendas y poder percibir mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a builder (construction). Maria and her family live in the district of  Pacasmayo, which belongs to the department of La Libertad, located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the departament of Lambayeque.
María works selling bread to the residents of her community. She also is a seamstress, offering exclusive designs to her customers, who already know her work. She does these activities in her own home and the income she receives help her support her husband with the household expenses.   

María wants to buy more fabric to design more clothes and receive higher income. That is why she has decided to get a loan of  1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a single woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 33 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for a year. Elvira sells items such as canned goods, coffee and chips to people in her community. She also raises chickens on her small poultry farm. Elvira hopes to acquire more chickens and expand her poultry business.
Elvira is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase chickens, feed and vitamins, and items to sell in her store such as canned goods.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed and vitamins, and items to sell such as canned goods

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derrick is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.  

For the past eight years, he has operated a business of buying and selling goats and cows for meat. He sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Derrick faces a major challenge of high pricing and disease outbreak in his business. He dreams of establishing a butcher shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase seven goats for his butcher shop. He decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase seven goats and cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 26 years old. She is single. She owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items commonly used at home such as salt, matches, sugar, candles, soap, table dishes, etc. She has done this business for 2 years and this business has enabled her to buy almost all the basic needs she has required. 

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more items and to fill her store in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store such as sugar, matches, candles, etc.

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es:
Edgar de 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su casa, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que tiene una actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Edgar se dedica  a la venta de golosinas y bebidas desde hace 1 año, en su domicilio ofrece sus productos  para mayor comodidad, además puede atender a cualquier hora a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga será para ayudar económicamente a sus padres.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para  comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para implementar su pequeño negocio y así puede solventar sus gastos personales, como poder pagar el crédito otorgado.  Edgar es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea mejorar en la vida y darle algunas comodidades a sus padres.
texts.en:
Edar is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents at home with running water and electricity. They live in the Olmos district which belongs to the Lambayeque department. The area consists of agricultural and livestock workers.

Edgar has been selling sweets and drinks for a year now. He sell them from home since it is convenient and he can serve his clients at any hour. He uses the profits to help his parents financially.

He requested Edpyme Alernativa a 500 Peruvian soles loan to buy merchandise to supply his store and make profits to cover personal payments such as paying back his loan. Edgar is known to be a hardworking person in his area as well as having the drive to improve his life and offers his parents life's comforts.

loans.use: buy merchandise to supply his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-age dependents.

Evangeline has a small market at home to earn a living. She sells basic food items like rice and corn grains, biscuits, and canned goods. Evangeline supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for three years. She earns PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her retail store and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 58 years old and married with five daughters and one son. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she sells a little bit of everything. A large portion of her profits comes from selling large bags of sugar, rice, and flour. Carmen is asking for a $400 loan in order to purchase more products for her grocery store. With a large portion of the loan, she plans to buy sugar, rice, and flour. With the restof the loan, she plans to buy different kinds of snacks and soft drinks. Carmen is passionate about her business and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and flour for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es: Rosa Guadalupe D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad vive con sus nietos. Ella posee una pupuseria en el lugar D. su residencia es muy famosa en la localidad pues las pupusas que prepara tienen un sabor exquisito e inigualable y el acompañamiento del delicioso curtido a base D. fermento D. piña y la rica secreta receta D. salsa D. tomate son el complemento idoneo D. sus pupusas. Se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues les da una buen servicio y precios cómodos; Rosa es una mujer emprendedora con ganas D. salir adelante  para ella las personas que trabajan duro y le ponen amor a su labor son las que consiguen el éxito, es por eso que ella le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como maíz, arroz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles, entre otros para mantener a flote el negocio. Rosa Guadalupe tiene fe que su esfuerzo le dará la oportunidad D. darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Guadalupe is fifty-six years old and lives with her grandchildren.  She has a pupusa (stuffed tortilla) business in her home, which is famous in the neighborhood as the pupusas she makes have an exquisite and incomparable taste, and the accompaniment of delicious cabbage salad on a base of fermented pineapple, and the rich tomato sauce maD. from a secret recipe, are the perfect complement for her pupusas.  She has a large clientele, as she gives them good service and affordable prices.

Rosa is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead in life.  As far as she's concerned, people who work hard and love the work they do, are those that achieve success.  This is why she is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy raw ingredients such as corn, rice, cheese, pork, beans, and other things to keep her business afloat. 

Rosa Guadalupe has faith that her efforts will proviD. her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cheese, pork, and beans.

loans.name: Santiago Apostol Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado  por diez  mujeres  indígenas  que se dedican  a diferentes  actividades  económicas , ellas  formaron el grupo  ya que son vecinas  de  la comunidad .
Este grupo se llama Santiago  Aposto  pues sus clientes son muy devotos al santito de santiago apostol.
La representante de este grupo es la   señora  Silvina  de treinta y siete años de edad  esta felizmente casada  con el señor  Perfecto  ambos tienen cuatro hijos que estudian.
La señora Silvia fue quien enviíto a las persona a formar parte de  este grupo; ella se dedica a la venta de pan , es muy reconocida  en su localidad  ya que hace unos panes  muy deliciosos  ya que ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace veinte años , siempre tiene muy buenas ventas  además de que vende el pan en su localidad  sale a venderlos fuera para que las personas prueben el delicioso pan de  de Jicayan.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para  comprar  más insumos para la elaboración   del pan:
Manteca, harina, panela entre otros para que se le facilite y realice  más y tenga  un poco mas de ganancias; ya que estas las utiliza  para que sus hijos puedan segur estudiando , de igual manera  para realizar sus pagos que adquirido del préstamo.
Las mujeres que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Soledad –se dedica a la venta de pan.
Maria –se dedica a la venta de  trajes bordados.
Emilia –se dedica a la venta de ropa elaborada  a mano.
Juana – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Irene – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Consuelo – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Deysi- se dedica a la venta de artículos de fantasía.
Eva – se dedica a la venta de  zapatos.
Macedonia- se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que las ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de este milagro par tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is made up of ten indigenous women who work in different business activities.  They formed this group as they are neighbors from the same community.

This group is called 'Santiago Apostol' as its members are devout followers of the saint of Santiago Apostol.  The group's representative is Silvia.  She is 37 years old and happily married to Perfecto.  The couple have four children who are all in school.  It was Silvia who invited people to join this group.  Her business is selling bread and she is very well known in her town as she makes delicious bread.  She has been in this business for twenty years and always has very good sales.  In addition to selling bread in her town, she also sells her bread elsewhere so that people are able to taste delicious Jicayan bread.

Silvia requested this loan to buy more supplies for making bread (butter, flour, unrefined sugar, etc.) so that she can produce more and make more profits which she uses so that her children can continue studying and she can continue repaying her loan.

The women who make up this group are:
Soledad - who sells bread.
Maria - who sells embroidered dresses.
Emilia - who sells hand-made clothes.
Juana - who sells Mexican snacks.
Irene - who sells Mexican snacks.
Consuelo - who sells Mexican snacks.
Deysi - who sells costume jewelry.
Eva - who sells shoes.
Macedonia - who sells groceries.

The women thank Fundacion Realidad for the support that they have provided to enable them to get ahead in life and fulfill their dreams, and for being part of this miracle so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell bread

loans.name: Seum

texts.en:
Seum is 29 years old.  She is married to Heng and they have three children. They are all in school. Seum has been generating her income by raising pigs. From this business, she earns approximately $5 USD each day. Seum would like to purchase feed but lacks capital so she wishes to request some funds so she can buy concentrated feed for fattening her pigs. She wants to increase her business so that her micro-enterprise will grow more each day through this loan. This will allow her to provide her customers with the best product whenever her pigs are ready to be sold. 

Seum’s business was started as a new source of revenue so she could improve the quality of life for her family and provide the best education for her children. Her final goal is to meet the expectation that all of her projects will be larger in the future. This is the first loan with Kiva and the fourth loan with HKL. She says that becoming a member of this micro-finance was an excellent decision because obtaining a loan is an easier, faster process and the interest rate is low. She is very grateful to all the lenders who always help her family. She hopes that this loan will improve her income per day.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.  

La socia Leonarda; 34 años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos y es soltera, la socia se dedica  a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes desde hace 9 años, la socia también es ganadera, la socia tiene sus vacas y toros, ella también cría chanchos, en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir en la compra de chanchos y de una vaca el crédito esperado, la socia desea incrementar el número de animales vacunos para la venta de los productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca y un par de chanchos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Leonarda, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.

Leonarda is 34 years old, she is single and has 3 children. She has been engaged in managing her grocery store for 9 years, and she is also a livestock breeder. She owns cows and bulls, and she also breeds pigs. She wants to invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of pigs and of a cow: she wants to increase the number of cows to sell dairy products. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of a cow and of a pair of pigs.

She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a pair of pigs.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana, is a 49-year-old lady. She is married to Oktovianus, a 53-year-old teacher. From their marriage, they have been blessed with four children, namely; Joniawan, 30 and Juliana, 26, both married; Yudi, 25, and Dewi, 20, both university students.

Yohana is a vegetable seller. She has been running the business for seven years. She used to sell the vegetables at a local market, but after having a grandchild she decided to move the business to her residence so she would be able to look after the business as well as her grandchild. She initiated her business by selling a bundle of vegetable and tomatoes under a tree. After six months she built up a small place and put the stuff in it. She offers various kinds of vegetables and other stuff, e.g.: cabbage, mustard greens, tomatoes, chilies, nuts, firewood, kerosene etc. 

Yohana plans to improve her business by adding more stock to sell. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase more vegetables, cooking ingredients, firewood, and kerosene to sell. She is hoping that her loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, cooking ingredients, firewood, and kerosene.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y su hija, el es sastre, elabora, pantalones, camisas, para niños y caballeros, desde hace 12 años trabaja en este oficio, lo aprendió en talleres de alta costura y ahora tiene su propio taller, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar material para elaboración de informes escolares como telas de diferentes colores, botones, hilos, agujas, de esa forma tendrá lo necesario para terminar los pedidos y obtener ante los clientes mejor preferencia por la puntualidad.
El propósito de José, es salir con el contrato de informes de las escuelas y a si asegurar el nuevo contrato para los próximos años y seguir trabajando con la institución para futuros préstamos, que le permitan ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and daughter.  He’s a tailor.  He makes pants and shirts for children and men.  

He’s been in this occupation for 12 years.  He learned working in haute couture shops and now he has his own shop; he does not have a fixed work schedule.

He will use the loan to buy supplies like different color fabric, buttons, thread and needles to manufacture school uniforms and have what he needs to complete his orders and obtain more customer preference because of his punctuality.

Jose’s goal is to get ahead with the school uniform contract to assure new contracts in the years to come and continue working with the institution for future loans that will allow him to help with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and thread to manufacure uniforms.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rigoberto desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovino, porcino y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de más alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.  Rigoberto es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  tener mejoras económicas que ofrecerles.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 38, lives with is wife and children in his own house which has electricity as the sole utility.  It is located in the rural district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For several years Rigoberto has been raising and selling livestock such as sheep, pigs and chickens.  He has set up an appropriate barnyard behind his house and gives the animals balanced feed, fodder and natural grains so they will develop to optimum size for sale at the different markets in the area.  In this way he earns a good profit to take care of household expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more balanced feed and pay for animal healthcare.  With the income he earns he will pay back the loan and improve his children's lifestyle.  Rigoberto is a hard-working, responsible person who wants the best for his children and to be able to offer them economic stability.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and pay for animal healthcare.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with 7 children, 2 of whom are in school while the rest have completed school. Her husband is a medicine man who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for the children.

Umazi has operated a maize selling business for the past 5 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are no harvests in dry seasons. She dreams of building a house.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bags of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Yahaira Karolina

texts.es:
Doña Yahaira tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Campana en el departamento Cortes. La señora tiene dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Lleva 7 años de casado con su esposo Miguel, lo cual es topógrafo. 

Como don Miguel tiene trabajo estable, doña Yahaira anteriormente lo pasaba en casa cuidando de los niños.
