Cuando estos crecieron, ella decidió junto con su esposo, poner un negocio para tener otro fuente de ingreso para la familia. Abrió un puesto cerca de una escuela de la aldea y allí vende todo tipo de  golosinas para niños. Vende churros, dulces, aguas, chicles, y paletas (helado que se come en un palo). El puesto se abre a las 5 de la mañana y sigue abierto hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Yahaira solicitó su primer crédito de L4000 para la compra de productos como chicles, frutas, y churros para surtir su negocio. Ella quiere hacer crecer el negocio y realizarse como comerciante para ayudar a sus hijos a culminar sus estudios. El crédito sirve de mucho ya que con el, se tiene más productos y los clientes encuentran lo que buscan. Con un inventario más amplio, Yahaira espera competir con las pulperías cercanas.
texts.en:
Doña Yahaira is 31 years old and lives in the village of Campana in the department of Cortes.  The Señora has two children aged 15 and 12 years old.  She has been married for seven years to Miguel, who is a surveyor.

As Don Miguel has stable work, Doña Yahaira previously stayed at home taking care of the children.  As they grew up, she decided, together with her husband, to start a business to earn another source of income for the family.  She opened a food stall close to a school in the village, and this is where she sells all types of confectionery for children.  She sells churros (dough fritters), sweets, water, gum and paletas (popsicles).  Her food stall opens at five in the morning, and remains open until 5 in the afternoon.

Yahaira has requested her first loan of L4,000 for the purchase of products such as gum, fruit and churros to stock up her business.  She wants to grow her business and establish herself as a businesswoman in order to help her children complete their education.  The loan will be very useful to her as with it, she will be able to have more products in stock and her customers will be able to find what they want.  With a larger inventory, Yahaira hopes to compete with the small grocery stores nearby.

loans.use: to purchase gum, fruit and churros (dough fritters).

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 43-year-old housewife who has six sons and daughters. Her husband works in a private company in Jordan.
To help support the family, Aisha opened a small food market almost ten years ago. The store is in an extended room from her house. She sells snacks, juices, and other food products such as rice, sugar, pasta, etc. 
During these ten years, Aisha did not expand her business a lot because she was concentrating on raising her children. But now she has applied for a loan in order to buy more new products and add greater variety to what she sells in order to expand her food market.

loans.use: to add more food products to her store.

loans.name: Maelega

texts.en:
Maelega is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Asau.  She is married and has ten adult children.  To make a living, Maelega owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Maelega has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maelega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1970 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Maelega is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and taro rhizomes (roots to start new taro plants).  The loan will be Maelega's fourth loan from SPBD.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and taro rhizomes.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by selling electronic products. 

For 10 years, Tien has earned a living by running a general store. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which would help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann is humble resident who has been living in Prey Chor district. She is now 42 years old and a responsible mother of four children, three of whom are attending school in a province. She is completely dedicated to farming work to generate income, earning approximately $2.50 per day. 

With the loan she has applied for from Kiva, she will purchase a stock of rice from local villagers at a cheaper price to keep it for daily food during the year. For her prospects, she will strive to work harder to provide her children further education.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, 25 years old, is a single young man. He describes himself as a quiet man. He has been selling goats for the last three years. In addition, he runs a retail shop to add to his source of income. He faces the challenge of insufficient funds to improve his business. Patrick plans to use the loan of KES 20,000 to expand his business by buying more goats. In the future, Patrick's dream is to venture into a butcher shop. He also plans in the next five years, to go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more goats.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Nena has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Lilia Rogelia

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer de 49 años de edad pero con una alegría y las  ganas de vivir y salir adelante de una joven de 20 años, Lilia es madre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad por el cual daría la vida ya que es lo más importante que tiene en la vida y es su motor y motivo para seguir adelante. La vivienda de Lilia se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se cultivan los productos como el algodón, la uva, el esparrago, entre otros. Lilia estudio la carrera de educación, pero debido a que no encontraba empleo y luego de mucho ahorro logro tener su negocio de venta de productos para el hogar, al cual le dedica alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede llegar a atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque  es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque les ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Lilia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como vasos, platos, jarras, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 49-year-old woman with the happiness and desire to live and get ahead of a 20-year-old.  Lilia's the mother of a small child, 2, for whom she would give her life because he's the most important thing in her life and her driving force and motivation for getting ahead.  Lilia's house is in the Santiago district, which is known for having a warm and welcoming climate.  They also grow cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other crops there.

Lilia studied education but she didn't find work.  Then, after saving a lot, she was able to have her business selling household products.  She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers.  She believes it's going well for her in her business because she's friendly with the customers and especially because she sells quality products at affordable prices.

Lilia's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy glasses, plates, mugs, and other merchandise for her business.  This way she'll be able to have a greater variety of products to sell and to continue striving every day to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: "To finish building her house."

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, mugs, and other merchandise

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en:
Regina is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Teshi, a place that is well-known in the country because the ethnic group the ga live there. The area is known for its beautiful countryside, its ethnic groups, and for being the land bridge that joins the mountain range with the coast. Regina is maried, her husband, and her two children live there.

She is a very diligent woman whose destiny has been to work hard to support her family. She has the support of her husband, who works in interior and exterior design.

Currently, Rigina makes a living by selling clothes. She started the business several years back, with her mother as her example to follow. She works every day in the afternoon, but her mainstay are the weekends, when she visits the majority of her customers. She also sometimes goes to fairs in the city.

With this loan, she will be able to buy more pants, shirts, and underwear to stock her business. It is a very good time to invest because the city is in a season of celebration, which is when people buy her products most.

She thanks Kiva for supporting her as she moves forward, and in the near future, establishes a permanent storefront. She is thankful that this business continues to be strengthened so that her family lacks nothing. 

She represent the 'Blema tesa' group of four hardworking members.

loans.use: to buy more pants, shirts, and underwear to stock her business.

loans.name: Deria Xochitl

texts.en:
Deria is a very family oriented woman. She started her own business with her Mom\'s help. She has two small children for whom she works very hard every day, and her husband emigrated to the United States to try and find employment to help his family. Deria was worried about their financial situation and so she started her business, which today helps her cover all of the family\'s expenses. She hopes to be able to expand her business so that her husband will be able to come back home and so that he will never have to leave again. Together they will manage the business and will enjoy a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $250 to purchase inventory and to increase the variety of products in her store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to make her business grow. She plans on repaying the loan in 3 to 6 months. you can help Deria and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Deria es una mujer muy entregada a su familia inició su propio negocio con la ayuda de su mamá, tiene 2 hijos pequeños por los que todos los días trabaja muy duro y su esposo emigro a los Estados Unidos para encontrar un empleo y sacar a su familia adelante. Deria preocupada por todo esto emprendió el negocio y actualmente este le permite cubrir con los gastos de la familia. Ella tiene la esperaza de hacer crecer su negocio de tal modo que su esposo regrese y no se vuelva a ir, juntos administrarlo y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar mercancía para tener una mayor capacidad y variedad de productos en su tienda, ella tiene la espera que con este préstamo le ayude hacer crecer su negocio. En un término de 3-6 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo, tú puedes apoyar a Deria y a su familia, apóyalos.

loans.use: purchase food

loans.name: Afag

texts.en:
Afag has been in this business for 3 years.
This business allows her family to have a better income.
Having borrowed  $600 she bought medicinal preparations for her cattle.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a milk cow.
Afag is 36 years old , an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region. She has settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. Afag is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 32 years old and has four children.  She was running a coconut tree farm.  She would harvest the coconuts when they were mature enough to drink and haul them to town to sell for locals to enjoy.  (A favorite refreshment or mealtime beverage for Samoans is fresh coconut water, drunk straight from the coconut.)  However, Tina has now mostly left the coconut harvesting and selling to her children.  She now spends most of time practicing the traditional Samoan art of weaving.  She hopes that with the children focusing on the coconut business and with her focusing on the weaving, they can generate enough income to make ends meet.  A loan to Tina would enable her to purchase some weaving tools and supplies to make this second business successful.

loans.use: Tools and supplies for weaving

loans.name: Abou

texts.en: Abou Traoré is 24 and single. He sells cell phone accessories. He currently lives in eastern Abidjan and has 2 years of experience in his field. Traoré has been with AE&I since 2006 and he desires a loan to satisfy his customers' demand for cell phone accessories and make more profits. He wants to develop his business and be able to take care of his family.

loans.use: Abou Traoré will use the loan to purchase a stock of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with a daughter named Karina. Vladimir and his family live in Izyum, Ukraine. He runs a business selling household items and office supplies. His business is located in a very favorable spot in downtown Izyum. Previous loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have provided the opportunity for him to open a new vending facility. To date, Vladimir has been in this trade for approximately six years.

Vladimir has now hired employees to work for him. They are all very polite, respectful and customer-friendly. This helps to produce a positive impact on his business. Moreover, clients are attracted by the individualized and personal approach Vladimir’s employees has to each customer.

Vladimir would like to obtain a loan of $1,200 USD to expand his family business. His venture has seen considerable growth since Vladimir received his first loan with “Nadiya Ukraine”. He has not only been able to increase his turnover capital and develop his business, but he was also able to generate enough profit to perform full reconstruction of his apartment.

Vladimir is hoping to see further consistent growth in his trade after utilizing this loan. Profits generated will be invested in his daughter’s college education. One day, Vladimir hopes to earn enough to buy his daughter her own apartment.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.es:
I have already one year experience selling new and used clothing. It is the source of income for my family. I would like to invest in my business and start selling other items like shoes, toys, and winter clothing. I request a loan of $1000 to buy more merchandise for this business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada tengo ya mas de un año con el negocio. Es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Me gustaría mucho invertir en el negocio y empezar a vender mas cosas como zapatos y juguetes y ropa de frió. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía para el negocio.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun S., age 40, is a farmer who earns about $1 a day cultivating her land.  Her husband has a well-digging business and earns about $3 a day.  They have four children, two who are workers in a garment factory, one who is a laborer, and one who is a student.  She is requesting a loan for $1000 to purchase new tools for her husband’s business.  These tools will allow him to work more efficiently and provide higher quality service to his customers.  They will also use this loan to fix his car, allowing him to travel further for business.  They plan to use the increased income to help fund their child’s education and reinvest in her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's well-digging business.

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en: I am Ishrat B., wife of Hadi Muhammad.  I have three children, one of my sons is in kindergarten while the others are young. My husband constructs buildings on contract. My husband requests a loan to obtain a big order and buy a few required tools. I therefore, request a loan in a group. Jameela B. requests a loan to buy a cow .Voilet B. requests a loan for the expansion of their video games club. Zeenat B. requests this loan for goats trading.

loans.use: To buy a few required tools

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is married with two children. She is 40-years-old and lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since 1993 selling beverages and other food products. Mrs. A. is also a fashion designer. Her request for a loan in the amount of $450 will be used to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional beverages and food products for resale

loans.name: Yissel's Group

texts.en:
Yissel is the coordinator of a group of five dynamic and hard-working entrepreneurs of San Cristobal.

Yissel is a single mother who has to work a lot to feed her son and support her university studies. Yissel owns and runs a beauty salon, specializing in nail-care. She offers services such as nail polish, designer nails, artificial nail removal, pedicures, and so forth. Yissel hopes that her business’s growth will help her increase her revenues and hire two or three girls to help her attend to her customers. Yissel is requesting a loan together with the other members of the group. Each entrepreneur will use her loan for her own business.

The other members are:

Altagracia Ydira B. P., Normaliza J. A. and Juana F. D. L. C. will purchase clothing in bulk in order to boost their businesses.

Miguelina A. will buy an assortment of products for a small grocery store.

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one of the members fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase of products for a small beauty parlor.  The other entrepreneurs will buy products related to their respective business.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en: Mrs. Thach S. is a 38-year-old vegetable seller in the local village, Paing L’vea, which is located in the Kampong Speu Province. She has three children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband, Oun Chhem, pictured on the right of the photo, is a pig breeder. The family spends its limited income on pig food, education (for the children), and other such expenses. She already received one loan from AMK, and with the loan proceeds she purchased pigs and built the pigs’ stall next to her house. With respect to the first loan she received from AMK, she proudly claims that her repayments were always made in a timely manner. Currently, she is seeking a loan to be able to buy more vegetables to sell in the village.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell at the local village.

loans.name: Sokha Sim Group

texts.en:
Four members in the Prey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province will be formed as one group. Mr. Sokha S. is the group leader and he is also a bicycle repairer in the village. In his business activity, he has an inadequate amount of money to buy more bike equipment.

Thus, he now is asking for a loan for this purpose. He is 28 years old and the father of three children, all of whom are too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Yon Deourn, is a housewife.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more bicycle equipment.

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu M., 26 years old, is married with two children. She has one boy and one girl, ages 7 and 4, respectively. She owns a charcoal distribution business, where she works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily. She earns $45 a month and has operated the business since 2005.

Mwajabu is the leader of the Maarifa group, consisting of five other members. She has taken out six loans from Tujijenge before and successfuly paid back all of them. With this loan she hopes to purchase a small piece of land to build a storage room, increase her inventory, and help pay her children's school fees. The other group members operate a brick distribution business and fishing and food vending businesses. These members guarantee each other in paying back their debts.

loans.use: To buy land to build a storage room, and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is the wife of S. A. and they have been living in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 30 years. She is the mother of three children, two daughters and one son. Her son is a laborer. Her two daughters make special order decorative embroidery. S. A., her husband, has a soft-drink business. Ramzana successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan for her husband’s soft-drink business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khursheed baji wants a loan for her drink corner shop. Safia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Safia baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Ayesha baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister' and signifying respect.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Lailaty

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Lailaty is a 51-year-old single woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a new entrepreneur who started a Mama Lishe, or local café, in 2007 where she serves delicious cuisine to her customers. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that actually entails. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Lailaty’s monthly profit from the café, where her children and two employees assist her, is approximately $US300. She is requesting a loan of $US275 in order to purchase more stocks of rice as well as additional chairs and tables to accommodate more customers. In the future, she hopes to further expand her café.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and seating

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Samet Roen, 48, who live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Their first daughter is a garment factory worker. Two of their children assist their mother in selling recyclable materials and two other children study in local schools. The two youngest children stay at home.

Mr. Heng and his wife have been growing rice since they were married. The couple works very hard for their living because they have a lot of children and with only farming business, they can't make their living standard get better so Heng found an additional job as a construction worker and his wife created another business selling recyclable materials.

Samet Roen and her two children buy recyclable materials from villagers for re-sale to middlemen. Currently the couple needs a pump for their farming business. Therefore, Heng is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to buy a pump for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for growing rice

loans.name: Toefuataina

texts.en: Toefuataina C., 32, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the village people and general puplic 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Toefuataina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel. Her whole family supports this business.

loans.use: Purchasing taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam On N. is a villager in Smaong Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder.

Her business is going well and she therefore wants to expand her work. She is now requesting a loan so she can buy eight more piglets and food for her current stock.

Her husband Mr. Long Chem is a construction worker and farmer.

Mrs. Sam On N. is 37 years old and the mother of four children. All of the children attend the local school.

Mr. Long Chem is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon K. has a small business that capitalizes on the huge demand for cell phones and related accessories in Tajikistan. He started selling phones four years ago and now has a small stand in a market at the bus station. He is not married yet, but despite his young age, he supports his parents. 

Azamjon’s business is very personal. Often, he will get a request for a specific phone or accessory, and he will make a special effort to find it if he does not have it in stock. At the same time, Azamjon sells SIM cards and cards to replenish of the phone account balance, which are currently in high demand among the population. 

Azamjon has requested a loan to give him extra capital to purchase inventory for his business. IMON Tajikistan is happy to be able to provide the means for Azamjon to strengthen his business and continue working toward his goals.

loans.use: To purchase SIM cards and cards to replenish the phone account balance

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es:
Gliceria es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.

Gliceria es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 1 hija, Gliceria es profesora de primaria, Gliceria se dedica a la curtiembre de cueros, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que ahora realiza con la ayuda de obreros en su domicilio, las pieles los adquiere en los camales, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima.

Gliceria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pieles.
Los sueños de Gliceria son tener una fábrica y producir zapatos.
texts.en:
Gliceria is a member of the Communal Bank called “Amaquella,” which means Don’t Be Lazy in Quechua. Gloria has a partner, is 39 years old and has 1 daughter. Gliceria is an elementary teacher. Gliceria tans hides, a profession she learned from her parents and now completes with the help of workers in her home. She acquires the skins from the slaughterhouses, and sells them in Lima. Gliceria needs a loan for 1050 soles to invest in buying hides. Gloria dreams of having a workshop and producing shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hides to tan

loans.name: Poung

texts.en: Poung T., 39, is a local palm tree climber. With the palm tree climbing, he can tap palm juice from palm trees, boil it to make palm sugar or turn it into palm wine for sale. He is currently earning an average of US$11 a day to help feed his family. His wife's name is Leap Heng, and she is is a good housewife. She cooks delicious meals for the family and is the good mother of three children; all of them are teenagers and still under her care. T. and Heng are facing difficulties with their living conditions; their house is not so good and small for them. Thus they have decided to ask for a loan to purchase wood to repair their old house.

loans.use: to purchase wood to repair their old house

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra. Maria vende productos omnilife desde hace dos años pues le ha ido bien ya que es un producto aceptable al público, comenzó con unos ahorro y dinero prestado, doña Maria tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Laureles norte, con dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad. Sus planes es poder mejorar su casa para vivir cómodos, poder dar a sus hijos estudios, y en lo personal `poder obtener el primer lugar en las ventas en su trabajo lo cual se tiene que esforzar mucho para lograr las metas. Con este crédito es la quinta solicitud que va invertir en comprar productos omnilife para ofertar a sus clientes. A corto plazo espera captar mas clientes para vender mas y sus ingresos sean favorables.
texts.en:
Maria has sold omnilife products for two years. This has gone well since this is a product that is well accepted by the public. She began with some savings and loaned money. Maria is 32 years old and lives in north Laureles with her two children who are 4 and 6 years old. Her plans are to be able to improve her house in order to live comfortably, to be able to give her children an education and, on a personal note, to be able to obtain first place in sales in her job for which she has to put forth a lot of effort to achieve the goals. This loan is the fifth one that she is going to invest in the purchase of omnilife products to offer to her customers. In the short-term, she hopes to capture more customersso she can sell more and that her earnings are favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more omnilife products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Охонов Курбон в прошлом работал председателем небольшого джамоата. Ему 66 лет, женат, воспитал 6 детей. Все его дети уже обзавелись своими семьями и кроме самого младшего сына проживают отдельно от родителей. Зарабатываемых сыном денег вполне хватает на сносную жизнь. После выхода на пенсию Курбона назначили помощником директора средней общеобразовательной школы. Недавно Курбон отремонтировал свой дом и решил обставить его мебелью. Подсчитав свои сбережения Курбон решил получить займ, так как  немного не хватило на покупку всей мебели. Для этого он обратился в МикроИнвест.
texts.en:
Kurbon O. has worked in the past as a president of a small local government organization. He is 66 years old, married and has raised six children. All of his children already have their own families and everyone besides his youngest son live separately from parents. His son's money are more than enough for a decent living. After his retirement Kurbon received a position as an assistant principle in a secondary school. Just recently Kurbon has remodeled his house and decided to furnish it. After counting his savings he decided to get a loan because he was a little bit short on money to buy all of the furniture. He has come to MicroInvest for the loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: для покупки мебели

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las Palmas" esta representado por la señora Velfi L. y ubicado barrio san Juan D. dios   donD. todas residen en el mismo barrio y se conocen entre si, existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Velfi L.  y la señora augusta, ellas son primas en primer grado, pero ambas tienen ingresos independientes. Todos los miembros del grupo tienen sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como cosméticos, comida,   pan,  tubos D. plásticos, zapatos, ropa y a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. limpieza. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe gran competencia en especial con la importación D. productos D. marca. El destino del financiamiento es para la diversificación D. sus productos para hacerle frente a la competencia y a la compra D. material y herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar sus productos. Las socias tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios por la experiencia en entidades similares a la fundación agrocapital.
texts.en:
Vilfi L. is the representative for the communal bank "Las Palmas." The bank is located in the San Juan D. Dios neighborhood, where all of the members live and know each other. There are family ties between Mrs. Velfi L. and Mrs. Augusta; they are first cousins, however they maintain independent incomes.

All of the group members have small businesses that sell things like cosmetics, food, bread, plastic tubes, shoes, clothing, as well as businesses that proviD. services like tailoring and clothes laundering. Within this commercial area there is a lot of competition, especially with importing name brand products. The purpose of these loans is to diversify their products in order to give them an advantage over the competition. Also, they will buy material and work tools to improve their products. The members have experience with solidarity groups because of their experience with organizations similar to the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Yamilex Del Socorro

texts.es: La Joven Yamilex es soltera,  trabaja como responsable de recursos humanos en la universidad URACCAN desde hace 3 años, tiene 1 hijo de 8 añitos de edad que estudia 3er grado de educacion  primaria, y a pesar que no cuenta con la ayuda del papa de su hijo a luchado para que no le falte nada, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es cambiarle las puertas a la casa y heharle el piso a una habitacion, Yamilex es una joven  con alto espiritu de superación personal, muy responsable, vive con sus padres y asume los gastos familiares, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos, su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar una maestria, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones para su hijo y sus padres.
texts.en:
Young Yamilex is single and for three years has worked in human resources at URACCAN (the University of the Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua). She has an 8-year-old son who is in third grade, and despite not being able to count on the boy's father for support, she has struggled so that her son does not want for anything.

Yamilex is requesting her seventh loan to invest in making improvements to her home, including replacing the house's doors and installing flooring in a bedroom.

Yamilex is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is very responsible, lives with her parents, and, as her family has very few financial resources, has assumed responsibility for all of the family's expenses. Her dream is to finish her Master's degree. She also wants to have stable employment, good health, and better living conditions for her son and her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace doors and install flooring in her home

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera esta en el 6to ciclo del programa D. Mujeres Emprendadoras D. Fundacion Paraguaya. Son D. la zona D. Paiñu Ñemby.  Están trabajando hace mas D. 1 año con la Fundación y son muy solidarias entre ellas.  Las mujeres realizan actividades como polladas y tallarinadas para poder a ayudar a las compañeras que estaban enfermas.  Así también para poder pagar sus cuotas por adelantado. 

Tiene un ahorro D. 1.600.000 y tienen un promedio D. crédito D. Gs. 711.764.

Las integrantes son: 

1	Luciana S..	quiniela
2	Regina A..	Venta D. comidas
3	Julia M..	Venta D. merceria.
4	Rosa Estigarribia.	Venta D. comidas.
5	Ilse I.	Venta D. merceria.
6	Visitacion D. F..	Ventas ropas.
7	Dayana P..	Venta cosmeticos, ropas.
8	Lilian S..	Venta D. ropas, 
9	Elizbeth V..	Venta D. frutas, verduras.
10	Rosa G..	Venta D. merceria.
11	Gladys Estigarribia.	Venta D. ropas.
12	Lucia D. F.	Venta D. ropas.
13	María I.	Venta D. comidas.
14	Osvalda B..	Venta D. bazar.
15	Irma M..	Venta D. merceria.
16	Mirna Z.	Venta D. comida
17	Victorina M..	Venta D. comida.
texts.en:
The "Primavera" (Spring) committee is on its sixth loan as part of the "Mujeres Emprendadoras" (Enterprising Women) program run by Fundación Paraguaya. They are from the Paiñu Ñemby area. They have worked with Fundación Paraguaya for more than one year, and their group is very united. They have different economic activities, such as making barbequed chicken or pasta to be able to help their members who are sick. This is how they are able to pay back their loans ahead of time. They have a savings of 1,600 guaranís and an average loan of 711.764 guaranís. The members of the group and their economic activities are: 1 Luciana S.. Lottery ticket sales 2 Regina A. Food sales 3 Julia M.. Sewing supplies sales 4 Rosa Estigarribia. Food sales 5 Ilse I. Sewing supplies sales 6 Visitacion D. F.. Clothing sales 7 Dayana P.. Cosmetic and clothing sales 8 Lilian S.. Clothing sales 9 Elizbeth V.. Fruit and vegetable sales 10 Rosa G.. Sewing supplies sales 11 Gladys Estigarribia. Clothing sales 12 Lucia D. F. Clothing sales 13 María I. Food sales 14 Osvalda B.. Assorted merchandise sales 15 Irma M.. Clothing supplies sales 16 Mirna Z. Food sales 17 Victorina M.. Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like bread, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, shoes, and new and used clothing

loans.name: Las Lideres Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Lideres " esta representado por la señora Piedades que tienen un parentesco familiar con su Herman la señora Mirtha, ambas tienen ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. Los miembros del grupo tienen diferentes fuentes D. ingreso entre ellos esta la venta D. ropa, zapatos, pan, vidrio y cosméticos por catalogo. Dentro del mercado la competencia crece día a día por lo que las  socias deben mejorar sus productos y sus ventas, es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder adquirir mercadería a bajo precio y materiales e insumos que mejoren sus ventas y por enD. sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida y las D. sus familias. La socias cuenta con la experiencia adquirida en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital pero es la primera vez que trabajan con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The group “Las Lideres” is represented by Señora Piedades whose sister Señora Mirtha is also part of the group. Their income is totally independent of each other. The members of the group earn their living in different ways such as selling clothes, shoes, bread, glass, and cosmetics from a catalogue. Competition in the market place increases daily so the members have to improve their products and their sales. For this reason they require financial assistance in order to be able to buy merchandise, materials, and ingredients at low prices. Increased sales and income will allow them to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The members have experience with organisations similar to Kiva partner, Agrocapital, but this will be their first loan with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kiria

texts.en:
Kiria lives within PMI Nkwen, Bamenda, in the northwest region. She is married: her husband’s name is Boba Malafa. They have six children, all under the age of 15. She intends to invest her loan in her roadside business of frying and selling puff-puff (fried dough) with beans. Specifically, she wishes to purchase one bag of beans, one bag of flour, and a tin of oil. She will also apply part of the loan toward her farming endeavors.

Kiria first heard about GHAPE in 2004, and this will be her fourth loan. She has repaid her previous loans satisfactorily. This loan will help her improve on her puff-puff business because she will have enough capital to expand on her business. She is convinced that her business will succeed because of her considerable experience in this work. Her business helps her community because she provides affordable food for people.

Kiria feels that her loans through GHAPE have benefited her because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, and because GHAPE provides training as well as proper follow-up after the loan is disbursed to ensure that the loan is properly managed.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her roadside puff-puff business, and to apply toward her farming work

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra E. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Abra exerce ce commerce depuis 4 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son magasin.
texts.en:
Abra E. is 33-years-old, married and the mother of 2 children. She owns a general store in Wome. Abra has run this business for 4 years and hopes to increase her stock with this loan.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: El Grupo “San Antonio” se encuentra representado por la señora Julia y conformada por 12 miembros  que cursan ya su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. En general los socios se dedican a actividades de índole comercial como la venta de comida, cosméticos, lubricantes, ropa y al servicio de limpieza. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. Las socias cuentan con experiencia crediticia ya que algunas ya trabajaron en nuestra institución y van cursando su segundo ciclo y los miembros nuevos conocen la modalidad del crédito solidario.
texts.en:
The “San Antonio” group is represented by Julia and it is composed of 12 members who are in their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in their payments. In general, the members work in types of business such as selling food, cosmetics, lubricants, clothing, and cleaning services. There is a lot of competition, but the members of the group know how to get ahead because of their experience and their desire to work. The loan will be used to purchase materials, ingredients, and tools that will help them to generate greater income, since their families depend on that income. The members have experience with credit because some of them have already worked with our institution and they are in their second loan cycle and the new members are familiar with the group loan model.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is a 33-year-old married man. He has been working as an electrician in the sanitary sector since 2003 and has 15 years of previous experience in the field. Today, Farid is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy an electric compressor for his work in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy an electric compressor.

loans.name: Holda

texts.en:
Holda is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Holda started her own clothing business,selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit 30,000 Tanzania shillings.
 
This is Holda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Fabric clothes(kanga,vitenge).

 With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Holda hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge,kanga

loans.name: Kham

texts.en:
Kham P., 41, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. As an extra profit, her husband works in construction.

Kham P. is a good mother who has given birth to six children. Four of her children are single and under her care, while the other two are married and live separately.

Kham P. is applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike which she will use to reduce the cost of her family's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for family transportation

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Mercedes es originario de Guanacastillo, comarca perteneciente a Nindiri.  Al centro María M. coordinadora del grupo, quien a sus 43 años de edad se mantiene jovial y  enérgica.

María posee una mini pulpería que ha logrado gracias a los créditos en ADIM y al esfuerzo que ha hecho por acrecentar su negocio. Inició vendiendo Hielo, helados y refrescos naturales. Actualmente ya posee un frízer donde mantiene leche, pollo, carne, jugos enlatados, Coca-Colas y vende todo tipo de golosinas.

Su crédito lo quiere para la compra de granos básico para surtir más su negocio y lograr tener una Pulpería amplia. Agradece a ADIM ya que a través de todos los financiamientos que se le han dado es que logró iniciar su negocio. Tiene tres años de haber iniciado créditos con la institución y tres de haber puesto su mini-pulpería. Como grupo no han tenido dificultad puesto que son muy honestas y puntuales en sus créditos.

Salis vende ropa nueva y ropa de segunda en su casa de habitación y Marcelina G. elabora y vende tortillas en el municipio.

loans.use: compra de granos básicos

loans.name: Benida

texts.en:
Benida is 51 years old, married and living in the village of Addalam Jones, Isabela. They have three children and all of them are already working. Benida would like to buy additional merchandise and expand her store in order for her to improve their way of living. Her husband is in full support in her business though her husband is busy managing their rice fields.

Benida is managing a sari-sari store within their village.According to her she would like to expand her store that’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 that she can use to purchase additional groceries to her store. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted for her business to become profitable for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business improvement

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
At 52 years old, Amelia is already a widow. She has four children who are all married. At present she is living at Barangay Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela, together with her daughter and grandchildren.

Amelia has been engaged in fruit and vegetable vending in their small village for almost twenty-eight years. Her weekly net income is Php 2,000 which she utilizes for their daily needs, especially for their daily food.

Wanting to buy additional vegetables and fruit for her vending business Amelia wants to apply for a loan of Php 14,000 from Kiva lenders for the additional requirements of her business. She wants to support her family in their daily needs, especially the financial aspect, so that they will have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rec Jui Lower Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone to seek a loan of 6,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for a number of reasons. As teachers’ salaries are usually small, SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone loans are very useful in helping them supplement their salaries.

This will be the first loan these teachers are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone and Kiva. Like most teachers in Sierra Leone, the members of this group rarely have extra income with which they can buy or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time.

Some of them will use their loan to begin or continue building a house, others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use it to invest in businesses in order to supplement their monthly salaries and still others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture and household goods.

The leader of this group of teachers is Samuel A. T.. He is a senior teacher at the school and has been in the teaching profession for thirty-one years now. Samuel is about forty-five years old and married with four children and one foster child. Two of his children are in Junior Secondary School II, the others are not of school going age, and his foster child is in primary school II.

Samuel will use this loan to buy house-building materials like rods and bags of cement, as well as furniture like chairs and a video set.

loans.use: To buy house-building materials, furniture and a video set

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long B., 39, is married and lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for US$2 each day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver making US$2.50 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Long B. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a water pump and pipe.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and pipe.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S., age 61, is a local farmer who lives alone in her small wooden house located in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells porridge for breakfast to her nearby neighbors in the village. She was married, but her husband died of senility. She has two daughters who are working in Thailand. Kim S. hopes to earn additional income by using a Kiva loan to buy piglets to raise at her home.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise at her home

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge Murilo J. tiene 28 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Platanares con su familia de 7 miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de de cerdos para engorde y venderlos en comercios cercanos. El trabaja con su familia mas que todo en ganadería y cerdos.  Es la cuarto vez don Jorge se financia con FUDECOSUR, obteniendo montos de 200000 hasta 2000000 colones. Estos prestamos le han ayudado a trabajar, prestando capital, con un tasa interes bajo.  El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera tener un beneficio economico para la familia y salir adelante. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge Murilo Jiménez is 28, single, and does not have children. He lives in Platanares with his family; there are seven members. He wants a loan to buy pigs to fatten and sell to nearby businesses. He works with his family, mostly with livestock and pigs. This is Jorge’s fourth loan with FUDECOSUR. He has received amounts from 200,000 to 2,000,000 colones. These loans, made with low interest, have helped him to work. He has not had other loans with formal banks. He expects to have an economic benefit for his family and to get ahead. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Mirla Anali

texts.es:
Mirla tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Tongorrape del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año ha instalado en su vivienda una pequeña bodega con la que ayuda a solventar la economía de su hogar. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad así como abarrotes y golosinas. Su esposo trabaja como profesor en un colegio de la zona y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos.

Mirla desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos profesionales de éxito. Ella es una madre responsable y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirla is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the Tongorrape district of Motupe, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For one year, she has had a small store in her home, which helps with her household finances. She offers various products to her neighbors such as groceries and candies. Her husband works as a teacher in the local school, and together they are getting ahead with their family.

Mirla wants to expand her business by purchasing more products, but does not have sufficient capital to do so. Thus, she has seen the need to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Nuevos Soles.

Her greatest wish is to see her children succeed. She is a responsible mother and very devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchae basic products for her store

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina N. is from the village of Centro 2 in Mallig, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Victorina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Victorina owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Victorina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Victorina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Victorina is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Victorina's 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Togoosuren

texts.en:
Togoosuren is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rented plot of land with a yard. Togoosuren pays 20,000 tugrugs (about $14 US) per month in rent. She and her family have been living in their current home for five years. 

Togoosuren started her scarf weaving and cashmere/camel wool/yak hair sweater business at her home in 2004.  Originally, she would weave by hand, but she has been using two weaving machines for the business recently. Because of her hard work and determination, she was able to pay for her children's education fees and was able to support her two daughters in homes of their own.  

Generally, she spends the profits from her business on her household and her children's educational fees.  Togoosuren has many orders from her customers because she produces high quality and fashionable products.  She is a decent, open, helpful and very hardworking person. She says, “I'm working hard to give a high quality education to my two children, and to help my children become good people with good morals.” She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan.

loans.use: To purchase more wool

loans.name: Maria Adali

texts.es:
Doña María Adali E. R. tiene un terreno donde ella se dedica a la actividad de trabajo agrícola y ganadera como pequeña productora, el financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de 4 toretes para desarrollarlos y una vez estos tengan un mayor peso venderlos a mejor precio. Ella quiere comprar estos toretes para tener otra actividad de trabajo que le genere otros ingresos ya que ella se dedicaba únicamente a la siembra de granos básicos (cultivo de Frijol y Maíz), en épocas de invierno. Esta forma de trabajo lo inicio con esfuerzo propio ella trabajaba en una finca y las personas dueñas de esta propiedad le permitieron que ella utilizara 4 manzanas áreas de la propiedad para que sembrara granos básicos como frijol y maíz y con la venta de la cosecha de estos granos ella tuviera más ingresos, de esta forma estas personas dueñas de la propiedad le ayudaron, ella ahora para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a esta otra actividad de trabajo comprando y vendiendo ganado, la expectativa que ella tiene con este tipo de negocio comprando y vendiendo ganado, ella espera aumentar su operatividad de trabajo teniendo otra alternativa y otra forma de ingresos ya que antes ella solo tenía  ingresos en épocas de cosecha y ahora tiene mayor operatividad y más trabajo en todo el año.
Doña María Adali E. es casada y tiene 3 hijos estos niños estudian la primaria en una escuela cerca de la comunidad donde ella vive. Doña María Adali tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel desde el año 2006 y se le han otorgado 5 créditos para apoyarla en esta actividad de trabajo. Cuando se le comenzó a dar financiamientos a doña María ella tenía únicamente 3 vacas y ahora con este apoyo que se le dado en estos 4 años ha venido mejorando y aumentando su unidad productiva ósea ella ahora tiene 9 vacas paridas y 5 toretes, el beneficio que ella ha tenido ha sido notable esto le permite tener una mejor forma de trabajo y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. María Adali E. R. has a plot of land where she does farm work and raises cattle. She will use the financing to purchase 4 young bulls to raise. Once they have more weight, she will sell them at a higher price. She wants to buy these bulls to have another work activity that generates income. She used to work by only growing basic grains (bean and corn crops) during the winter. She started this type of work on her own initiative. She used to work on a farm and the owners of the property allowed her to use an area of four blocks on the property to plant basic grains such as beans and corn. With the sale of the crop, she had more income. In this way, the owners of the property helped her. Now, in order to improve her income, she works at the other activity buying and selling cattle. The expectation she has with buying and selling cattle is to grow her operations and have another type of income. Before, she only had income during harvest time and now she has more operations and more work all year. . Ms. María Adali E. is married and has 3 children. The children are in primary school in a school in the community where she lives. Ms. María Adali has been working with Ceprodel for four years, since 2006. They have given her 5 loans to support her in this work activity. When they started giving financing to María she only had 3 cows. Now, with the support they have given her these last four years, she has improved and increased her production. Now she has 9 calved cows and 5 young bulls. The benefit to her has been notable. It has allowed her to have better work and a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 4 young bulls to raise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en el sector Tres Puentes, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, situado a una hora y cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace aun año tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en la que ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio nació de la necesidad de obtener un ingreso adicional que les permitiera a ella ya a su familia salir adelante, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como peón agrícola no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El establecimiento goza de buena acogida ya que la zona se encuentra retirada del mercado mas cercano y sus vecinos no pueden movilizarse todos los dias para adquirir productos de consumo diario. Teresa trata de brindarles productos de calidad y un buen trato para que el negocio crezca y se desarrolle favorablemente. 

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes para aumentar sus ventas y captar mas ingresos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Teresa es una mujer alegre que disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior que les depare un futuro prometedor. Esta es la segunda vez que ella trabaja con Nuestra Institucion y ha demsotrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and her three dependent children in the Tres Puentes area, a rural area in the district of Pítipo, located an hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. A year ago, Teresa set up a small store in her home, where she offers her neighbors all sorts of basic products and groceries. She started this business because she needed the extra income in order for her family to stay afloat, because her husband's income as a farmhand was not enough to cover the household expenses. Her shop enjoys a good business because the area where she lives is far from the closest market and her neighbors can't travel there every day to get the basic goods they need. Teresa tries to offer them high-quality products and good service so that her business will grow and develop well. Teresa would like to expand her store by buying more groceries, which would increase her sales and bring in more income. For this reason she is asking Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner] for a loan of 1200 Peruvian Soles to help her reach her goal. Teresa is a happy woman who very much enjoys her work. Her greatest desire is to give her children the opportunity to study towards an advanced degree that will offer them a better future. This is the second time that she has worked with the field partner and she has shown herself to be responsible and on time with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to expand her store.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Enrique V. tiene 37 años de edad, es padre de un niño de tres años y esta casado con Maria
Eucebia Padilla. Santos es maestro de educacion en el centro basico San Juan Bosco de la aldea Agua Caliente de Linaca desde hace 8 años, Santos termino de hacer su casa y hoy esta solicitando un credito el cual lo utilizara para poder hacer un patio techado ya que por las tardes el sol le da dentro de su casa y como es una zona de clima caliente hace mucha calor dentro de la casa.
Santos se acaba de graduar de Licenciado en Pedagogia y con ello mejoraran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos Enrique V. is 37 years old. He is married to Maria, and he has a three year old son. Santos has been a teacher at the San Juan Bosco basic center in the village of Agua Caliente de Linaca for eight years. Santos finished building his house, and he is now requesting a loan to be able to build a covered patio. In the afternoons the sun shines in his house. As it is a hot climate, it gets very hot inside the house. Santos just graduated with a degree in pedagogy, which will improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma B. trades in palm oil and gari (ginger product). She is hardworking and dedicated to her business, and her store is located along the main Market Road.  She started in fish trading and later switched to her present business (palm oil and gari). She has 10 years of experience in business. She is married to a Field Officer and they have 2 children. She needs the loan to buy palm oil and gari from neighbouring villages and hopes to use the proceeds to educate her kids and build a house.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and gari to sell.

loans.name: Mary Asunkwain

texts.en:
Born in 1977, Mary is married to a very supportive husband. They are blessed with four children. They have had some challenges because of a rural exodus for greener pastures from the urban city of Bamenda. Farmlands are scare or far from their residence in Nkwen, a quarter of Bamenda, Cameroon. This means that they trek very long distances to farm. Her desire to give her children love and the best education motivated her to become a GHAPE member in 2007.  Her past loan investments are still yielding good dividends. She plans to invest this loan in the purchase of beans, palm oil, groundnuts and yams. Mary plans to actively involve her entire family in implementing this phase of her business.

With the profit from this loan, Mary plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medication.  She knows very well that she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the lengthy repayment period. Moreover, last year Anna was able to make savings through which she acquired a piece of farmland.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To purchase beans, palm oil, groundnuts and yams

loans.name: Bokk Jom-Medina Sorar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BOKK-JOM de Médina Sorar est créé, il y a six mois en même temps que l'inauguration du Banc Villageois "MEDINA SORAR" en 2009. il est composé de 11 membres issus tous du même quartier que porte le nom du Banc Villageois. C'est un groupe très soudé et solidaire, qui tien régulièrement des rencontres de concertation et d'échange pour la bonne marche de leurs activités de commerce. C'est un groupe homogène, elles sont toutes mariées et mère d'au moins de 3 enfants. Se sont des femmes très dégourdies en matière de commerce, elles diversifient leurs activités commerciales, certaines vendent de l'encens, d'autres des produits halieutiques ou cosmétiques et/ou tissus.

la présidente, Madame Fatou T., à l'extrême droit de la photo, en tenue tapissés de carreaux rouges, gris et jaunes est âgée de 45 ans. C'est une femme très dynamique, qui cultive un bon esprit de solidarité et d'entraide dans le groupe. Elle est pleine de rigueur et de volonté et ne ménage pas d'effort pour la bonne marche du groupe et la réussite de ses entreprises. Elle fait du commerce d'effets vestimentaires et de produits cosmétiques. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal pour revendre à crédit dans son quartier. Les recouvrements elle les fait périodiquement à la fin de chaque mois. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale par la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.

Bien vrai que le groupe n'a que 6 mois d'existence dans le système de l'institution de micro finance CAURIE-MF, mais ses membres menaient des activités de petit depuis plus de 5 ans. Ce qui leur a doté d'une bonne expérience en matière commerciale et à fait que leur premier remboursement a été effectué sans faille, et leur niveau d'épargne assez bon.
texts.en:
The BOKK-JOM group of Médina Sorar was created six months ago in 2009, at the same time the MEDINA SORAR « Banc Villageois » loan group was inaugurated. The group consists of 11 members, all from the same neighbourhood, from which the Banc Villageois took its name. It is a very closely knit and supportive group, which regularly holds consultation and exchange meetings to ensure the good functioning of their businesses. It is a homogeneous group of married women, mothers of at least three children. They are very resourceful in commercial matters, diversifying their activities: some sell incense, others seafood products, beauty products, or clothing fabrics. The president, Mrs Fatou T., seen at the far right in the picture, wearing a red, gray and yellow square-patterned ensemble, is 45 years old. She is a very dynamic woman, who nurtures a spirit of solidarity and mutual aid within the group. She is quite strict and strong-willed and doesn’t spare any efforts to maintain the good functioning of the group and the success of their business activities. She retails clothing apparel and beauty products. She gets her supplies from Dakar, the capital of Senegal, for resale on credit in her neighbourhood. She recovers her loan payments at the end of each month. Her objective is to support her husband with their children’s nourishment and education. Although the group only existed six months within the CAURIE-MF MFI, their members had prior experience with credit loans over the past five years. This has given them a solid commercial sense, ensuring that their first loan was reimbursed without problems, and also sustaining a good level of savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the group's self-financing capacity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy something for his home (kitchen)

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva M. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 47 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $220 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children. They live in the city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. A very talented lady, Parveen is involved in a domestic-sewing business while her husband, M. akram, is a driver. To help support them financially, their elder son runs an electric supplies shop. Their younger son is in 9th standard and their daughter is in 12th standard. 

The elder son, M. A., stayed in school until 10th standard and then started working. He has been in this business for the last 6 years. Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son, who will use the loan amount to buy electrical supplies such as wires, tube lights and switches in bulk and enhance his business.

loans.use: Purchase electrical supplies

loans.name: Balabawi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle a 47 ans. Pour contribuer aux charges de sa famille nombreuse, elle commercialise  des produits d’alimentation générale et des céréales.
L’activité se déroule dans sa maison où elle met à la disposition des habitants du quartier ses différents produits. 
Le crédit demandé est destiné à réapprovisionner sa boutique pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle avec 5 sacs de riz GINO, 3 bidons d'huile NIOTO, 2 cartons de boîtes de conserve de tomates, 3 cartons de détergents et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of seven children. She is 47. In order to be able to help support her numerous family, she sells foodstuffs and cereals. She sells these goods in front of her house where she displays her wares to the people of her neighborhood. The requested loan is destined to allow her to add to the inventory of her shop, so as to satisfy the needs of her clientele, by buying 5 sacks of Gino rice, three tins of Nioto oil, two cases of tins of tomatoes, three cases of detergent, and various other products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for her inventory

loans.name: Amigas De Villa Victoria Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal de “Amigas de Villa Victoria” se conformó para ingresar al Centro Focal de Santiago II, este nuevo grupo consta de ocho integrantes, 7 mujeres y 1 varón, a la cabeza la señora Doris  como presidenta.

La  señora Doris refiere que es su primera experiencia en nuestra institución, su hermano fue quien le invitó a formar parte de la asociación.  El negocio que lleva adelante requiere de paciencia y tiempo, pues se trata de una tienda de barrio.  Una gran ventaja es que su tienda está en el mismo domicilio y su hija le ayuda en la venta. El crédito que solicitó tiene como objetivo la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio.  Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la capacitación y el consultorio de salud.

La A.C. “Amigas de Villa Victoria” cuenta con ocho integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: venta de lencería, tejido de mantas, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas y trenzado, venta de carne, costura de mochilas, trabajo con minibús.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amigas de Villa Victoria” was formed in connection with the Santiago II Regional Office. This new group has eight members, 7 women and 1 man, headed by Doris as president. Doris comments that it this is her first experience with our institution. Her brother was the one who invited her to become part of the association. The business she runs requires patience and time, because it is a neighborhood store. One great advantage is that the store is in her own home, and her daughter helps her with sales. She requested a loan with the objective of buying merchandise to stock her store. What she likes most about Pro Mujer is the training and the health clinic. The “Amigas de Villa Victoria” communal bank has eight members who also have their own businesses. These include lingerie sales, blanket weaving, fruit sales, braiding and blanket weaving, meat sales, backpack making, and minibus service.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for a neighborhood store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 46 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos a quienes los adora. Hace muchos años atrás se dedicaba en la venta de productos comestibles y a falta de variedad en productos fue perdiendo clientes. Desde entonces hace 2 años, se dedica en la preparación y venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas (papas y pollo frito), en la puerta de su casa. Sus clientes son sus vecinos que gustan de su sazón, casi siempre suelen comprarle muy seguido a su establecimiento, ya que los precios que ofrece son muy asequibles.
